title: namespace being stripped off elements when fragment parent is present
description:
from this case: https://help.marklogic.com/staff/Tickets/Ticket/View/12111

1) Configure the following fragment parent on the database:



namespace: http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/xmlschema/workfolderitem/2

localname: content



2) Load file using xdmp:document-load():



xquery version "1.0-ml";

xdmp:document-load("/Users/pkim/Documents/projects/lexis/replication/xmldocs/prod.xml",

<options xmlns="xdmp:document-load">

<uri>/documents/prod.xml</uri>

<repair>none</repair>

<permissions>{xdmp:default-permissions()}</permissions>

</options>)



3) Examine document in Query Console. Notice that the child element of wfiml:content (wfiml:doc) is missing its namespace prefix.

	    <casesum:editorialsummary VStype="GROUP" VSalign="L" VSseparation="2NL" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">
	      <hdr inline="N" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y" format="BANNER">Case Summary</hdr>
	      <casesum:posture VSalign="L" xml:id="_clspp" VSseparation="NL">
		<hdr inline="N" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y">Procedural Posture</hdr>
		<p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		  <ref:anchor id="clspara_1" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		  <text>Defendant appealed a judgment from the Circuit Court for Milwaukee County (Wisconsin), which convicted him of carrying a concealed weapon in violation of <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4H40000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. 941.23"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360090000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> (1999-2000). The case came before the court on bypass from the Court of Appeals. Defendant asked the court to determine the effect of a new constitutional amendment, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4H50000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:constitution>
			<lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			</lnci:constref>
		      </lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600B0000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite>, on the State's ability to prosecute the carrying of concealed weapons.</text>
		</p>
	      </casesum:posture>
	      <casesum:overview VSalign="L" xml:id="_clsov" VSseparation="2NL">
		<hdr inline="N" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y">Overview</hdr>
		<p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		  <ref:anchor id="clspara_3" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		  <text>Defendant owned a grocery store that had been robbed several times. Officers entered the store to conduct a license check and asked defendant if he kept a gun in the store. Defendant removed a gun from the front pocket of his pants. Following his conviction for carrying a concealed weapon (CWW), defendant argued that his conviction impaired his constitutional rights under <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4H60000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:constitution>
			<lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			</lnci:constref>
		      </lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600C0000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite>. The court agreed. Strict application of the CWW statute disallowed the reasonable exercise of defendant's constitutional right to keep and bear arms for the lawful purpose of security. Defendant's interests in maintaining a concealed weapon in his store substantially outweighed the State's interest in enforcing the CWW statute. Moreover, defendant had no reasonable means of keeping the weapon in his store except to conceal it. Defendant's conviction was not proper because he was not allowed to raise as a defense his right to keep and bear arms for security; that right, when exercised within one's own business and supported by a factual determination that one did not have an unlawful purpose, would usually provide a constitutional defense to the charge of violating the CWW statute.</text>
		</p>
	      </casesum:overview>
	      <casesum:outcome VSalign="L" xml:id="_clsoc" VSseparation="2NL">
		<hdr inline="N" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y">Outcome</hdr>
		<p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		  <ref:anchor id="clspara_4" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		  <text>The court reversed the judgment and remanded with directions that the case should be dismissed unless the State could show probable cause that defendant had an unlawful purpose when he was carrying the concealed weapon.</text>
		</p>
	      </casesum:outcome>
	    </casesum:editorialsummary>

			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text><lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4H80000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>
			  </lnci:constitution>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600G0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> declares that the people have the right to keep and bear arms for lawful purposes. While <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4H90000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			    </lnci:statref>
			  </lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600H0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> (1999-2000), which bans carrying a concealed weapon (CWW), withstands a facial challenge to its constitutionality under <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HB0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>
			  </lnci:constitution>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600J0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>, there are circumstances in which a strict application of the CCW statute may result in an unreasonable limitation of the constitutional right.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>
			  <skos:scopeNote>covers the prosecution's proof in a criminal proceeding, including the duty to prove the corpus delicti of the criminal offense, the essential elements of a crime beyond a reasonable doubt, and that the defendant committed the crime. Also covers the prosecutor's burden to overcome the defendant's presumption of innocence.</skos:scopeNote>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_4" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>To convict a person of carrying a concealed weapon in violation of <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HD0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			    </lnci:statref>
			  </lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3601C0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> (1999-2000), the State must prove three elements. First, the State must show that a person who is not a peace officer went armed with a dangerous weapon. Second, the State must show that the defendant was aware of the presence of the weapon. Third, the State must show that the weapon was concealed.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

			  <lncr:alphagrouping xmlns:lncr="http://www.lexis-nexis.com/lncr">N</lncr:alphagrouping>
			  <skos:prefLabel>Necessity</skos:prefLabel>
			  <skos:broader rdf:resource="urn:topic:E4894F71279C4A67A5411A5DD9B86680">Defenses</skos:broader>
			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>
			  <skos:scopeNote>covers the defense wherein an accused chooses the lesser of evils, acts to prevent imminent harm, or has no other legal alternative to violating the letter of the law.</skos:scopeNote>
			  <ln:taxonomynodeproperty name="Status" value="Active" xmlns:ln="http://krm.lexisnexis.com/ln/"/>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_5" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text> <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HF0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 939.45" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:statref normcite="_939.45(1)()">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			    </lnci:statref>
			  </lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W2YJ-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000939#    45#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_1"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 939.45"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3602S0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Stat. � 939.45(1)</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> (1999-2000) permits a defendant charged with a crime a defense of privilege when the actor's conduct occurs under circumstances of necessity so as to be privileged under <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HG0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 939.47" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:statref normcite="_939.47()">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			    </lnci:statref>
			  </lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W2YM-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000939#    47#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 939.47"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3602T0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Stat. � 939.47</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> (1999-2000). However, the defense of necessity, by its plain language, exists only when a defendant acts in response to "natural physical forces," not human forces that pose potential dangers. The existence of random, albeit frequent, criminal conduct in one's vicinity does not qualify as a "natural physical force" under the law.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

			  <lncr:alphagrouping xmlns:lncr="http://www.lexis-nexis.com/lncr">P</lncr:alphagrouping>
			  <skos:prefLabel>Police Powers</skos:prefLabel>
			  <skos:broader rdf:resource="urn:topic:27DB189BC34143D0B4E25AAB32D610E0">Governments</skos:broader>
			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>
			  <skos:scopeNote>covers the nature and scope of state police power, including the use of police power to suppress or prevent crime and nuisance; the permissible uses of such power and limitations upon the exercise of such power; and the exercise of such power to preserve and protect public health, safety, morals, and welfare.</skos:scopeNote>
			  <ln:taxonomynodeproperty name="Status" value="Active" xmlns:ln="http://krm.lexisnexis.com/ln/"/>
			</skos:Concept>
	</rdf:RDF>
		    </classify:classitem>
		  </classify:classification>
		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_6" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>In <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			  <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			  <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:skos="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">
		
	</rdf:RDF>
			</globalentity:entity>, constitutional rights do not expand the police power; they restrict the police power. Thus, courts may limit the broad application of the carrying a concealed weapon statute, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HH0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			    </lnci:statref>
			  </lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360460000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> (1999-2000), in those circumstances where limitation is necessary to narrowly accommodate the constitutional right to keep and bear arms for lawful purposes.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

			  <lncr:alphagrouping xmlns:lncr="http://www.lexis-nexis.com/lncr">P</lncr:alphagrouping>
			  <skos:prefLabel>Police Powers</skos:prefLabel>
			  <skos:broader rdf:resource="urn:topic:27DB189BC34143D0B4E25AAB32D610E0">Governments</skos:broader>
			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>
			  <skos:scopeNote>covers the nature and scope of state police power, including the use of police power to suppress or prevent crime and nuisance; the permissible uses of such power and limitations upon the exercise of such power; and the exercise of such power to preserve and protect public health, safety, morals, and welfare.</skos:scopeNote>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_7" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text><lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HJ0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>
			  </lnci:constitution>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3604V0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> does not establish an unfettered right to bear arms. The State retains the power to impose reasonable regulations on weapons, including a general prohibition on the carrying of concealed weapons. However, the State may not apply these regulations in situations that functionally disallow the exercise of the rights conferred under <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HK0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>
			  </lnci:constitution>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3604W0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>. The State must be especially vigilant in circumstances where a person's need to exercise the right is the most pronounced. If the State applies reasonable laws in circumstances that unreasonably impair the right to keep and bear arms, the State's police power must yield in those circumstances to the exercise of the right. The prohibition of conduct that is indispensable to the right to keep (possess) or bear (carry) arms for lawful purposes will not be sustained.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

			  <lncr:alphagrouping xmlns:lncr="http://www.lexis-nexis.com/lncr">P</lncr:alphagrouping>
			  <skos:prefLabel>Police Powers</skos:prefLabel>
			  <skos:broader rdf:resource="urn:topic:27DB189BC34143D0B4E25AAB32D610E0">Governments</skos:broader>
			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>
			  <skos:scopeNote>covers the nature and scope of state police power, including the use of police power to suppress or prevent crime and nuisance; the permissible uses of such power and limitations upon the exercise of such power; and the exercise of such power to preserve and protect public health, safety, morals, and welfare.</skos:scopeNote>
			  <ln:taxonomynodeproperty name="Status" value="Active" xmlns:ln="http://krm.lexisnexis.com/ln/"/>
			</skos:Concept>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_8" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>When an exercise of the State's police power implicates the constitutional right to keep and bear arms, the validity of the exercise is measured by the reasonableness of the restriction on the asserted right. This same analytical approach guides judicial determination of whether a particular application of an otherwise reasonable restriction on the right to bear arms is still constitutionally valid. In analyzing reasonableness, one must balance the conflicting rights of an individual to keep and bear arms for lawful purposes against the authority of the State to exercise its police power to protect the health, safety, and welfare of its citizens. A balance must be struck between the individual's right to exercise each constitutional guarantee and society's right to enact laws that will ensure some semblance of order. As these interests will necessarily conflict, the question then becomes which party should accept the encroachment of its right. The solution to the conflict is judicial in nature. Courts must be and are, whether willingly or not, the ultimate arbiters as to whether or not there is, in a particular case, an unwarranted invasion of constitutionally guaranteed rights.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>

			  <lncr:alphagrouping xmlns:lncr="http://www.lexis-nexis.com/lncr">P</lncr:alphagrouping>
			  <skos:prefLabel>Police Powers</skos:prefLabel>
			  <skos:broader rdf:resource="urn:topic:27DB189BC34143D0B4E25AAB32D610E0">Governments</skos:broader>
			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>
			  <skos:scopeNote>covers the nature and scope of state police power, including the use of police power to suppress or prevent crime and nuisance; the permissible uses of such power and limitations upon the exercise of such power; and the exercise of such power to preserve and protect public health, safety, morals, and welfare.</skos:scopeNote>
			  <ln:taxonomynodeproperty name="Status" value="Active" xmlns:ln="http://krm.lexisnexis.com/ln/"/>
			</skos:Concept>
	</rdf:RDF>

		  </classify:classification>
		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_9" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>Under its broad police power, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			  <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			  <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:skos="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">
		
	</rdf:RDF>
			</globalentity:entity> may regulate firearms. It may regulate the time, place, and manner in which firearms are possessed and used. The concealed weapons statute is a restriction on the manner in which firearms are possessed and used. It is constitutional. Only if the public benefit in this exercise of the police power is substantially outweighed by an individual's need to conceal a weapon in the exercise of the right to bear arms will an otherwise valid restriction on that right be unconstitutional as applied.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_10" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>The criminality of gun possession is mitigated in the two places where an otherwise law-abiding person is likely to spend most of his time and to deserve the greatest expectation of personal security: his home and his workplace. The purposes of a concealed carry prohibition are often less compelling in settings in which the person bearing the concealed weapon is an owner of the property on which he or she goes armed. Although the considerations discussed above are not determinative of the reasonableness of prohibiting a shopkeeper from carrying a concealed weapon, they weigh against the need for applying the carrying a concealed weapon (CCW) statute, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HM0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			    </lnci:statref>
			  </lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360700000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> (1999-2000), in such circumstances if the shopkeeper had a substantial interest in exercising a right under <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HN0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>
			  </lnci:constitution>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360710000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>. Strict application of the CCW statute in instances when the public interest in enforcing the statute is weak may unreasonably impair a person's right to keep and bear arms when the person's interest in exercising that right through the use of a concealed weapon is substantial. The primary concern of the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			  <globalentity:content>Wisconsin Supreme Court</globalentity:content>
			  <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:skos="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">
		
	</rdf:RDF>
			</globalentity:entity> is examining the CCW prohibition in a circumstance in which the bearing of arms for the purpose of security is the most reasonable and the most necessary.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>
		<casesum:headnote VSalign="L" headnotesource="lexis-caselaw-editorial" VSmultiseparation="2NL" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_11" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>The importance of being able to exercise the right to bear arms in the setting of one's own property is implied by the language of <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HP0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_12" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>A court examines three sources in determining a constitutional provision's meaning: the plain meaning of the words in the context used; the constitutional debates and the practices in existence at the time of the writing of the constitution; and the earliest interpretation of the provision by the legislature as manifested in the first law passed following adoption.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>

		    </classify:classitem>
		  </classify:classification>
		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_13" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>The common understanding of "security" does not implicate an imminent threat. Rather, it connotes a persistent state of peace. The domain most closely associated with a persistent state of peace is one's home or residence, followed by other places in which a person has a possessory interest. A person is less likely to rely on public law enforcement for protection in these premises and is more likely to supply his own protection. In fact, a person who takes no initiative to provide security in these private places is essentially leaving security to chance. Firearms ownership has long been permitted in <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			  <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			  <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:skos="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">
		
	</rdf:RDF>
			</globalentity:entity>. The inclusion in <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HR0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>
			  </lnci:constitution>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607Y0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>of the right to bear arms for security was intended to include a personal right to bear arms to protect one's person, family, or property against unlawful injury and to secure from unlawful interruption the enjoyment of life, limb, family, and property, subject to reasonable regulation.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

			  <lncr:alphagrouping xmlns:lncr="http://www.lexis-nexis.com/lncr">P</lncr:alphagrouping>
			  <skos:prefLabel>Police Powers</skos:prefLabel>
			  <skos:broader rdf:resource="urn:topic:27DB189BC34143D0B4E25AAB32D610E0">Governments</skos:broader>
			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>
			  <skos:scopeNote>covers the nature and scope of state police power, including the use of police power to suppress or prevent crime and nuisance; the permissible uses of such power and limitations upon the exercise of such power; and the exercise of such power to preserve and protect public health, safety, morals, and welfare.</skos:scopeNote>
			  <ln:taxonomynodeproperty name="Status" value="Active" xmlns:ln="http://krm.lexisnexis.com/ln/"/>
			</skos:Concept>
	</rdf:RDF>
		    </classify:classitem>
		  </classify:classification>
		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_14" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>A citizen's desire to exercise the right to keep and bear arms for purposes of security is at its apex when undertaken to secure one's home or privately owned business. Conversely, the State's interest in prohibiting concealed weapons is least compelling in these circumstances because application of the carrying a concealed weapon statute, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HS0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			    </lnci:statref>
			  </lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360800000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> (1999-2000), has but a tenuous relation to alleviation of the State's acknowledged interests. If the restriction of a private right is oppressive, while the public welfare is enhanced only to a slight degree, the offending statute is void as an invalid exercise of the police power.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

			  <skos:broader rdf:resource="urn:topic:27DB189BC34143D0B4E25AAB32D610E0">Governments</skos:broader>
			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>
			  <skos:scopeNote>covers the nature and scope of state police power, including the use of police power to suppress or prevent crime and nuisance; the permissible uses of such power and limitations upon the exercise of such power; and the exercise of such power to preserve and protect public health, safety, morals, and welfare.</skos:scopeNote>
			  <ln:taxonomynodeproperty name="Status" value="Active" xmlns:ln="http://krm.lexisnexis.com/ln/"/>
			</skos:Concept>
	</rdf:RDF>
		    </classify:classitem>
		  </classify:classification>
		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_15" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>Applying intermediate scrutiny to an "as applied" constitutional challenge, the test for whether statutes or ordinances that restrict a fundamental right are constitutional is whether they leave open ample alternative channels by which the citizen may exercise the affected right. In circumstances where the State's interest in restricting the right to keep and bear arms is minimal and the private interest in exercising the right is substantial, an individual needs a way to exercise the right without violating the law. In these circumstances, regulations limiting a constitutional right to keep and bear arms must leave some realistic alternative means to exercise the right.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_16" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text><lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HT0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>
			  </lnci:constitution>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608P0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> expressly limits the right to keep and bear arms to "lawful purposes." Therefore, a defendant is not entitled to assert a constitutional defense to a carrying a concealed weapon charge, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HV0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			    </lnci:statref>
			  </lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608R0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> (1999-2000), if he or she carried a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose. Carrying a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose, even if a defendant were able to satisfy the two other tests for an unreasonable restriction, is not protected by <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HW0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>
			  </lnci:constitution>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608S0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>.</text>
		    </p>

			  <lncr:alphagrouping xmlns:lncr="http://www.lexis-nexis.com/lncr">P</lncr:alphagrouping>
			  <skos:prefLabel>Purpose</skos:prefLabel>
			  <skos:broader rdf:resource="urn:topic:F5010D8915984CD3A718B89DD112A073">Mens Rea</skos:broader>
			  <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="urn:taxonomy:E5E8CECAC300479987626973823B0160"/>
			  <skos:scopeNote>covers the element of a criminal offense that requires an offender to act consciously when committing the act that constitutes the crime.</skos:scopeNote>
			  <ln:taxonomynodeproperty name="Status" value="Active" xmlns:ln="http://krm.lexisnexis.com/ln/"/>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_17" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>Whether a defendant carried a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose is a question of fact, as it may involve a state of mind for which competing evidence is necessary. This inquiry requires a determination of the individual's purpose for carrying the concealed weapon. Carrying a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose means carrying a concealed weapon in furtherance of the commission of a crime. To overcome a constitutional defense, the State has the burden of alleging that a defendant had a specific criminal purpose and of presenting evidence that the defendant carried the concealed weapon for that unlawful purpose. If the court determines that the alleged intent is criminal in nature and if the State meets its burden of producing evidence sufficient to raise the issue of that intent, then the court will instruct the trier of fact to determine if the unlawful purpose was held by the defendant while he carried the concealed weapon. If the trier of fact determines the allegation is true, a defendant will be precluded from successfully availing himself of any constitutional challenge to a carrying a concealed weapon (CCW) conviction. If it determines otherwise, then the unconstitutionality of enforcing the CCW statute, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HX0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			    </lnci:statref>
			  </lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608T0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite> (1999-2000), against the defendant remains, and no further verdict regarding the elements of the CCW offense need be answered.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>
		</casesum:headnote>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_18" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>A defendant who challenges on constitutional grounds a prosecution for carrying a concealed weapon has to secure affirmative answers to the following legal questions before he can raise a constitutional defense. First, did the defendant's interest in concealing the weapon to facilitate exercise of his right to keep and bear arms substantially outweigh the State's interest in enforcing the concealed weapons statute? The State has a significant interest in prohibiting the carrying of concealed weapons. Thus, to satisfy this element, the defendant must have been exercising the right to keep and bear arms under circumstances in which the need to do so was substantial. Second, did the defendant conceal his weapon because concealment was the only reasonable means under the circumstances to exercise his or her right to bear arms? Put differently, did the defendant lack a reasonable alternative to concealment to exercise his constitutional right to bear arms? The invocation of this possible defense must be raised by motion of the defendant before trial, and resolution of these legal questions must be made by the court prior to trial. Affirmative answers to these questions will require a court to conclude that the State's enforcement of the CCW statute constituted an unreasonable and unconstitutional impairment of the right to keep and bear arms as granted in <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HY0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			      <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			    </lnci:constref>
			  </lnci:constitution>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608X0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext>Wis. Const. art. I. � 25</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>.</text>
		    </p>

		  <bodytext xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		    <p>
		      <ref:anchor id="hnpara_19" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <text>The issue of defendant's unlawful purpose in carrying a concealed weapon is relevant only when the court approves a constitutional defense. The State can overcome a court-approved constitutional defense only if it asserts, and then proves at trial, that the defendant had an unlawful purpose at the time he or she carried the concealed weapon. Whether the defendant had an unlawful purpose, defined as an intent to use the weapon in furtherance of the commission of a crime, is a question of fact. The question should be submitted to the trier of fact along with separate, traditional instructions on the crime of carrying a concealed weapon. If a jury answers that the defendant did not intend the unlawful purpose specifically alleged by the State, then it will not need to reach the questions posed in the jury instructions for a carrying a concealed weapon offense, as the defendant's conduct remains constitutionally protected. If any unlawful purpose is proven, then the defendant can be found guilty of carrying a concealed weapon upon proof beyond a reasonable doubt of the elements of the crime of carrying a concealed weapon.</text>
		    </p>
		  </bodytext>

		  <globalentity:content>Eric M. McLeod</globalentity:content>

	    <courtcase:panel VSalign="L" VSseparation="2NL">
	      <hdr inline="Y" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y">Judges:</hdr>
	      <courtcase:judges><$=D>AVID T. PROSSER, J. <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		  <globalentity:content>WILLIAM A. BABLITCH</globalentity:content>
		  <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100041936" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		</globalentity:entity>, J. (concurring). <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		  <globalentity:content>ANN WALSH BRADLEY</globalentity:content>
		  <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100064504" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		</globalentity:entity>, J. (concurring). <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		  <globalentity:content>N. PATRICK CROOKS</globalentity:content>
		  <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100057874" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		</globalentity:entity>, J. (concurring/dissenting). <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		  <globalentity:content>SHIRLEY S. ABRAHAMSON</globalentity:content>
		  <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		</globalentity:entity>, CHIEF JUSTICE (dissenting).  </courtcase:judges>
	    </courtcase:panel>
	    <courtcase:opinionby VSalign="L" VSseparation="2NL"><hdr inline="Y" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y">Opinion by:</hdr>DAVID T. <person:judge status="valid" xmlns:person="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/person/1/">PROSSER</person:judge></courtcase:opinionby>
	    <majorityopinion VSalign="L" VSseparation="2NL">
	      <hdr inline="N" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y" format="BANNER">Opinion</hdr>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_4" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="441" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="789" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P1" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>DAVID T. PROSSER</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100024089" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, J. This case involves an incident that occurred in the city of Milwaukee on the evening of November 26, 1999. The defendant, Munir Hamdan (Hamdan), owned and operated a grocery store on West Capitol Drive. As time came<ref:page num="2" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> to close the store, Hamdan removed a handgun that he kept under the counter near the cash register and carried it into a back room for storage. At some point he wrapped the gun in a plastic bag.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_5" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P2" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> While Hamdan was in the back room, two plain clothes Milwaukee police officers entered the store. Hamdan's son pressed a buzzer, summoning his father, and Hamdan shoved the wrapped gun into his trouser pocket and went out to meet the visitors.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_6" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P3" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The officers explained that they were conducting a license check. Hamdan led one of the officers to a glass-enclosed area where he kept the cash register and showed him the licenses. During the ensuing conversation, the officer asked Hamdan if he kept a gun in the store and, if so, where it was located. Hamdan <ref:page num="442" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> answered affirmatively and then pulled the wrapped gun from the front pocket of his trousers. The officers confiscated the gun but did not arrest Hamdan or charge him with an offense.</text>
	      </p>

			  </casesum:headnote>"Any person except a peace officer who goes armed with a concealed and dangerous weapon is guilty of a Class A misdemeanor." A "peace officer" is defined as "any person vested by law with a duty to maintain public order or to make arrests for crime, whether that duty extends to all crimes or is limited to specific crimes." <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4RS0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 939.22" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="41013090013" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite>. A Class A misdemeanor is punishable by a fine not to exceed $ 10,000 or imprisonment not to exceed 9 months, or both. <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4RT0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 939.51" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="40521780020" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

			  </meta>
			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:0E5390F82F7D4C2DBD06E44166387A29" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			</classify:classitem>
			<classify:classitem>
			  <meta>
			    <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>

			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:39B976ACAE4C4839990528F14E59A34D" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			</classify:classitem>
