			    <metaitem name="InternalName" value="General Overview"/>
			  </meta>
			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:C75CDBC599A749E28E5D4CFDE7FD5757" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			</classify:classitem>
		      </classify:classification>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text><lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4H80000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600G0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> declares that the people have the right to keep and bear arms for lawful purposes. While <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4H90000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:stat>
				<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
				</lnci:statref>
			      </lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600H0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> (1999-2000), which bans carrying a concealed weapon (CWW), withstands a facial challenge to its constitutionality under <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HB0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600J0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite>, there are circumstances in which a strict application of the CCW statute may result in an unreasonable limitation of the constitutional right.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </casesum:headnote>The new<ref:page num="4" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> amendment, <lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND18T0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:constitution>
			<lnci:constinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			    </lnci:hierlev>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
			</lnci:constref>
		      </lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:precedent>
			  <lnci:editletter ID="I494K3WC0K1MND0K20000400" appliedby="human" comment="Interprets or construes at" letter="ii"/>
			</lnci:precedent>
		      </lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600K0000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite>, declares that the people have the right to keep and bear arms for lawful purposes. <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n2">2</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_3" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text><lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4S70000400" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DX0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Article I, Section 25 of the Wisconsin Constitution</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> provides in its entirety: <casesum:headnote headnotesource="lexis-caselaw-editorial" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">
			      <ref:anchor id="clscc3" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <classify:classification classscheme="ln.search-advisor" xmlns:classify="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/classification/1/">
				<classify:classitem>
				  <classify:classitem-identifier>
				    <classify:classcode normval="00000620"/>
				  </classify:classitem-identifier>
				</classify:classitem>
				<classify:classitem>
				  <meta>
				    <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
				    <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
				    <metaitem name="score" value="97"/>
				    <metaitem name="versionmajor" value="4"/>
				  </meta>
				  <classify:classitem-identifier>
				    <classify:classcode normval="00000620"/>
				  </classify:classitem-identifier>
				</classify:classitem>
				<classify:classitem>
				  <meta>
				    <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
				    <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
				    <metaitem name="score" value="97"/>
				    <metaitem name="versionmajor" value="5"/>
				  </meta>
				  <classify:classitem-identifier>
				    <classify:classcode normval="00000620"/>
				  </classify:classitem-identifier>
				</classify:classitem>
			      </classify:classification>
			      <classify:classification classscheme="ln.legal" xmlns:classify="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/classification/1/">
				<meta>
				  <metaitem name="ProcessDate" value="09-24-2012 15:10:18"/>
				</meta>
				<classify:classitem>
				  <meta>
				    <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
				    <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
				    <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00000620"/>
				    <metaitem name="InternalName" value="Right to Bear Arms"/>
				  </meta>
				  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:4E6F821962FC4804B4AD3B27A047CE68" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
				</classify:classitem>
			      </classify:classification>
			      <bodytext>
				<p>
				  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_3" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				  <text>See <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HC0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				      <lnci:constitution>
					<lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
					  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
					</lnci:constref>
				      </lnci:constitution>
				      <lnci:content>
					<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
					  <request xmlns="">
					    <parameters>
					      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DY0000400"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					    </parameters>
					    <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
					  </request>
					</linktemplate:linktemplate>
				      </lnci:content>
				    </lnci:cite>.</text>
				</p>
			      </bodytext>
			    </casesum:headnote>"The people have the right to keep and bear arms for security, defense, hunting, recreation or any other lawful purpose."</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> While <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4RV0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600M0000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> (the CCW statute) withstands a facial challenge to its constitutionality under the amendment, <emph typestyle="un">see </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND1V70000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1V60000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4RX0000400" historycite="0" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="31842786" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Cole"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND4RY0000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="23642" value="WI"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="112" kw="1327_2003_112*.112" page="112" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2003"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="2003"/>
			    <lnci:page num="112"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="P27"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND4S30000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="520" kw="2005_264_520*.520" page="520" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="264"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="264"/>
			    <lnci:page num="520"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND4S50000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="328" kw="1572_665_328*.328" page="328" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="665"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="665"/>
			    <lnci:page num="328"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND33C0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="2003"/>
			    <lnci:page num="613"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2003#000112#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PNUM_27_3481"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2003#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2003 WI 112"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="27"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600P0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Cole</emph>, 2003 WI 112, P27, 264 Wis. 2d 520, <ref:page num="443" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> 665 N.W.2d 328</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1WD0000400" seqnum="1"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1WF0000400" seqnum="10"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1WG0000400" seqnum="11"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1WH0000400" seqnum="13"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1WJ0000400" seqnum="17"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1WK0000400" seqnum="18"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>, we recognize that there are now circumstances in which a strict application of the CCW statute may result in an unreasonable limitation of the new constitutional right. </rfc:reasonforciting>In Hamdan's case, we must determine whether the constitutional right to keep and bear arms for security or defense permitted Hamdan to carry a concealed weapon in his store under the circumstances of this case, notwithstanding the CCW statute.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_9" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P6" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> We conclude that it was unreasonable and unconstitutional<ref:page num="5" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> to apply the CCW statute to punish Hamdan on the facts as we understand them. Strict application of the CCW statute effectively disallowed the reasonable exercise of Hamdan's constitutional right to keep and bear arms for the lawful purpose of security. Considering the diminished public interest in applying the CCW statute in the context of Hamdan's conduct, we hold that the State's police power must yield in this case to Hamdan's reasonable exercise of the constitutional right to keep and bear arms for security. This right, when exercised within one's own business and supported by a factual determination that no unlawful purpose motivated concealment of the weapon, will usually provide a constitutional defense to a person who is charged with violating the CCW statute. Because Hamdan was not permitted to assert this defense, his challenge to the CCW statute was not fully addressed by the circuit court and his conviction under <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4S80000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I494K3WC0K1MND0K30000400" appliedby="human" comment="Unconstitutional in part by" letter="Up"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600T0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> was not proper.</text>
	      </p>
	      <h xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">I. BACKGROUND FACTS</h>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_10" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P7" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Munir Hamdan had owned and operated the Capitol Foods grocery and liquor store since 1987. The store was a family-run business, open 365 days a year and operated from<ref:page num="6" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> 9:00 a.m. until 8:00 or 9:00 p.m., depending on the time of year. Hamdan's wife and <ref:page num="444" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> 15-year-old son were present in the store on the evening of November 26, 1999. The family had just completed a meal in a back room that functions as a kitchen and dining quarters for family members who congregate and work at the store. It was after 8:00 p.m., the night after Thanksgiving, when the officers came in. The front door of the store was not locked, but Hamdan insisted that he had begun the process of closing up.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_11" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P8" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> This is the contextual information the jury was permitted to hear. Most of <ref:page num="791" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Hamdan's proffered evidence was not admitted. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><emph typestyle="un">infra</emph> P14. For instance, the jury was not told that Hamdan's store is located in a high-crime neighborhood. According to Milwaukee police data, there had been at least three homicides, 24 robberies, and 28 aggravated batteries reported that year in the small census tract that included Hamdan's store. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote3" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n3">3</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_4" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>To put this in perspective, the 1990 census tract in which Hamdan's store is located (Census Tract 47) is one of 218 tracts in the city of Milwaukee.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> There had been violent criminal episodes both inside and immediately outside Hamdan's store. Between 1993 and 1999, the store was the target of four armed robberies--three of which were successful--and the site of two fatal shootings. Hamdan claims<ref:page num="7" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> that on one occasion an armed assailant held a gun to his head and actually pulled the trigger. The weapon misfired and Hamdan survived. In February 1997 Hamdan engaged in a struggle with an armed assailant who was attempting to rob the store. In the course of this attack, Hamdan shot and killed the robber in self-defense. The other homicide at the store occurred in April 1998. Incidents of violent crime continued <ref:page num="445" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> in and around the store after Hamdan's prosecution, including shootings that resulted in bullets striking the store.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_12" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P9" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> As a result of these general and specific concerns for the safety of himself, his family, and his customers, and for the security of his property, Hamdan kept a handgun under the store's front counter next to the cash register during store hours. The jury was not told the basis of Hamdan's motivation for possessing this weapon<ref:page num="8" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> or that the handgun seized was the same handgun Hamdan used to defend himself from the February 1997 attacker. The jury was told that Hamdan kept the handgun in a locked area closed off from the public and that local law enforcement knew that Hamdan kept a gun for protection.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_13" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P10" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The jury also learned from the State's only witness, Officer Bodo Gajevic, that "the majority of the store owners [in the area] have some type of weapon on the premises based on my experience." In fact, Officer Gajevic explained that he often checked these weapons to see if they were operating properly.</text>
	      </p>
	      <h xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">II. LITIGATION HISTORY</h>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_14" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P11" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Six days after being visited by the officers, Hamdan met with an assistant district attorney for <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Milwaukee County</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102992558" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> to discuss the incident. After this conference, he was charged with carrying a concealed weapon. Hamdan filed a motion to dismiss the charge, challenging the enforcement of the CCW statute on constitutional grounds. He contended that prior court decisions broadly construing the phrase "goes armed" are no longer valid given the right to keep and bear arms conferred by <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4SC0000400" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600V0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25 of the Wisconsin Constitution</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND1V90000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1V90000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Hamdan argued that his prosecution<ref:page num="9" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> under <ref:page num="446" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> the CCW statute would impermissibly infringe upon his rights under the newly enacted amendment. Hamdan also contended that no presumption of constitutionality should be accorded the CCW statute because it significantly predated the constitutional amendment. <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote4" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n4">4</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_5" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>This court has rejected this argument regarding the presumption of constitutionality in <rfc:anchorcite lni="4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND1V90000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1V80000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4SF0000400" historycite="0" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="31842786" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="Cole"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND4SG0000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="23642" value="WI"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="112" kw="1327_2003_112*.112" page="112" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2003"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="2003"/>
				    <lnci:page num="112"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint lastnum="18" num="P12"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND4SM0000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="520" kw="2005_264_520*.520" page="520" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="264"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="264"/>
				    <lnci:page num="520"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND4SP0000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="328" kw="1572_665_328*.328" page="328" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="665"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="665"/>
				    <lnci:page num="328"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND33D0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="2003"/>
				    <lnci:page num="613"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2003#000112#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PNUM_12_3481"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2003#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2003 WI 112"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="12"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360F10000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Cole</emph>, 2003 WI 112, PP12-18, 264 Wis. 2d 520, 665 N.W.2d 328</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1WM0000400" seqnum="7"/>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>, which is also decided today.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote></rfc:reasonforciting></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_15" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P12" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> After the parties had briefed this issue, the circuit court denied Hamdan's motion. <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Milwaukee County</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102992558" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> Circuit Judge <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Robert Crawford</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100057957" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> concluded that <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s ban against carrying concealed weapons is not an overly broad infringement of <ref:page num="792" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Hamdan's state constitutional right to keep and bear arms. The court reasoned that, as part of the legislature's inherent police power, it could reasonably require that a storeowner openly display a handgun--for instance, by placing it in a holster--if the storeowner kept a handgun for security at his<ref:page num="10" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> or her place of business.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_16" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P13" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In preparation for trial, Hamdan and the State submitted competing motions in limine regarding the admission of evidence to support a defense of privilege. The State contended that Hamdan should be prohibited from introducing evidence of crime statistics and prior robberies at the store, as well as <lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND33F0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600W0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>, arguing that there is no privilege, as a matter of law, under the privilege statute (<lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4SS0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 939.45" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="43162580029" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="939.45"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_939.45()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W2YJ-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000939#    45#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 939.45"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600X0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 939.45</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>) in these circumstances. Hamdan argued to allow such evidence. He theorized that a privilege to carry a concealed weapon--a privilege relating to the defense of property and protection against retail theft or to necessity--was grounded in the new amendment. <ref:page num="447" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Hamdan also submitted a proposed modified jury instruction for jury consideration of these matters.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_17" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P14" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The circuit court denied Hamdan's motion to admit this evidence. The court determined that there is no statutory privilege under <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4ST0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 939.45" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="43162580029" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="939.45"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_939.45">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W2YJ-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000939#    45#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 939.45"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3600Y0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>� 939.45</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> allowing a person to go armed with a concealed weapon no matter what the threats to that person might be. In reaching this conclusion, the court denied that the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> Constitution supports any<ref:page num="11" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> common law privilege to carry concealed weapons in certain circumstances. As a result, the evidence was excluded and the final jury instructions contained no mention of <lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND34D0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360100000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>, the history of crimes in and around Hamdan's store, or any defense of privilege.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_18" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P15" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> After a jury trial on July 11, 2000, Hamdan was found guilty of carrying a concealed weapon. At sentencing, the court noted a need to clarify the reach of state gun laws and also remarked upon the jury's consternation in finding Hamdan guilty for violating the statute in this case. The court ultimately fined Hamdan one dollar. Hamdan sought appellate review, and we granted his petition to bypass the court of appeals.</text>
	      </p>
	      <h xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">III. ISSUES PRESENTED AND STANDARD OF REVIEW</h>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_19" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P16" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> This case, along with the companion case of <emph typestyle="un">Cole</emph>, decided today, represents our first opportunity to interpret <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s new right to "keep and bear arms." <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote5" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n5">5</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_6" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND1WT0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
			    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1WT0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND1WW0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1WW0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND36T0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:constitution>

				</lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">

					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite> was previously addressed by this court in <rfc:anchorcite lni="462M-PH10-0039-44FR-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND1WT0000400" status="valid">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1VB0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="134" kw="2005_253_134*.134" page="134" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="253"/>

				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="264" kw="1572_645_264*.264" page="264" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="645"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="645"/>
				      <lnci:page num="264"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND1YY0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>

				  </lnci:case>
				  <lnci:metadata>

				      <lnci:editletter ID="I494K3WC0K1MND0K40000400" appliedby="human" comment="Explained by" letter="e"/>
				    </lnci:precedent>
				  </lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:content>
				    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:462M-PH10-0039-44FR-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				      <request xmlns="">
					<parameters>
					  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2002#000059#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2002#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2002 WI 59"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360F50000400"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					</parameters>
					<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Gonzales</emph>, 2002 WI 59, 253 Wis. 2d 134, 645 N.W.2d 264</linktext>
				      </request>
				    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				  </lnci:content>
				</lnci:cite>
			      </rfc:anchorcite>. However, the sole issue in that case, as ultimately decided by this court, was whether <lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND3WR0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:constitution>
				  <lnci:constinfo>
				    <lnci:hier>
				      <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
					<lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
				      </lnci:hierlev>
				    </lnci:hier>
				  </lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
				    <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
				  </lnci:constref>
				</lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360F80000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite> was in effect on November 6, 1998, the date when the offense at issue was committed. We determined that it was not applicable at that time. <rfc:anchorcite lni="462M-PH10-0039-44FR-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND1WW0000400" status="valid">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1WV0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4T50000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4SW0000400" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				  <lnci:case>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND4T40000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4SX0000400">

				      <lnci:pinpoint num="P30"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND36V0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4T00000400">
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="134" kw="2005_253_134*.134" page="134" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="253"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND36W0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4T20000400">

				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND3TT0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND1YY0000400"/>
				  </lnci:case>
				  <lnci:content>
				    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:462M-PH10-0039-44FR-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

					</parameters>

		  </footnote> <lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND36S0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>

		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360110000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> became part of the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity><ref:page num="448" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Constitution on November 30, 1998. It provides in its entirety: "The people have the right to keep and bear arms for security, defense, hunting, recreation or any other lawful purpose."</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_20" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="12" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P17" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> We are asked to interpret this provision in the context of a challenge to <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s sweeping prohibition on the carrying of concealed weapons. This prohibition is codified in <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4T60000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360120000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> as follows: "Any person except a peace officer who goes armed with a concealed and dangerous weapon is guilty of a Class A misdemeanor."</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_21" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P18" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Hamdan presents three related theories why his conviction under the CCW statute must be reversed. First, he argues that the adoption of <lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND3XB0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360130000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> requires a new construction of the<ref:page num="793" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> CCW statute. He contends that, properly construed, the statute no longer reaches his conduct. Second, he argues that the adoption of <lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND4140000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360140000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> alters the defense of privilege and gives him a privilege defense on these facts. Third, he argues that his conviction under the CCW statute impairs constitutional rights protected by <lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND4200000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360150000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> and cannot stand. All three theories have at their core certain suppositions regarding the effect of the <lnci:cite ID="I494BJ3K0K1MND42B0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360160000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> on the CCW statute. The first two theories claim that adoption of the amendment invalidates elements of prior case law interpreting<ref:page num="13" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> both the CCW statute and its susceptibility to defenses of common law and statutory privilege. Hamdan's third argument is a constitutional assault on the CCW statute based on an alleged need to reconcile the statute with the constitutional right to keep and bear arms.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">

		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND1WY0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1WY0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="449" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P19" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> These theories present questions of law. 		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_4" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>To convict a person of carrying a concealed weapon in violation of <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HD0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:stat>
				<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
				</lnci:statref>
			      </lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3601C0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> (1999-2000), the State must prove three elements. First, the State must show that a person who is not a peace officer went armed with a dangerous weapon. Second, the State must show that the defendant was aware of the presence of the weapon. Third, the State must show that the weapon was concealed.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </casesum:headnote>To convict a person of carrying a concealed weapon in violation of <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4TK0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>

			  </lnci:hier>

		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3601D0000400"/>

			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite>, the State must prove three elements. First, the State must show that a person who is not a peace officer went armed with a dangerous weapon. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND1XW0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1XW0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3WPP-T3S0-0039-44D3-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND1XC0000400" status="valid">

			      <lnci:volume num="594"/>

		    </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>Over the years, every element of the statute has been vigorously litigated.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_24" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND1YH0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1YH0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P21" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Hamdan asks the court to withdraw a series of appellate decisions interpreting the first element, which is based on the statutory phrase "goes armed." For more than 70 years, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> courts have defined the phrase "goes armed" in the CCW statute to mean that "the weapon was on the defendant's person or that the weapon must have been within the defendant's reach and that the defendant was aware of the presence of the weapon." <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-WC70-003G-33BY-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND1YH0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND1YG0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

			<lnci:case>

			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>

			  </lnci:caseref>

			</lnci:case>

			<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1X30000400" seqnum="3"/>
		      </rfc:anchorcite>. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2290000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2290000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>In <emph typestyle="un">Keith</emph>, the court of appeals upheld the CCW conviction of a woman who was carrying a concealed weapon while she was standing on the front porch<ref:page num="15" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> of the duplex where she was living. </rfc:reasonforciting></rfc:reasonforciting>

		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote6" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n6">6</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_7" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>
			    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2400000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2400000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>In <emph typestyle="un">Keith</emph>, police officers came into contact with the defendant after she set off a burglar alarm while trying to gain access to her friend's house where she had been staying. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2420000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2420000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-XTG0-003G-3182-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2400000400" status="valid">
				  <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND22B0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				  <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND4WC0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="5445325" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				    <lnci:case>
				      <lnci:caseinfo>
					<lnci:casename>
					  <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
					  <lnci:text txt="v."/>
					  <lnci:party2 name="Keith"/>
					</lnci:casename>
					<lnci:jurisinfo txt="Ct. App."/>
					<lnci:decisiondate txt="1993"/>
				      </lnci:caseinfo>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND4WD0000400">
					<lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
					<lnci:ldi jumppage="77" kw="2005_175_75*.77" page="75" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="175"/>
					<lnci:volume num="175"/>
					<lnci:page num="75"/>
					<lnci:pinpoint num="77"/>
				      </lnci:caseref>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND4WJ0000400">
					<lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
					<lnci:ldi jumppage="865" kw="1572_498_865*.865" page="865" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="498"/>
					<lnci:volume num="498"/>
					<lnci:page num="865"/>
				      </lnci:caseref>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2060000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
