					</lnci:casename>
					<lnci:decisiondate txt="1996"/>
				      </lnci:caseinfo>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND5250000400">
					<lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
					<lnci:ldi jumppage="204" kw="2005_206_199*.204" page="199" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="206"/>
					<lnci:volume num="206"/>
					<lnci:page num="199"/>
					<lnci:pinpoint num="204"/>
				      </lnci:caseref>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND5290000400">
					<lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
					<lnci:ldi jumppage="701" kw="1572_556_701*.701" page="701" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="556"/>
					<lnci:volume num="556"/>
					<lnci:page num="701"/>
				      </lnci:caseref>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND20K0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
					<lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
					<lnci:volume num="1996"/>
					<lnci:page num="114"/>
				      </lnci:caseref>
				    </lnci:case>
				    <lnci:content>
				      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RSV-Y7F0-003G-30B5-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="204"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360GG0000400"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					  </parameters>
					  <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Coleman</emph>, 206 Wis. 2d 199, 204, 556 N.W.2d 701 (1996)</linktext>
					</request>
				      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				    </lnci:content>
				  </lnci:cite>
				  <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1XT0000400" seqnum="2"/>
				</rfc:anchorcite>. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2J60000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2J60000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The defendant claimed that on a prior occasion armed robbers invaded the apartment and the defendant had escaped through the window to call the police. </rfc:reasonforciting></rfc:reasonforciting></rfc:reasonforciting>
			    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2J60000400">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2J60000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2J40000400">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2J40000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

					<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RSV-Y7F0-003G-30B5-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

					</linktemplate:linktemplate>
				      </lnci:content>
				    </lnci:cite>
				  </rfc:anchorcite> The defendant argued that, when the police came through the door on the day of his arrest, he believed that history was repeating itself and so he grabbed a gun in self-defense. </rfc:reasonforciting>
			      </rfc:reasonforciting>

				  <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2J50000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

				    <lnci:case>

				    </lnci:case>

				      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				    </lnci:content>
				  </lnci:cite>
				</rfc:anchorcite> The court held that Coleman was privileged in his actions. </rfc:reasonforciting>
			    </rfc:reasonforciting>

		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> or a "statutory" privilege based upon <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND0WR0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

			</lnci:constref>
		      </lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_38" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="797" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="457" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P35" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2KS0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2KS0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>In <emph typestyle="un">Coleman</emph> we recognized<ref:page num="25" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> a narrow common law privilege to the crime of being a felon in possession of a firearm. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2MR0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2MR0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>This privilege requires a defendant to prove multiple factors. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2MT0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2MT0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3RSV-Y7F0-003G-30B5-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2KS0000400" status="valid">
			  <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2KR0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND52G0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND51W0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:case>
			      <lnci:caseinfo>
				<lnci:casename>
				  <lnci:party1 name="Coleman"/>
				</lnci:casename>
			      </lnci:caseinfo>
			      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND52F0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND51X0000400">
				<lnci:ldi jumppage="210" kw="2005_206_199*.210" page="199" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="206"/>
				<lnci:pinpoint lastnum="211" num="210"/>
			      </lnci:caseref>
			      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2610000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND5200000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				<lnci:ldi jumppage="701" kw="1572_556_701*.701" page="701" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="556"/>
			      </lnci:caseref>
			      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2620000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND20J0000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
			    </lnci:case>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RSV-Y7F0-003G-30B5-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000206#000199#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_210_3491"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000206#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="206 Wis. 2d 199"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="210"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3603M0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Coleman</emph>, 206 Wis. 2d at 210-211</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite>
			  <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1XV0000400" seqnum="2"/>
			  <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1XW0000400" seqnum="3"/>
			</rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting></rfc:reasonforciting></rfc:reasonforciting><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2MT0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2MT0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2MR0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2MR0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><footnote>
			<ref:anchor id="fn_fnote16" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<label alt-content="n16">16</label>
			<bodytext>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_22" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>The <emph typestyle="un">Coleman</emph> test for a defendant wishing to invoke the common law privilege for felons in possession of a firearm is: </text>
			    <blockquote>
			      <p>
				<ref:anchor id="fnpara_23" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<text>the defendant must prove: (1) the defendant was under an unlawful, present, imminent, and impending threat of such a nature as to induce a well-grounded apprehension of death or serious bodily injury, or the defendant reasonably believes he or she is under such a threat; (2) the defendant did not recklessly or negligently place himself or herself in a situation in which it was probable that he or she would be forced to possess a firearm; (3) the defendant had no reasonable, legal alternative to possessing a firearm, or reasonably believed that he or she had no alternative; in other words, the defendant did not have a chance to refuse to possess the firearm and also to avoid the threatened harm, or reasonably believed that he or she did not have such a chance; (4) a direct causal relationship may be reasonably anticipated between possessing the firearm and the avoidance of the threatened harm; (5) the defendant did not possess the firearm for any longer than reasonably necessary. </text>
			      </p>
			    </blockquote>
			  </p>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_24" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>
			      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2P70000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2P70000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2P70000400" status="unresolved">
				  <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2P60000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				  <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND5360000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND51W0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				    <lnci:case>
				      <lnci:caseinfo>
					<lnci:casename>
					  <lnci:party1 name="Coleman"/>
					</lnci:casename>
				      </lnci:caseinfo>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DC010K1MND5350000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND51X0000400">
					<lnci:ldi jumppage="210" kw="2005_206_199*.210" page="199" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="206"/>
					<lnci:pinpoint lastnum="211" num="210"/>
					<lnci:syllabusnum ID="I4JVTG4Y0K1MNJ4XN0000400" num="2"/>
				      </lnci:caseref>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2690000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND5200000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
					<lnci:ldi jumppage="701" kw="1572_556_701*.701" page="701" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="556"/>
					<lnci:syllabusnum ID="I4JVTG4Y0K1MNJ4XP0000400" num="3"/>
				      </lnci:caseref>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26B0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND20J0000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
				    </lnci:case>
				    <lnci:content>
				      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RSV-Y7F0-003G-30B5-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
					<request xmlns="">
					  <parameters>
					    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000206#000199#"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_210_3491"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000206#"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="206 Wis. 2d 199"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="210"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360GN0000400"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					  </parameters>
					  <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Coleman</emph>, 206 Wis. 2d at 210-211</linktext>
					</request>
				      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				    </lnci:content>
				  </lnci:cite>
				</rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>
			    </text>
			  </p>
			</bodytext>
		      </footnote> However, in <rfc:anchorcite lni="3WPP-T3S0-0039-44D3-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2MR0000400" status="valid">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2KT0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

			<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1XX0000400" seqnum="12"/>
			<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1XY0000400" seqnum="13"/>
		      </rfc:anchorcite>, we declined to apply the <emph typestyle="un">Coleman</emph> test to the crime of carrying a concealed weapon. </rfc:reasonforciting>In <emph typestyle="un">Dundon</emph>, the manager of a gas station was arrested for carrying a concealed weapon after he placed a handgun in his waistband while transporting money from his station to a bank. <rfc:anchorcite lni="3WPP-T3S0-0039-44D3-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2MT0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2MS0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

The court declined to link the privilege under <emph typestyle="un">Coleman</emph> to the crime of carrying a concealed weapon or to find any common law privilege to CCW offenses. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2NG0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2NG0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3WPP-T3S0-0039-44D3-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2MW0000400" status="valid">

		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3603Y0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> provides a basis in law to support a "statutory" privilege. If we assumed that the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> Constitution could serve as the basis for a "statutory" privilege under <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND5370000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 939.45" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44923190030" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="939.45">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="subsection" num="6"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_939.45(6)">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W2YJ-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000939#    45#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_6"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 939.45"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360400000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>� 939.45(6)</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>, we would still conclude that the constitution would have to spell out the scope of the privilege--the nexus between the privilege and the specific criminal conduct--to be applicable. <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND14R0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360410000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> recognizes a right to keep and bear arms generally, but it does not express a privilege to exercise that right in a particular manner or particular circumstance. These are essential attributes of a statutory privilege. <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND14S0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360420000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> does not create a "statutory" privilege to the crime of carrying a concealed weapon. </text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_40" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="798" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P37" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Under the facts of this case and in the context of the CCW statute, we do not believe that modifying the principles underlying the law of privilege, as codified in <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND5380000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 939.45" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="43162580029" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="939.45"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_939.45()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W2YJ-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000939#    45#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 939.45"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360430000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 939.45</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> and interpreted in prior decisions of this court, is the appropriate method of effectuating the rights guaranteed under <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s right to keep and bear<ref:page num="28" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> arms amendment.</text>
	      </p>
	      <h xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">VI. CONSTITUTIONALITY "AS APPLIED"</h>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_41" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P38" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The adoption of <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND14T0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360440000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> did not affect prior judicial interpretations of the CCW statute <ref:page num="459" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> or the availability of privilege defenses for CCW crimes, but it did create an obligation to protect rights guaranteed by the amendment.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_42" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P39" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The State's broad police power to regulate the ownership and use of firearms and other weapons continues, notwithstanding <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND1530000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360450000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2P90000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2P90000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Nonetheless, the amendment's broad declaration of the right to keep and bear arms inevitably impacts the exercise of that power. <casesum:headnote headnotesource="lexis-caselaw-editorial" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">

			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:5A506C7EE952463FADC713DBB3AC9B51" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_6" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>In <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity>, constitutional rights do not expand the police power; they restrict the police power. Thus, courts may limit the broad application of the carrying a concealed weapon statute, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HH0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:stat>
				<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
				</lnci:statref>
			      </lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360460000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> (1999-2000), in those circumstances where limitation is necessary to narrowly accommodate the constitutional right to keep and bear arms for lawful purposes.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </casesum:headnote>In this state, constitutional rights do not expand the police power; they restrict the police power. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2PR0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2PR0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-WCF0-003G-33DJ-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2P90000400" status="valid">

Knoop, <emph typestyle="un">State Constitutions and The Right to Keep and Bear Arms</emph>, <lnci:cite ID="I4DXP70T0K1MND1FB0000400" loadable="0" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

		      </lnci:cite> (describing the general application of this principle). </rfc:reasonforciting></rfc:reasonforciting><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2PR0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2PR0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Thus, courts may limit the broad application of the CCW statute in those circumstances where limitation is necessary to narrowly accommodate the constitutional right to keep and bear arms for lawful purposes. <footnote>

Faced with similar challenges, other states applying a reasonableness standard in the context of regulating firearms have recognized that "the police power cannot [] be invoked in such a manner that it amounts to the <emph typestyle="un">destruction</emph> of the right to bear arms." <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RVJ-C470-003G-J2SY-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2PT0000400" status="valid">

			      </p>
			    </bodytext>
			  </footnote> Some states have employed language less demanding than "destruction," assuring that "regulations or restrictions [on a constitutional right to bear arms for defensive purposes] do not <emph typestyle="un">frustrate</emph> the guarantees of the<ref:page num="30" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> constitutional <ref:page num="799" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> provision." <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RXR-1PY0-003G-H356-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2R70000400" status="valid">

			  </rfc:anchorcite> (emphasis added); <footnote>

			    <label alt-content="n19">19</label>
			    <bodytext>
			      <p>
				<ref:anchor id="fnpara_27" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<text>The <emph typestyle="un">Buckner</emph> opinion also described the reasonableness of any impairment of the right to bear arms by stating that "the legitimate governmental purpose in regulating the right to bear arms cannot be pursued by means that broadly stifle the exercise of this right where the governmental purpose can be more narrowly achieved." <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RXR-1PY0-003G-H356-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2VB0000400" status="valid">
				    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2V90000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				    <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND5660000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="4460278" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-X7P0-003F-Y1RG-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">

				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite>
			    <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1YG0000400" seqnum="1"/>
			  </rfc:anchorcite> (stating that regulations restricting the <ref:page num="461" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> possession or manner of carrying personal weapons are valid "if the aim of public safety does not frustrate the guarantees of the state constitution"); <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-YYY0-003F-Y112-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2R70000400" status="valid">
			    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2RB0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <lnci:cite ID="I493DC010K1MND54J0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="3718638" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

				  <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Or. Ct. App."/>

				</lnci:caseinfo>

				  <lnci:volume num="61"/>

				</lnci:caseref>

				  <lnci:volume num="658"/>
				  <lnci:page num="577"/>
				  <lnci:pinpoint num="579"/>
				</lnci:caseref>
				<lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND20V0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				  <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4061" value="Ore. App. LEXIS"/>
				  <lnci:volume num="1983"/>
				  <lnci:page num="2242"/>
				</lnci:caseref>
			      </lnci:case>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-YYY0-003F-Y112-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000658#000577#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_579_4932"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000658#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="658 P.2d 577"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="579"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3604S0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9282"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Boyce</emph>, 61 Ore. App. 662, 658 P.2d 577, 579 (Or. Ct. App. 1983)</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite>
			    <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND1YH0000400" seqnum="2"/>
			  </rfc:anchorcite> (holding that a limitation on the right to bear arms is permissible when the means chosen to protect the public "does not unreasonably interfere with the right"). </rfc:reasonforciting>
		      </rfc:reasonforciting>
		    </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  </rfc:reasonforciting>Case law reveals that while the right to bear arms for lawful purposes is not an absolute, neither is the State's police power when it eviscerates this constitutionally protected right.</text>
	      </p>

			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:C75CDBC599A749E28E5D4CFDE7FD5757" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00004024"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="Police Powers"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:5A506C7EE952463FADC713DBB3AC9B51" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		    </classify:classification>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="hnpara_7" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HJ0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			      </lnci:constref>
			    </lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3604V0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> does not establish an unfettered right to bear arms. The State retains the power to impose reasonable regulations on weapons, including a general prohibition on the carrying of concealed weapons. However, the State may not apply these regulations in situations that functionally disallow the exercise of the rights conferred under <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HK0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			      </lnci:constref>
			    </lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3604W0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite>. The State must be especially vigilant in circumstances where a person's need to exercise the right is the most pronounced. If the State applies reasonable laws in circumstances that unreasonably impair the right to keep and bear arms, the State's police power must yield in those circumstances to the exercise of the right. The prohibition of conduct that is indispensable to the right to keep (possess) or bear (carry) arms for lawful purposes will not be sustained.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </casesum:headnote>does not establish an unfettered right to bear arms. Clearly, the State retains the power to impose reasonable regulations on weapons, including a general prohibition on the carrying of concealed weapons. However, the State may not apply these regulations in situations that functionally disallow the exercise of the rights conferred under <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND17X0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3604X0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>. The State must be especially vigilant in circumstances where a person's need to exercise the right is the most pronounced. If the State applies reasonable laws in circumstances that unreasonably impair the right to keep and bear arms, the State's police power must yield in those circumstances<ref:page num="32" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> to the exercise of the right. The prohibition of conduct that is indispensable to the right to keep (possess) or bear (carry) arms for lawful purposes will not be sustained.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_45" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P42" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Hamdan insists that enforcement of the CCW statute on the facts of his case unreasonably impaired his constitutional rights. He contends that, <ref:page num="462" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> even if the CCW statute technically prohibited his conduct and even if his conduct was not privileged, it was still unconstitutional to apply the statute in the circumstances of his case. Hamdan argues that the right to bear arms provision guarantees, at a minimum, the right to carry a concealed weapon on one's own business property for defense or security when there is a compelling need to do so. The State, on the other hand, maintains that the addition of <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND1980000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3604Y0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> has had little, if any, impact on the constitutional validity of applying the CCW statute. It argues that while Hamdan may have the right to possess a weapon in his store for the lawful purposes of security and defense, he must continue to possess that weapon openly.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_46" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2VD0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2VD0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P43" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> We assess the merits of Hamdan's "as applied" challenge by considering the facts of his case, not hypothetical<ref:page num="33" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> facts in other situations. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="40KS-M540-0039-44SW-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2VD0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2VC0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0040000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="23635880" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Stevenson"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0050000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="23642" value="WI"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="71" kw="1327_2000_71*.71" page="71" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2000"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="2000"/>
			    <lnci:page num="71"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="P12"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0090000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="86" kw="2005_236_86*.86" page="86" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="236"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="236"/>
			    <lnci:page num="86"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND00C0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="90" kw="1572_613_90*.90" page="90" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="613"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="613"/>
			    <lnci:page num="90"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2190000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="2000"/>
			    <lnci:page num="413"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:40KS-M540-0039-44SW-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2000#000071#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PNUM_12_3481"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2000#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2000 WI 71"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="12"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360510000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Stevenson</emph>, 2000 WI 71, P12, 236 Wis. 2d 86, 613 N.W.2d 90</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>; <rfc:anchorcite lni="3TFC-CCD0-0039-42XW-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2VD0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2W00000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND00G0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6889986" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>

			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1998"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND00H0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="371" kw="2005_219_362*.371" page="362" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="219"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="219"/>
			    <lnci:page num="362"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="371"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND00N0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="260" kw="1572_580_260*.260" page="260" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="580"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="580"/>
			    <lnci:page num="260"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND21B0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1998"/>
			    <lnci:page num="102"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3TFC-CCD0-0039-42XW-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000219#000362#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_371_3491"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000219#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="219 Wis. 2d 362"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="371"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360550000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Janssen</emph>, 219 Wis. 2d 362, 371, 580 N.W.2d 260 (1998)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>The State prosecuted Hamdan for carrying a handgun in his trousers pocket, in his own small store, at the time he did, and around the persons he did. The issue is whether the State may restrict the carrying of a concealed firearm in these circumstances without unreasonably infringing Hamdan's rights under <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND17Y0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">

			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_47" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2W30000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2W30000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P44" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> As we explained in <emph typestyle="un">Cole</emph>, <casesum:headnote headnotesource="lexis-caselaw-editorial" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">
		      <ref:anchor id="clscc8" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <classify:classification classscheme="ln.search-advisor" xmlns:classify="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/classification/1/">

			</classify:classitem>
			<classify:classitem>

			</classify:classitem>
			<classify:classitem>

			    <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>

		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_8" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>When an exercise of the State's police power implicates the constitutional right to keep and bear arms, the validity of the exercise is measured by the reasonableness of the restriction on the asserted right. This same analytical approach guides judicial determination of whether a particular application of an otherwise reasonable restriction on the right to bear arms is still constitutionally valid. In analyzing reasonableness, one must balance the conflicting rights of an individual to keep and bear arms for lawful purposes against the authority of the State to exercise its police power to protect the health, safety, and welfare of its citizens. A balance must be struck between the individual's right to exercise each constitutional guarantee and society's right to enact laws that will ensure some semblance of order. As these interests will necessarily conflict, the question then becomes which party should accept the encroachment of its right. The solution to the conflict is judicial in nature. Courts must be and are, whether willingly or not, the ultimate arbiters as to whether or not there is, in a particular case, an unwarranted invasion of constitutionally guaranteed rights.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>

			<lnci:cite ID="I4DXP70T0K1MND1FF0000400" loadable="0" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

			  <lnci:content><emph typestyle="un">State Gun Control Legislation</emph>, <lnci:span CITE-REF="#53#3#000038#000185#" cfi:contentclasscode="3" cfi:kw-fallback-substring="#53#3#000038#" cfi:normcite="38 U. Chi. L. Rev. 185" spanid="I56N5HD52N1R3605W0000400" xmlns:cfi="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/cite-finding-information/1/">38 U. Chic. L. Rev. 185</lnci:span>, <lnci:span CITE-REF="#53#3#000038#000185#" cfi:anchoridref="PAGE_202_8136" cfi:contentclasscode="3" cfi:kw-fallback-substring="#53#3#000038#" cfi:normcite="38 U. Chi. L. Rev. 185" cfi:pinpoint="202" spanid="I56N5HD52N1R3605X0000400" xmlns:cfi="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/cite-finding-information/1/">202-03</lnci:span> (1970)</lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>
		      </rfc:anchorcite> ("The scope of permissible regulation in states with arms provisions is dependent upon a balancing of the public benefit to be<ref:page num="35" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> derived from the regulation against the degree to which it frustrates the purposes of the provision."). </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y10000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y10000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>In <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RVJ-C470-003G-J2SY-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y10000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y00000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0290000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="4042558" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="McAdams"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Wyo."/>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1986"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02B0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="499" value="P.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="1236" kw="1706_714_1236*.1236" page="1236" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="714"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="714"/>
			    <lnci:page num="1236"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND21J0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4141" value="Wyo. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1986"/>
			    <lnci:page num="658"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RVJ-C470-003G-J2SY-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000714#001236#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000714#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="714 P.2d 1236"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3605Y0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="11009"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. McAdams</emph>, 714 P.2d 1236 (Wyo. 1986)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20B0000400" seqnum="3"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20C0000400" seqnum="5"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20D0000400" seqnum="9"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>, the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wyoming</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102925937" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> Supreme Court explained this need for balance as follows: </rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
		<blockquote>
		  <p>
		    <ref:anchor id="para_49" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <text>
		      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y10000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y10000400_3" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      </rfc:reasonforciting>
		    </text>
		  </p>
		  <p>
		    <ref:anchor id="para_50" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <text>[A] balance must be struck between the individual's right to exercise each constitutional guarantee and society's right to enact laws which will ensure some semblance of order. As these interests will necessarily conflict, the question then becomes which party should <ref:page num="464" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> accept the encroachment of its right. The solution to the conflict is judicial in nature. Courts must be and are, whether willingly or not, the ultimate arbiters as to whether or not there is, in a particular case, an unwarranted invasion of constitutionally guaranteed rights. </text>
		  </p>
		</blockquote>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_51" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y30000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y30000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3RVJ-C470-003G-J2SY-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y30000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND2Y20000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02F0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0290000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02D0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND02B0000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="1237" kw="1706_714_1236*.1237" page="1236" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="714"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint lastnum="38" num="1237"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26F0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND21J0000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I494K3WC0K1MND1VB0000400" appliedby="human" comment="Followed by" letter="f"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RVJ-C470-003G-J2SY-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000714#001236#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_1237_4932"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000714#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="714 P.2d 1236"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="1237"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360600000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="11009"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Id.</emph> at 1237-38</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20F0000400" seqnum="9"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. We agree with this characterization of the constitutional inquiry, including the indispensable role of courts in determining whether enforcement of the CCW statute has unreasonably impaired the constitutional right.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
