			</classify:classitem>
			<classify:classitem>
			  <meta>
			    <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			    <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			    <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00004024"/>
			    <metaitem name="InternalName" value="Police Powers"/>
			  </meta>
			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:5A506C7EE952463FADC713DBB3AC9B51" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			</classify:classitem>
		      </classify:classification>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_9" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>Under its broad police power, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> may regulate firearms. It may regulate the time, place, and manner in which firearms are possessed and used. The concealed weapons statute is a restriction on the manner in which firearms are possessed and used. It is constitutional. Only if the public benefit in this exercise of the police power is substantially outweighed by an individual's need to conceal a weapon in the exercise of the right to bear arms will an otherwise valid restriction on that right be unconstitutional as applied.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </casesum:headnote>Under its broad police power, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> may regulate firearms. It may regulate the time, place, and manner in which firearms are possessed<ref:page num="36" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> and used. The concealed weapons statute is a restriction on the <emph typestyle="un">manner</emph> in which firearms are possessed and used. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="43F8-SWG0-0039-42H8-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3020000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3010000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02H0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="26801907" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Perez"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02J0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="23642" value="WI"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="79" kw="1327_2001_79*.79" page="79" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2001"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="2001"/>
			    <lnci:page num="79"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02M0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="582" kw="2005_244_582*.582" page="582" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="244"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="244"/>
			    <lnci:page num="582"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02P0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="820" kw="1572_628_820*.820" page="820" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="628"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="628"/>
			    <lnci:page num="820"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND21K0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="2001"/>
			    <lnci:page num="422"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:43F8-SWG0-0039-42H8-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2001#000079#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2001#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2001 WI 79"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360610000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Perez</emph>, 2001 WI 79, 244 Wis. 2d 582, 628 N.W.2d 820</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>It is constitutional. We hold that only if the public benefit in this exercise of the police power is substantially outweighed by an individual's need to conceal a weapon in the exercise of the right to bear arms will an otherwise valid restriction on that right be unconstitutional as applied.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_53" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P47" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> We begin by examining the manner in which the State prohibits the carrying of concealed weapons and whether its reasons for doing so are strong in the context of Hamdan's conduct. This inspection will reveal the comparative burden the CCW statute imposes upon the rights declared in <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND2800000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360640000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>. </text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_54" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <ref:page num="801" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="465" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P48" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND30R0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND30R0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Wisconsin's current CCW statute is very broad. It is essentially a strict liability offense. </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3040000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3040000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND30R0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND30R0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><footnote>
			<ref:anchor id="fn_fnote20" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<label alt-content="n20">20</label>
			<bodytext>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_28" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>The only <emph typestyle="un">mens rea</emph> element of the offense is that the defendant must be aware of the weapon's presence. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="450J-11C0-0039-44CX-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND30R0000400" status="valid">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3050000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02X0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="28355521" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				  <lnci:case>
				    <lnci:caseinfo>
				      <lnci:casename>
					<lnci:party1 name="State"/>
					<lnci:text txt="v."/>
					<lnci:party2 name="Nollie"/>
				      </lnci:casename>
				    </lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02Y0000400">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="23642" value="WI"/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="4" kw="1327_2002_4*.4" page="4" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2002"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="2002"/>
				      <lnci:page num="4"/>
				      <lnci:pinpoint num="P13"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0330000400">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="538" kw="2005_249_538*.538" page="538" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="249"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="249"/>
				      <lnci:page num="538"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0350000400">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="280" kw="1572_638_280*.280" page="280" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="638"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="638"/>
				      <lnci:page num="280"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND21M0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="2002"/>
				      <lnci:page num="3"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				  </lnci:case>
				  <lnci:content>
				    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:450J-11C0-0039-44CX-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				      <request xmlns="">
					<parameters>
					  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2002#000004#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PNUM_13_3481"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2002#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2002 WI 4"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="13"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360HK0000400"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					</parameters>
					<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Nollie</emph>, 2002 WI 4, P13 n.3, 249 Wis. 2d 538, 638 N.W.2d 280</linktext>
				      </request>
				    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				  </lnci:content>
				</lnci:cite>
				<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20H0000400" seqnum="2"/>
			      </rfc:anchorcite>.</text>
			  </p>
			</bodytext>
		      </footnote> The legislature has not authorized any statutory defenses or exceptions (other than peace officers) to the broad prohibition found in the statute. </rfc:reasonforciting>As presently construed, the statute prohibits any person, except a peace officer, from carrying a concealed weapon, regardless of<ref:page num="37" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> the circumstances, including pursuit of one of the lawful purposes enumerated in <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND2880000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:constitution>
			<lnci:constinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			    </lnci:hierlev>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
			</lnci:constref>
		      </lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360650000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite>. In addition, the statute reaches unloaded firearms as well as loaded ones, <emph typestyle="un">see</emph> <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02S0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 939.22" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44551300024" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="939.22">
			      <lnci:hierlev label="subsection" num="10"/>
			    </lnci:hierlev>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_939.22(10)()">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W2Y6-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000939#    22#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_10"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 939.22"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360660000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 939.22(10)</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> (defining a "dangerous weapon" under the CCW statute), and applies to any weapon within a individual's reach, <emph typestyle="un">see </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-WC70-003G-33BY-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3040000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3030000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02V0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4TY0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="Asfoor"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND02T0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4V00000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="433" kw="2005_75_411*.433" page="411" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="75"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint lastnum="34" num="433"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26G0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4V40000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="529" kw="1572_249_529*.529" page="529" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="249"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26H0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND2020000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-WC70-003G-33BY-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000075#000411#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_433_3491"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000075#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="75 Wis. 2d 411"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="433"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360670000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Asfoor</emph>, 75 Wis. 2d at 433-34</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20G0000400" seqnum="7"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>, if the person knows the weapon is present.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_55" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P49" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The breadth of <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0370000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360680000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>� 941.23</linktext>
			</request>

		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> is better appreciated by comparing it with the law in other jurisdictions. In 1998 <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">

			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:4X7F-82W0-R03K-C4TS-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_30" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>As of 2002, six states do not have a constitutional provision affording residents a right to bear arms: <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>California</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-103034278" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Iowa</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102953009" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Maryland</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102961741" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Minnesota</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102898782" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>New Jersey</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102953011" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>, and New York. </text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> However, <ref:page num="466" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> remains one of only six states that generally disallow any class of ordinary citizens to lawfully carry concealed weapons. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> J. Harvie Wilkinson<ref:page num="38" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> III, <emph typestyle="un">Federalism for the Future</emph>, <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0390000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="25857699" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:lawrev>

			<lnci:lawrevlocator>

			  <lnci:page num="523"/>
			  <lnci:pinpoint num="525"/>
			</lnci:lawrevlocator>
		      </lnci:lawrevref>
		    </lnci:lawrev>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/analytical-materials/urn:contentItem:42K5-N2F0-00CV-51GT-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#657#3#000074#000523#"/>

			  </parameters>
			  <linktext> 74 S. Cal. L. Rev. 523, 525 n.4 (2001)</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote22" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n22">22</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_31" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

			  </globalentity:entity> (<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND04X0000400" normcite="OHIO REV. CODE ANN. 2923.12" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44435700016" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

			    <globalentity:content>New Mexico</globalentity:content>

		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_32" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>New Mexico</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102953011" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity> recently enacted a concealed carry permitting system. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> 2003 N.M. S.B. 23. However, even before this permitting was allowed, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>New Mexico</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102953011" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>'s concealed carry prohibition exempted violations of the law in certain circumstances. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0510000400" loadable="1" normcite="N.M. STAT. ANN. 30-7-2" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="13177286" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:statinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="30-7-2">
				    <lnci:hierlev label="subdivision" num="A">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="para" num="1"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hierlev>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:statinfo>
			      <lnci:statref>
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="10072" value="N.M. Stat. Ann."/>
			      </lnci:statref>
			    </lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56PN-T310-004F-M1R3-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#10072#141#000030#000007#000002#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="N.M. Stat. Ann. � 30-7-2"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KC0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9088"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>N.M. Stat. Ann. � 30-7-2(A)(1)</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> (Michie Supp. 2002) (stating that it is not unlawful to carry a concealed loaded firearm "in the person's residence or on real property belonging to him as owner, lessee, tenant or licensee").</text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_33" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND30T0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND30T0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Vermont</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-103024876" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> does not have a statute expressly authorizing the carrying of concealed weapons, but the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Vermont Supreme Court</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" guid:guid="urn:entity:jb-100000013" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> has expansively read the state's right to bear arms amendment, <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND3280000400" loadable="1" normcite="VA. CONST. 1 16" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44307790029" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="16"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="1_16">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="7161" value="Va. Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:568P-FTV0-004G-J2YD-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#7161#128#        1 #            16 #"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Va. Const. 1,16"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KD0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139219"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Chapter I, Article 16 of the Vermont Constitution</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite>, as requiring the ability to carry concealed firearms. <rfc:anchorcite lni="3SYX-S760-00GX-50KB-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND30T0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND30S0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0530000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="1050770" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="Rosenthal"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Vt."/>
				    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1903"/>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0540000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="674" value="Vt."/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="295" kw="1956_75_295*.295" page="295" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1956" volume="75"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="75"/>
				    <lnci:page num="295"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0560000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="556" value="A."/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="610" kw="78_55_610*.610" page="610" pagesuffix="*" reporter="78" volume="55"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="55"/>
				    <lnci:page num="610"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint num="610"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND21N0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4124" value="Vt. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="1903"/>
				    <lnci:page num="132"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3SYX-S760-00GX-50KB-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#674#3#000075#000295#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#674#3#000075#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="75 VT 295"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KF0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="323879"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Rosenthal</emph>, 75 Vt. 295, 55 A. 610, 610 (Vt. 1903)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20J0000400" seqnum="3"/>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Vermont</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-103024876" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity> currently prohibits both the open and concealed carrying of a weapon only if an individual has "the intent or avowed purpose of injuring a fellow man." <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0580000400" normcite="13 VT. STAT. ANN. 4003" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="40718420040" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:statinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="title" num="13">
				    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="4003"/>
				  </lnci:hierlev>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:statinfo>
			      <lnci:statref normcite="13_4003">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="7007" value="Vt. Stat. Ann."/>
			      </lnci:statref>
			    </lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56SC-8T20-004G-G4GW-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#7007#123#000013#004003#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="13 Vt. Stat. Ann. � 4003"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KH0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10837"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 13, � 4003</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> (1998). </text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> Each of the five other states (<globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Illinois</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102997853" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, <ref:page num="467" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Kansas</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-103003711" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Missouri</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102898782" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Nebraska</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102953011" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, and <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Ohio</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102924963" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>) also has a constitutional <ref:page num="802" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> provision granting the right to keep and bear arms.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_56" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="40" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND30W0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND30W0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P50" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Upon closer examination, however, there are few similarities between <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity>'s CCW law and the CCW laws of these other five states. First, the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Kansas</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-103003711" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> right to bear arms amendment is one of only two state right to bear arms provisions that has been interpreted to confer a collective right, as opposed to an individual right, to bear arms. <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote23" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n23">23</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_34" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>Some commentators suggest that the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Kansas</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-103003711" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> right to bear arms provision was construed to confer an individual right to bear arms in <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RX4-3RW0-003F-D52X-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND30W0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND30V0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND05C0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="3351633" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="Junction City"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="Mevis"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Kan."/>
				    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1979"/>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND05D0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="297" value="Kan."/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="526" kw="591_226_526*.526" page="526" pagesuffix="*" reporter="591" volume="226"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="226"/>
				    <lnci:page num="526"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND05G0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="499" value="P.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="1145" kw="1706_601_1145*.1145" page="1145" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="601"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="601"/>
				    <lnci:page num="1145"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND21P0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="3952" value="Kan. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="1979"/>
				    <lnci:page num="350"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RX4-3RW0-003F-D52X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#297#3#000226#000526#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#297#3#000226#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="226 Kan. 526"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KJ0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="6805"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Junction City v. Mevis</emph>, 226 Kan. 526, 601 P.2d 1145 (Kan. 1979)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> David B. Kopel, <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND3290000400" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="29926330" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:lawrev>
				<lnci:lawrevref ID="I494BP8P0K1MND32B0000400">
				  <lnci:lawrevlocator>
				    <lnci:publicationname normpubcode="1612" value="N. Ky. L. Rev."/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="827" kw="1444_29_827*.827" page="827" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1444" volume="29"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="29"/>
				    <lnci:page num="827"/>
				  </lnci:lawrevlocator>
				</lnci:lawrevref>
			      </lnci:lawrev>
			      <lnci:content> <emph typestyle="un">What State Constitutions Teach About the Second Amendment</emph>, <lnci:span CITE-REF="#1612#3#000029#000823#" cfi:contentclasscode="3" cfi:kw-fallback-substring="#1612#3#000029#" cfi:normcite="29 N. Ky. L. Rev. 823" spanid="I56N5HD52N1R360KM0000400" xmlns:cfi="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/cite-finding-information/1/">29 N. Ky. L Rev. 823</lnci:span>, <lnci:span CITE-REF="#1612#3#000029#000823#" cfi:anchoridref="PAGE_846_8542" cfi:contentclasscode="3" cfi:kw-fallback-substring="#1612#3#000029#" cfi:normcite="29 N. Ky. L. Rev. 823" cfi:pinpoint="846" spanid="I56N5HD52N1R360KN0000400" xmlns:cfi="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/cite-finding-information/1/">846-847</lnci:span> (2002)</lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> (discussing how <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Kansas</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-103003711" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> and <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Massachusetts</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102961741" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> are the only two states to have interpreted their state constitution right to bear arms provisions as only a collective right).</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> Under such an interpretation, there would appear to be no constitutional impediment to a comprehensive CCW prohibition. In each of the other four "no-permit" states with a right to bear arms amendment, <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote24" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n24">24</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_35" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>Unlike the other four states, only <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Illinois</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102997853" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity>' right to bear arms provision does not enumerate, in some manner, defense and security as a purpose for which people may bear arms. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND05P0000400" normcite="ILL. CONST. I 22" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="40841800011" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="22"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_22">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="13597" value="Ill. Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56W4-D1Y0-006M-G33F-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#13597#128#000000001 #00000000000022 #"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Ill. Const. 1,22"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KP0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="6672"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Ill. Const. art. I, � 22</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> ("Subject only to the police power, the right of the individual citizen to keep and bear arms shall not be infringed."); <lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND32C0000400" loadable="1" normcite="KAN. CONST. BILL OF RIGHTS 4" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="41136490021" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="catchword" num="Bill of Rights">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="4"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="Bill of Rights_4">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="13252" value="Kan. Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:5635-13H0-004D-P4FR-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#13252#210#      bill of rights#     4#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Kan. Const. Bill of Rights 4"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KR0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="6810"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Kan. Const. Bill of Rights, � 4</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> ("The people have the right to bear arms for their defense and security; but standing armies, in time of peace, are dangerous to liberty, and shall not be tolerated, and the military shall be in strict subordination to the civil power."); <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND05R0000400" normcite="MO. CONST. I 23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42026990010" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="23"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_23">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="15730" value="Mo. Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56R2-0530-004F-63ST-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#15730#128#000001#    23#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="MO Const 1,23"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KS0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="138877"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Mo. Const. art. I, � 23</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> ("That the right of every citizen to keep and bear arms in defense of his home, person and property, or when lawfully summoned in aid of the civil power, shall not be questioned; but this shall not justify the wearing of concealed weapons."); <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND05S0000400" normcite="NEB. CONST. I 1" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="41331090001" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="1"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_1">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="10668" value="Neb. Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56D9-B570-004F-B3SN-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#10668#128#000001#000001#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Neb. Const. 1,1"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KT0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="7884"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Neb. Const. art. I, � 1</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> ("All persons are by nature free and independent, and have certain inherent and inalienable rights; among these are . . . the right to keep and bear arms for security or defense of self, family, home, and others, and for lawful common defense, hunting, recreational use, and all other lawful purposes, and such rights shall not be denied or infringed by the state or any subdivision thereof."); <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND05T0000400" normcite="OHIO CONST. I 4" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="45233240015" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="4"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_4">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="9526" value="Ohio Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56WH-P0R0-009V-807W-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#9526#128#000001#     4#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="OH CONST 1,4"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KV0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9259"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Ohio Const. art. I, � 4</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> ("The people have the right to bear arms for their defense and security; but standing armies, in time of peace, are dangerous to liberty, and shall not be kept up; and the military shall be in strict subordination to the civil power."). Only the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Missouri</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102898782" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> constitutional provision expressly reserves for the state the restriction on carrying concealed weapons.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> Hamdan's conduct likely <ref:page num="468" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> would have been exempted from punishment. </rfc:reasonforciting>For example, in <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Ohio</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102924963" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, the state's CCW statute contains broad affirmative defenses, including the right of business owners and homeowners to lawfully carry a concealed weapon in certain circumstances. <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0590000400" loadable="1" normcite="OHIO REV. CODE ANN. 2923.12" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44091320041" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="2923.12">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="subdivision" num="C"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="2923.12(C)">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="9461" value="Ohio Rev. Code Ann."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56WH-NXD0-009V-8554-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#9461#117#000029#000023#    12#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_c"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Ohio Rev. Code Ann. � 2923.12"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3606C0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9258"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Ohio Rev. Code Ann. � 2923.12(C)</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> (West 1997). <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote25" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n25">25</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_36" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>The <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Ohio</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102924963" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity> statute provides: </text>
			<blockquote>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_37" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text><lnci:cite ID="I494BP8P0K1MND32W0000400" loadable="1" normcite="OHIO REV. CODE ANN. 2923.12" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44091320041" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:stat>
				  <lnci:statinfo>
				    <lnci:hier>
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="2923.12">
					<lnci:hierlev label="subdivision" num="C"/>
				      </lnci:hierlev>
				    </lnci:hier>
				  </lnci:statinfo>
				  <lnci:statref normcite="2923.12(C)">
				    <lnci:standardname normpubcode="9461" value="Ohio Rev. Code Ann."/>
				  </lnci:statref>
				</lnci:stat>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56WH-NXD0-009V-8554-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#9461#117#000029#000023#    12#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_c"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Ohio Rev. Code Ann. � 2923.12"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KW0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9258"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext>(C)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite> It is an affirmative defense to a charge under this section of carrying or having control of a weapon other than dangerous ordnance, that the actor was not otherwise prohibited by law from having the weapon, and that any of the following apply:</text>
			  </p>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_38" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>(1) The weapon was carried or kept ready at hand by the actor for defensive purposes, <emph typestyle="un">while the actor was engaged in</emph> or was going to or from <emph typestyle="un">the actor's lawful business or occupation, which business or occupation was of such character or was necessarily carried on in such manner or at such a time or place as to render the actor particularly susceptible to criminal attack</emph>, <emph typestyle="un">such as would justify a prudent person in going armed</emph>.</text>
			  </p>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_39" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>(2) The weapon was carried or kept ready at hand by the actor for defensive purposes, while the actor was engaged in a lawful activity and had reasonable cause to fear a criminal attack upon the actor or a member of the actor's family, or upon the actor's home, such as would justify a prudent person in going armed.</text>
			  </p>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_40" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>(3) The weapon was carried or kept ready at hand by the actor for any lawful purpose and while in the actor's own home. </text>
			  </p>
			</blockquote>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_41" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND05V0000400" normcite="OHIO REV. CODE ANN. 2923.12" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44091320041" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:statinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="2923.12">
				    <lnci:hierlev label="subdivision" num="C"/>
				  </lnci:hierlev>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:statinfo>
			      <lnci:statref normcite="_2923.12(C)">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="9461" value="Ohio Rev. Code Ann."/>
			      </lnci:statref>
			    </lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56WH-NXD0-009V-8554-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#9461#117#000029#000023#    12#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_c"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Ohio Rev. Code Ann. � 2923.12"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KX0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9258"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Ohio Rev. Code Ann. � 2923.12(C)</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> (West 1997) (emphasis added). </text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> Similar defenses are provided <ref:page num="469" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> in the other three states (<globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Illinois</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102997853" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Missouri</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102898782" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, and <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Nebraska</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102953011" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>) <ref:page num="803" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> that do not presently have concealed carry permit laws. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote26" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n26">26</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_42" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><emph typestyle="un">See</emph> 720 <lnci:cite ID="I494C01M0K1MND05X0000400" loadable="1" ri.key="13177287" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:statinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="chapter" num="5">
				    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="24/1">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="subdivision" num="a">
					<lnci:hierlev label="para" num="4"/>
				      </lnci:hierlev>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hierlev>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:statinfo>
			      <lnci:statref>
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="13599" value="Ill. Comp. Stat."/>
			      </lnci:statref>
			    </lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:content>Ill. Comp. Stat. 5/24-1(a)(4)</lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> (2000) (excepting persons "when on his land or in his own abode or fixed place of business" from prohibition of "carrying or possessing in any vehicle or concealed on or about his person . . . any pistol, revolver, stun gun or taser or other firearm"); <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0610000400" normcite="MO. REV. STAT. 571.030.3" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="40739760010" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:statinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="571.030">
				    <lnci:hierlev label="subsection" num="3"/>
				  </lnci:hierlev>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:statinfo>
			      <lnci:statref normcite="_571.030.3">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="11509" value="Mo. Rev. Stat."/>
			      </lnci:statref>
			    </lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56R2-03V0-004F-6200-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#11509#116#000571#   030#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_.3"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Mo. Rev. Stat. � 571.030 .3"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360KY0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="7864"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Mo. Rev. Stat. � 571.030.3</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> (West 1995) ("[State concealed weapon prohibition] does not apply when the actor . . . is in his dwelling unit or upon business premises over which the actor has possession, authority or control, . . . ."); <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0620000400" normcite="NEB. REV. STAT. 28-1202" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="41084720018" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:statinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="28-1202">
				    <lnci:hierlev label="subdivision" num="2"/>
				  </lnci:hierlev>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:statinfo>
			      <lnci:statref normcite="_28-1202(2)">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="10599" value="Neb. Rev. Stat."/>
			      </lnci:statref>
			    </lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56D9-B430-004F-B42Y-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#10599#450#000028#000012#        02#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_2"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Neb. Rev. Stat. � 28-1202"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360M00000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="7883"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Neb. Rev. Stat. � 28-1202(2)</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> (1995) ("It shall be an affirmative defense [to carrying a concealed weapon] that the defendant was engaged in any lawful business, calling, or employment at the time he or she was carrying any weapon or weapons and the circumstances in which such person was placed at the time were such as to justify a prudent person in carrying the weapon or weapons for the defense of his or her person, property, or family.").</text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_43" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3190000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3190000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Numerous other states also have specific exemptions from prosecution under a carrying a concealed weapon prohibition based on a person being on their own premises. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph>, <emph typestyle="un">e.g.</emph>, <lnci:cite ID="I494C01M0K1MND0D40000400" loadable="1" normcite="CAL. PENAL CODE 12026" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44649450018" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:stat>
				<lnci:statinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="12026"/>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:statinfo>
				<lnci:statref normcite="12026">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="14999" value="Cal. Penal Code"/>
				</lnci:statref>
			      </lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:4WK3-V1S0-R03M-B1GP-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>

			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND31C0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND31C0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>To be sure, some state courts have held, usually many years ago, that the offense of carrying a concealed weapon applies even to those on their own premises. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3Y8V-MB30-0046-80XK-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND31C0000400" status="valid">

			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0700000400" historycite="0" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="2102069" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RRM-TC70-003C-74M0-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#627#3#000130#000663#"/>

					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="665"/>
