	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_57" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="44" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="470" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P51" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> As a result of our legislature's decision to prohibit the carrying of concealed weapons under any circumstance, <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote27" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n27">27</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_45" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>The decision over whether to require the permitting of those who wish to carry concealed weapons in any circumstance fully remains with the legislature.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> the interaction between <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s CCW statute and the state constitution's right to bear arms is anomalous, if not unique. It appears that no other state, except perhaps <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Kansas</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-103003711" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, completely bans the carrying of concealed weapons by all citizens in all circumstances while simultaneously recognizing the right of individuals to own, possess, and carry firearms for lawful purposes. Hence, these other states provide little guidance on the particular issue of whether Hamdan's conduct, which violated the CCW law, may still be constitutionally protected.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_58" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P52" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> We have described <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s exceptionally restrictive scheme to show how it heightens the conflict between the CCW statute and the rights in <lnci:cite ID="I494C01M0K1MND1W10000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3606D0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>. The<ref:page num="45" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> issue is whether and when this conflict requires us to limit the outer reaches of the CCW statute, in order to avoid unreasonable impairments on the right to bear arms.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_59" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND31Y0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND31Y0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P53" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> We turn now to the public benefits underlying the CCW statute and how they apply in the circumstances of this case. As we explained in <emph typestyle="un">Cole</emph>, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity>'s prohibition of the carrying of concealed weapons is, as a general matter, a reasonable exercise of the police power, <rfc:anchorcite lni="4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND31Y0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND31X0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I494C01M0K1MND2210000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4SF0000400" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I494C01M0K1MND3G60000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4SG0000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="112" kw="1327_2003_112*.112" page="112" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2003"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I494C01M0K1MND2VF0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4SM0000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="520" kw="2005_264_520*.520" page="520" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="264"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I494C01M0K1MND25X0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4SP0000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="328" kw="1572_665_328*.328" page="328" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="665"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I494C01M0K1MND25W0000400" anaphref="I494BJ3K0K1MND33D0000400"/>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2003#000112#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2003#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2003 WI 112"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3606F0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Cole</emph>, 2003 WI 112, ___ Wis. 2d ___, P40</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20N0000400" seqnum="11"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20P0000400" seqnum="17"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>, and serves many valuable purposes in promoting public safety.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_60" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND32C0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND32C0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="471" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P54" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-XFV0-003G-32VT-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND32C0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND32B0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND07D0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="5881613" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Walls"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Ct. App."/>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1994"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND07F0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="65" kw="2005_190_65*.65" page="65" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="190"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="190"/>
			    <lnci:page num="65"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND07H0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="765" kw="1572_526_765*.765" page="765" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="526"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="526"/>
			    <lnci:page num="765"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2220000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4136" value="Wisc. App. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1994"/>
			    <lnci:page num="1499"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-XFV0-003G-32VT-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000190#000065#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000190#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="190 Wis. 2d 65"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3606G0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10984"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Walls</emph>, 190 Wis. 2d 65, 526 N.W.2d 765 (Ct. App. 1994)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20R0000400" seqnum="3"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>, the court of appeals described the inspiration for CCW laws as follows: </rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
		<blockquote>
		  <p>
		    <ref:anchor id="para_61" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <text>
		      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND32C0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND32C0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      </rfc:reasonforciting>
		    </text>
		  </p>
		  <p>
		    <ref:anchor id="para_62" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <text>
		      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND32C0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND32C0000400_3" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The reason for these statutes, it has been said, is "because persons becoming suddenly angered and having such a weapon in their pocket, would be likely to use it, which in their sober moments <ref:page num="804" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> they would not have done, and which could not have been done had not the weapon been upon their person." </rfc:reasonforciting>
		    </text>
		  </p>
		</blockquote>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_63" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND32F0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND32F0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-XFV0-003G-32VT-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND32F0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND32D0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND07M0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND07D0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>

			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RRM-Y940-000F-S0VX-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Williams v. Commonwealth</emph>, 261 S.W.2d 807, 807-08 (Ky. 1953)</linktext>

			</lnci:content>

		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20T0000400" seqnum="2"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>, with citations in <emph typestyle="un">Williams</emph> omitted). In short, <ref:page num="46" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> carrying a concealed weapon permits a person to act violently on impulse, whether from anger or fear, and that is a prospect the law may discourage.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_64" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P55" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND32Y0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND32Y0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Another rationale for prohibiting concealed weapons is to put people on notice when they are dealing with an individual who is carrying a dangerous weapon. Notice of the presence of a dangerous weapon permits people, including law enforcement officers, to act accordingly. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="45WB-DYJ0-0039-4393-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND32Y0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND32X0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND07V0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="29139363" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>

			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:45WB-DYJ0-0039-4393-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

		    </rfc:anchorcite>; <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RX4-38W0-003G-211M-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND32Y0000400" status="valid">

			<lnci:case>

			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0850000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="434" value="A.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="965" kw="180_614_963*.965" page="963" pagesuffix="*" reporter="180" volume="614"/>

			    <lnci:volume num="1992"/>
			    <lnci:page num="177"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RX4-38W0-003G-211M-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#434#3#000614#000963#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_965_4902"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#434#3#000614#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="614 A.2d 963"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="965"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3606T0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="7704"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Anderson v. State</emph>, 328 Md. 426, 614 A.2d 963, 965 (Md. 1992)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20W0000400" seqnum="1"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20X0000400" seqnum="2"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>; 94 C.J.S. <emph typestyle="un">Weapons</emph> � 21 (2001). </rfc:reasonforciting>This objective is perhaps the most significant inspiration for CCW laws. A related concern is that concealed weapons facilitate the commission of crime by creating the appearance of normality and catching people off guard.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_65" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND33F0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND33F0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P56" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> One additional rationale for the statute was recognized many years ago when this court stated that CCW laws promote "the preservation of life, by affixing the stigma of the law of the land to him who carries a concealed pistol, loaded or unloaded, except in the cases allowed by the statute." <rfc:anchorcite lni="3XYW-KT80-00KR-C1MV-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND33F0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND33D0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND08B0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4V90000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="Mularkey"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0890000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4VB0000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="431" kw="2002_201_429*.431" page="429" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2002" volume="201"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="431"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26M0000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND4VG0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="76" kw="1571_230_76*.76" page="76" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1571" volume="230"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26N0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND2030000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3XYW-KT80-00KR-C1MV-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#110#3#000201#000429#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_431_3490"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>

			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Mularkey</emph>, 201 Wis. at 431</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND20Y0000400" seqnum="2"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite><ref:page num="47" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> (quoting from <rfc:anchorcite lni="3YJ9-NRR0-00KR-F4Y9-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND33F0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND33G0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND08D0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="751616" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Bollis"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Miss."/>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1895"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND08F0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="266" value="Miss."/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="57" kw="723_73_57*.57" page="57" pagesuffix="*" reporter="723" volume="73"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="73"/>
			    <lnci:page num="57"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND08H0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="536" value="So."/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="100" kw="1835_19_99*.100" page="99" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1835" volume="19"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="19"/>
			    <lnci:page num="99"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="100"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2280000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="3994" value="Miss. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1895"/>
			    <lnci:page num="131"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/contentstore/cases" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#536#3#000019#000099#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_100_4961"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#536#3#000019#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="19 So. 99"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="100"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3606Y0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="filters" fixed=""/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Bollis</emph>, 73 Miss. 57, 19 So. 99, 100 (Miss. 1895))</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. <ref:page num="472" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> These insightful words are a reminder that one of the purposes of criminalizing conduct is to stigmatize socially malfeasant behavior.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_66" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P57" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> None of these rationales is particularly compelling when applied to a person owning and operating a small store. Although a shopkeeper is not immune from acting on impulse, he or she is less likely to do so in a familiar setting in which the safety and satisfaction of customers is paramount and the liability for mistake is nearly certain. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND33Y0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND33Y0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>There is less need in these circumstances for innocent customers or visitors to be notified that the owner of a business possesses a weapon. Anyone who enters a business premises, including a person with criminal intent, should presume that the owner possesses a weapon, even if the weapon is not visible. <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote28" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n28">28</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_46" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text><emph typestyle="un">Cf. </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S4X-F1V0-003B-H2N6-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND33Y0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND33J0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND08M0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="88553" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="Beard"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="United States"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1895"/>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND08N0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="52" value="U.S."/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="564" kw="1917_158_550*.564" page="550" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1917" volume="158"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="158"/>
				    <lnci:page num="550"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint num="564"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND08T0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="606" value="L. Ed."/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="1086" kw="627_39_1086*.1086" page="1086" pagesuffix="*" reporter="627" volume="39"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="39"/>
				    <lnci:page num="1086"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND08W0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="656" value="S. Ct."/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="962" kw="1805_15_962*.962" page="962" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1805" volume="15"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="15"/>
				    <lnci:page num="962"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2290000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4112" value="U.S. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="1895"/>
				    <lnci:page num="2278"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S4X-F1V0-003B-H2N6-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#52#3#000158#000550#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_564_1100"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#52#3#000158#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="158 U.S. 550"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="564"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360MW0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="6443"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Beard v. United States</emph>, 158 U.S. 550, 564, 39 L. Ed. 1086, 15 S. Ct. 962 (1895)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			    </rfc:anchorcite> (concluding that a person who is attacked "is entitled to stand his ground, and meet any attack made upon him with a deadly weapon").</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> A shopkeeper is not likely to use a concealed weapon to facilitate his own crime of violence in his own store. </rfc:reasonforciting>The stigma of the law is inapplicable when the public expects a shopkeeper to possess a weapon for security.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">

			  </meta>
			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:39B976ACAE4C4839990528F14E59A34D" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:BEBD1F6D91F24DB190CF248670871371" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			</classify:classitem>
			<classify:classitem>
			  <meta>
			    <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			    <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			    <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00016795"/>
			    <metaitem name="InternalName" value="Elements"/>
			  </meta>
			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:355B95E4F4434665921460FC33483070" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			</classify:classitem>
		      </classify:classification>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_10" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>The criminality of gun possession is mitigated in the two places where an otherwise law-abiding person is likely to spend most of his time and to deserve the greatest expectation of personal security: his home and his workplace. The purposes of a concealed carry prohibition are often less compelling in settings in which the person bearing the concealed weapon is an owner of the property on which he or she goes armed. Although the considerations discussed above are not determinative of the reasonableness of prohibiting a shopkeeper from carrying a concealed weapon, they weigh against the need for applying the carrying a concealed weapon (CCW) statute, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HM0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:stat>
				<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
				</lnci:statref>
			      </lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360700000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> (1999-2000), in such circumstances if the shopkeeper had a substantial interest in exercising a right under <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HN0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360710000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite>. Strict application of the CCW statute in instances when the public interest in enforcing the statute is weak may unreasonably impair a person's right to keep and bear arms when the person's interest in exercising that right through the use of a concealed weapon is substantial. The primary concern of the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin Supreme Court</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" guid:guid="urn:entity:jb-100000683" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> is examining the CCW prohibition in a circumstance in which the bearing of arms for the purpose of security is the most reasonable and the most necessary.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </casesum:headnote>"the criminality of gun possession is mitigated in the two places where an otherwise law-abiding person is likely to spend most of his time and to deserve the greatest expectation of personal security: his home and his workplace." <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S2R-5YM0-003V-B0CF-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3410000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3400000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0900000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6182477" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="People"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Buckmire"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="N.Y. Sup. Ct."/>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1995"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0910000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="235" value="Misc. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="581" kw="722_167_581*.581" page="581" pagesuffix="*" reporter="722" volume="167"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="167"/>
			    <lnci:page num="581"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0930000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="632" value="N.Y.S.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="885" kw="1586_638_883*.885" page="883" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1586" volume="638"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="638"/>
			    <lnci:page num="883"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="885"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND22B0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4041" value="N.Y. Misc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1995"/>
			    <lnci:page num="670"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I494K3WC0K1MND1VC0000400" appliedby="human" comment="Followed by" letter="f"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S2R-5YM0-003V-B0CF-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#632#3#000638#000883#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_885_5321"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#632#3#000638#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="638 N.Y.S.2d 883"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="885"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360740000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9095"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">People v. Buckmire</emph>, 167 Misc. 2d 581, 638 N.Y.S.2d 883, 885 (N.Y. Sup. Ct. 1995)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. We agree.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_68" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P59" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The purposes of a concealed carry prohibition are often less compelling in settings in which the person bearing the concealed weapon is an owner of the property on which he or she goes armed. Although the <ref:page num="473" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> considerations discussed above are not determinative of the reasonableness of prohibiting a shopkeeper from carrying a concealed weapon, they weigh against the need for applying the CCW statute in such circumstances if the shopkeeper had a substantial interest in exercising a right under Article I, Section 25.  </text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_69" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="805" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P60" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Strict application of the CCW statute in instances when the public interest in enforcing the statute is weak may unreasonably impair a person's right to keep and bear arms when the person's interest in exercising that right through the use of a concealed weapon is substantial. <ref:page num="49" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Our primary concern is examining the CCW prohibition in a circumstance in which the bearing of arms for the purpose of security is the most reasonable and the most necessary.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_70" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3430000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
		    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3430000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <ref:page num="P61" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND34H0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND34H0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>As alluded to above, many states have recognized, either by case law or statute, a special intersection between the right to bear arms and the protection of one's own property. For example, one state court has held that a citizen enjoys a common law right to carry a concealed weapon in the citizen's own home. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="44BM-F940-0039-43BM-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3430000400" status="valid">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3420000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0960000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="27757554" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:case>
			    <lnci:caseinfo>
			      <lnci:casename>
				<lnci:party1 name="Gilio"/>
				<lnci:text txt="v."/>
				<lnci:party2 name="State"/>
			      </lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Okla. Civ. App."/>
			      <lnci:decisiondate txt="2001"/>
			    </lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0970000400">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="19035" value="OK CIV APP"/>
			      <lnci:ldi jumppage="122" kw="4688_2001_122*.122" page="122" pagesuffix="*" reporter="4688" volume="2001"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="2001"/>
			      <lnci:page num="122"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0990000400">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="24366" value="P.3d"/>
			      <lnci:ldi jumppage="941" kw="1742_33_937*.941" page="937" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1742" volume="33"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="33"/>
			      <lnci:page num="937"/>
			      <lnci:pinpoint num="941"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND22C0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4052" value="Okla. Civ. App. LEXIS"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="2001"/>
			      <lnci:page num="93"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND22D0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4588" value="Okla. B.J."/>
			      <lnci:volume num="72"/>
			      <lnci:page num="3100"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			  </lnci:case>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:44BM-F940-0039-43BM-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#24366#3#000033#000937#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_941_4933"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#24366#3#000033#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="33 P.3d 937"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="941"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360770000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9271"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Gilio v. State</emph>, 2001 OK CIV APP 122, 33 P.3d 937, 941 (Okla. Civ. App. 2001)</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>
			<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2100000400" seqnum="9"/>
		      </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND34H0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
		    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND34H0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3510000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3510000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Other courts have recognized either a right to conceal weapons in one's own residence (as opposed to "carry" a concealed weapon in one's own premises), <emph typestyle="un">see </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="42BS-BPC0-0039-41VP-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND34H0000400" status="valid">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND34G0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND09D0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="25709756" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:case>
			    <lnci:caseinfo>
			      <lnci:casename>
				<lnci:party1 name="In re Colby H."/>
			      </lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Md. Ct. App."/>
			      <lnci:decisiondate txt="2001"/>
			    </lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND09F0000400">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="81" value="Md."/>
			      <lnci:ldi jumppage="702" kw="677_362_702*.702" page="702" pagesuffix="*" reporter="677" volume="362"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="362"/>
			      <lnci:page num="702"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND09H0000400">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="434" value="A.2d"/>
			      <lnci:ldi jumppage="646" kw="180_766_639*.646" page="639" pagesuffix="*" reporter="180" volume="766"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="766"/>
			      <lnci:page num="639"/>
			      <lnci:pinpoint lastnum="50" num="646"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND22F0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="703" value="Md. LEXIS"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="2001"/>
			      <lnci:page num="25"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			  </lnci:case>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:42BS-BPC0-0039-41VP-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#434#3#000766#000639#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_646_4902"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#434#3#000766#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="766 A.2d 639"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="646"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607B0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="7704"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">In re Colby H.</emph>, 362 Md. 702, 766 A.2d 639, 646-50 (Md. Ct. App. 2001)</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>
			<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2110000400" seqnum="6"/>
		      </rfc:anchorcite>, or a more general right to keep weapons in one's home, <emph typestyle="un">see</emph>, <emph typestyle="un">e.g.</emph>, <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RRM-X6N0-003F-M13P-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND34H0000400" status="valid">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND34J0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND09M0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="2172089" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:case>
			    <lnci:caseinfo>
			      <lnci:casename>
				<lnci:party1 name="Matthews"/>
				<lnci:text txt="v."/>
				<lnci:party2 name="State"/>
			      </lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Ind."/>
			      <lnci:decisiondate txt="1958"/>
			    </lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND09N0000400">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="322" value="Ind."/>
			      <lnci:ldi jumppage="677" kw="556_237_677*.677" page="677" pagesuffix="*" reporter="556" volume="237"/>

			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND09R0000400">

			      <lnci:volume num="148"/>

			      <lnci:pinpoint num="338"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND22G0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="481" value="Ind. LEXIS"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="1958"/>
			      <lnci:page num="194"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			  </lnci:case>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RRM-X6N0-003F-M13P-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#246#3#000148#000334#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_338_4912"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#246#3#000148#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="148 N.E.2d 334"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="338"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607F0000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="6707"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Matthews v. State</emph>, 237 Ind. 677, 148 N.E.2d 334, 338 (Ind. 1958)</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>
			<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2120000400" seqnum="4"/>
		      </rfc:anchorcite> (holding that provisions of a state law against carrying of a pistol without a license "do not restrict nor prohibit appellant or any other person from having a pistol in his home or 'fixed place of business' <ref:page num="50" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> for the defense of himself . . ."). </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3510000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3510000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>As the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Ohio Supreme Court</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" guid:guid="urn:entity:jb-100000237" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> stated, "The right of defense of self, property and family is a fundamental part of our concept of ordered liberty. . . . For <ref:page num="474" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> many, the mere possession of a firearm in the home offers a source of security." <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3M-0100-003C-805T-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3510000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND34M0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND09V0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="5564085" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="169" kw="1525_616_163*.169" page="163" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1525" volume="616"/>

			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3M-0100-003C-805T-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">

			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2130000400" seqnum="17"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_71" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3530000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3530000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P62" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-Y5J0-003F-Y0DK-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3530000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3520000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0B20000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="5272082" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>

			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>

			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0B30000400">

			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="429" kw="1670_113_429*.429" page="429" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1670" volume="113"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="113"/>
			    <lnci:page num="429"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0B50000400">
