			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-Y5J0-003F-Y0DK-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#221#3#000113#000429#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#221#3#000113#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="113 Or. App. 429"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607K0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9282"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Stevens</emph>, 113 Ore. App. 429, 833 P.2d 318 (Or. App. 1992)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2140000400" seqnum="4"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>, the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Oregon</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102903282" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> Court of Appeals, in determining that the defendant could not be convicted for carrying a concealed switchblade within his own home, held that the state's CCW statute applies only to the carrying of concealed weapons outside one's own home. <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-Y5J0-003F-Y0DK-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3530000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3540000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0B80000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0B20000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0B70000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0B50000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="319" kw="1706_833_318*.319" page="318" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="833"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="319"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26P0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0B30000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="429" kw="1670_113_429*.429" page="429" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1670" volume="113"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26R0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND22J0000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-Y5J0-003F-Y0DK-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000833#000318#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_319_4932"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000833#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="833 P.2d 318"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="319"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607N0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9282"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Id.</emph> at 319</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2150000400" seqnum="4"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. The court reached this decision despite the absence of any express exception in <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Oregon</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102903282" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity>'s CCW statute to this effect, <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0B90000400" normcite="OR. REV. STAT. 166.240" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44244360021" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="166.240"/>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_166.240">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="9201" value="Or. Rev. Stat."/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55GY-M4P0-004F-X031-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#9201#116#   166#   240#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Or. Rev. Stat. � 166.240"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607P0000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9290"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Or. Rev. Stat. � 166.240</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> (2001), and despite <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Oregon</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102903282" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity>'s permit system under which persons may apply to carry a concealed weapon, <emph typestyle="un">see</emph> <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0BB0000400" normcite="OR. REV. STAT. 166.291" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="40628500050" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="166.291"/>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_166.291">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="9201" value="Or. Rev. Stat."/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55GY-M370-004F-X0X6-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#9201#116#   166#   291#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Or. Rev. Stat. � 166.291"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607R0000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9290"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Or. Rev. Stat. � 166.291</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> (2001). </rfc:reasonforciting>The court explained two rationales for this conclusion: </text>
		<blockquote>
		  <p>
		    <ref:anchor id="para_72" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <text>First, the simple act of carrying a concealed switchblade<ref:page num="51" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> within one's own home is not the type of unrestrained rights-exercising that "poses a clear threat" to public safety and that can therefore be regulated. Second, the state's interpretation would restrict the manner in which one could carry a legal weapon from room to room within one's home and would inhibit an act that is so intrinsic to ownership and self-defense that it would unreasonably interfere with the exercise of one's constitutional right to possess the switchblade. </text>
		  </p>
		</blockquote>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_73" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND35K0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND35K0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-Y5J0-003F-Y0DK-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND35K0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND35J0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0BD0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0B20000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="Stevens"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0BC0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0B50000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="319" kw="1706_833_318*.319" page="318" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="833"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="319"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26S0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0B30000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="429" kw="1670_113_429*.429" page="429" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1670" volume="113"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26T0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND22J0000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I494K3WC0K1MND1VD0000400" appliedby="human" comment="Followed by" letter="f"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-Y5J0-003F-Y0DK-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000833#000318#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_319_4932"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000833#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="833 P.2d 318"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="319"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607S0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9282"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Stevens</emph>, 833 P.2d at 319</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2160000400" seqnum="3"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite> (citation omitted). Excepting the reference to switchblades, which are per se illegal under <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> law (<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0BF0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.24" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42786130002" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.24"/>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_941.24()">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32P-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    24#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.24"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607T0000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.24</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite>), we adopt <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Oregon</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102903282" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity>'s reasoning, appreciating its resonance in a state where a person has no option for pursuing official permission to lawfully carry a concealed weapon on his or her own premises.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_74" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P63" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The unreasonableness of applying certain gun regulations when they prohibit sensible conduct on <ref:page num="475" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> one's own property is commonly recognized. As explained by one commentator: </text>
		<blockquote>
		  <p>
		    <ref:anchor id="para_75" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <text>The purpose of statutes prohibiting the carrying of a weapon or the carrying of a concealed weapon except upon one's own premises<ref:page num="52" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> or at his place of business<ref:page num="806" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> [is] to allow persons <emph typestyle="un">to defend those areas in which they have a possessory interest</emph>, yet restrict the right to carry weapons to persons in such a position that they are not likely to be thrown into contact with the public and thus perhaps tempted, in a sudden quarrel, to use the weapon to the detriment of another. </text>
		  </p>
		</blockquote>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_76" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND35N0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND35N0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Ruby B. Weeks, Annotation, <emph typestyle="un">Scope and Effect of Exception, in Statute Forbidding Carrying of Weapons, as to Person on </emph><rfc:anchorcite rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND35N0000400" status="unresolved">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND35M0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0BH0000400" historycite="0" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="7019865" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="His Own Premises or at His Place of Business"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0BJ0000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="831" value="A.L.R.3d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="938" kw="169_57_938*.938" page="938" pagesuffix="*" reporter="169" volume="57"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="57"/>
			    <lnci:page num="938"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/analytical-materials/urn:contentItem:4TST-NV50-02C9-72NN-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#831#3#000057#000938#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="11"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#831#3#000057#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="57 A.L.R.3d 938"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607V0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="338920"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">His Own Premises or at His Place of Business</emph>, 57 A.L.R.3d 938</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>, � 2(a) (1974) (emphasis added). We also note the following analysis of the reasonableness of place and manner restrictions on the use of firearms, such as prohibitions on carrying concealed weapons: </rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
		<blockquote>
		  <p>
		    <ref:anchor id="para_77" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <text>
		      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND35N0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND35N0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      </rfc:reasonforciting>
		    </text>
		  </p>
		  <p>
		    <ref:anchor id="para_78" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <text><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND35N0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND35N0000400_3" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>It might be argued that these laws impede the purpose of self-defense if they deny an individual the right to carry a weapon when he is most likely to be attacked. </rfc:reasonforciting>This argument is countered by two considerations: the danger of widespread presence of weapons <emph typestyle="un">in public places</emph> and police protection against attack in these places. Thus, in view of the benefit to be derived from these laws, place and manner regulations <emph typestyle="un">which do not</emph> <ref:page num="53" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <emph typestyle="un"> restrict possession in homes or businesses</emph> do not seem to subvert unduly the self-defense purpose. </text>
		  </p>
		</blockquote>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_79" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>Ridberg, <emph typestyle="un">supra</emph>, at 204 (emphasis added).</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_80" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P64" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <casesum:headnote headnotesource="lexis-caselaw-editorial" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">
		    <ref:anchor id="clscc11" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <classify:classification classscheme="ln.search-advisor" xmlns:classify="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/classification/1/">
		      <classify:classitem>
			<classify:classitem-identifier>
			  <classify:classcode normval="00000620"/>
			</classify:classitem-identifier>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="score" value="95"/>
			  <metaitem name="versionmajor" value="4"/>
			</meta>
			<classify:classitem-identifier>
			  <classify:classcode normval="00000620"/>
			</classify:classitem-identifier>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="score" value="95"/>
			  <metaitem name="versionmajor" value="5"/>
			</meta>
			<classify:classitem-identifier>
			  <classify:classcode normval="00000620"/>
			</classify:classitem-identifier>
		      </classify:classitem>
		    </classify:classification>
		    <classify:classification classscheme="ln.legal" xmlns:classify="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/classification/1/">

			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:4E6F821962FC4804B4AD3B27A047CE68" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="hnpara_11" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>The importance of being able to exercise the right to bear arms in the setting of one's own property is implied by the language of <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HP0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			      </lnci:constref>
			    </lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>

				  <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				</request>

			  </lnci:cite>.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </casesum:headnote>The importance of being able to exercise the right to bear arms in the setting of one's own property is implied by the language of <lnci:cite ID="I494C3FH0K1MND2X60000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>

		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607X0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>. The amendment enumerates several lawful purposes for <ref:page num="476" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> which one can exercise the right to bear arms. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote29" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n29">29</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_47" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3630000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3630000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><casesum:headnote headnotesource="lexis-caselaw-editorial" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">
			      <ref:anchor id="clscc12" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <classify:classification classscheme="ln.search-advisor" xmlns:classify="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/classification/1/">

				<classify:classitem>
				  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:587A72F39DF74603A08B2F23CE628E1E" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
				</classify:classitem>

				<meta>
				  <metaitem name="ProcessDate" value="09-24-2012 15:10:18"/>
				</meta>
				<classify:classitem>
				  <meta>
				    <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
				    <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
				    <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00004016"/>
				    <metaitem name="InternalName" value="State Constitutional Operation"/>
				  </meta>
				  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:587A72F39DF74603A08B2F23CE628E1E" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
				</classify:classitem>
			      </classify:classification>
			      <bodytext>
				<p>
				  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_12" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				  <text>A court examines three sources in determining a constitutional provision's meaning: the plain meaning of the words in the context used; the constitutional debates and the practices in existence at the time of the writing of the constitution; and the earliest interpretation of the provision by the legislature as manifested in the first law passed following adoption.</text>
				</p>
			      </bodytext>
			    </casesum:headnote>This court generally examines three sources in determining a constitutional provision's meaning: "the plain meaning of the words in the context used; the constitutional debates and the practices in existence at the time of the writing of the constitution; and the earliest interpretation of the provision by the legislature as manifested in the first law passed following adoption." <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-VJ80-003G-3044-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3630000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND35P0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0BR0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6196024" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>

				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>

				  </lnci:caseinfo>

				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="680" kw="2005_199_674*.680" page="674" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="199"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="199"/>
				    <lnci:page num="674"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint num="680"/>
				    <lnci:syllabusnum ID="I4JVTG4Y0K1MNJ4XT0000400" num="4"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0BX0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="123" kw="1572_546_123*.123" page="123" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="546"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="546"/>

				  </lnci:caseref>

				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="1996"/>
				    <lnci:page num="30"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VJ80-003G-3044-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000199#000674#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_680_3491"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000199#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="199 Wis. 2d 674"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="680"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360N10000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Thompson v. Craney</emph>, 199 Wis. 2d 674, 680, 546 N.W.2d 123 (1996)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2170000400" seqnum="3"/>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>.</rfc:reasonforciting>
			</text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_48" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>We focus our attention on the plain language of the term "security" because the last two factors are not particularly helpful to ascertaining the intended meaning of the term "security." There is presently no relevant interpretation of Article I, Section 25 that has been provided by the legislature. As to the debates contemporaneous with the passage of the amendment, there is very little discussion as to the meaning of the term "security." In fact, according to one legislative source, it was freely admitted that "unless there is further clarification in the language of the Constitution, courts will be compelled to interpret the term 'security.'" Memorandum from Shaun Hass, Senior Staff Attorney, Wis. Legis. Council, entitled <emph typestyle="un">Analysis of 1995 Assembly Joint Resolution 53 and 1995 Senate Joint Resolution 7, Relating to the Right to Keep and Bear Arms (First Consideration) to <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> State Representative David Travis and Interested Legislators</emph> (Oct. 11, 1995), at 7 (hereinafter the LCS Memo).</text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_49" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Both the 1995 Legislative Council Staff memo and the Legislative Reference Bureau Drafter's Note to the resolution that became the amendment recommended that the meaning of "security" be clarified with additional language in the amendment, but no such clarification was included. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> 1995 LCS Memo, at 7; Wis. Legis. Reference Bureau, Drafter's Note for 1995 Assemb. Joint Res. 53, at 2, reprinted in <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Wis.</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity> Legis. Reference Bureau, Drafting Record to 1995 Assemb. J. Res. 53. The LCS memo noted that "security" could mean "security of the state" or it could refer to the general security of one's home or business. 1995 LCS Memo, at 7. The authors of these documents failed to reach a conclusion regarding what "security" means, with both stating that the meaning would have to be decided by the judiciary. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> Jeffrey Monks, <emph typestyle="un">The End of Gun Control or Protection Against Tyranny?: The Impact of the New <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> Constitutional Right to Bear Arms on State Gun Control Laws</emph>, <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0CG0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="26268938" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:lawrev>
			      <lnci:lawrevref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0CF0000400">
				<lnci:lawrevlocator>
				  <lnci:publicationname normpubcode="490" value="Wis. L. Rev."/>
				  <lnci:ldi jumppage="271" kw="2004_2001_249*.271" page="249" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2004" volume="2001"/>
				  <lnci:volume num="2001"/>
				  <lnci:page num="249"/>
				  <lnci:pinpoint lastnum="72" num="271"/>
				</lnci:lawrevlocator>
			      </lnci:lawrevref>
			    </lnci:lawrev>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/analytical-materials/urn:contentItem:42YD-9NG0-00CW-H0X7-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#490#2#2001#000249#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_271_8490"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="3"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#490#2#2001#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2001 Wis. L. Rev. 249"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="271"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360N40000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="7368"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext> 2001 Wis. L. Rev. 249, 271-72</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> n.140. </text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> Although Hamdan's conduct could arguably be construed <ref:page num="477" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> as undertaken for the purpose of "defense," we think the circumstances logically point to the purpose of "security."</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_81" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="54" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="807" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P65" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The term "security" is not defined by the amendment, nor is it given any specific meaning elsewhere under <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> law. The relevant legal definition of "security" is "the state of being secure, esp. from danger or attack." <emph typestyle="un">Black's Law Dictionary</emph> 1358 (7th ed. 1999). The applicable definitions of "security" in lay dictionaries are enlightening. Some definitions include: "1. freedom from danger, risk, etc.; safety. . . . 3. something that secures or makes safe; protection; defense. . . . 5. precautions taken to guard against crime, attack, sabotage, espionage, etc." <emph typestyle="un">Random House Unabridged Dictionary</emph> 1731 (2d ed. 1993). <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote30" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n30">30</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_50" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Similarly, "secure" is defined as "1. free from or not exposed to danger or harm; safe. . . . 3. affording safety, as a place[.]" <emph typestyle="un">Random House Unabridged Dictionary</emph> 1731 (2d ed. 1993).</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> Security is also defined as "Something that gives or assures safety, as: . . . c. Measures adopted, <emph typestyle="un">as by a business or homeowner</emph>, to prevent a crime such as burglary or assault[.]" <emph typestyle="un">The American Heritage Dictionary of The English Language</emph> 1632 (3d ed. 1992) (emphasis added).</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_82" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="55" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P66" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <casesum:headnote headnotesource="lexis-caselaw-editorial" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">
		    <ref:anchor id="clscc13" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <classify:classification classscheme="ln.search-advisor" xmlns:classify="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/classification/1/">
		      <classify:classitem>
			<classify:classitem-identifier>
			  <classify:classcode normval="00000620"/>
			</classify:classitem-identifier>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="score" value="94"/>
			  <metaitem name="versionmajor" value="4"/>
			</meta>
			<classify:classitem-identifier>
			  <classify:classcode normval="00000620"/>
			</classify:classitem-identifier>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="score" value="94"/>
			  <metaitem name="versionmajor" value="5"/>
			</meta>
			<classify:classitem-identifier>
			  <classify:classcode normval="00000620"/>
			</classify:classitem-identifier>
		      </classify:classitem>
		    </classify:classification>
		    <classify:classification classscheme="ln.legal" xmlns:classify="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/classification/1/">
		      <meta>
			<metaitem name="ProcessDate" value="09-24-2012 15:10:18"/>
		      </meta>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00000620"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="Right to Bear Arms"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:4E6F821962FC4804B4AD3B27A047CE68" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		    </classify:classification>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="hnpara_13" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>The common understanding of "security" does not implicate an imminent threat. Rather, it connotes a persistent state of peace. The domain most closely associated with a persistent state of peace is one's home or residence, followed by other places in which a person has a possessory interest. A person is less likely to rely on public law enforcement for protection in these premises and is more likely to supply his own protection. In fact, a person who takes no initiative to provide security in these private places is essentially leaving security to chance. Firearms ownership has long been permitted in <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>. The inclusion in <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HR0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			      </lnci:constref>
			    </lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3607Y0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite>of the right to bear arms for security was intended to include a personal right to bear arms to protect one's person, family, or property against unlawful injury and to secure from unlawful interruption the enjoyment of life, limb, family, and property, subject to reasonable regulation.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </casesum:headnote>The common understanding of "security" does not implicate an imminent threat. Rather, it connotes a persistent state of peace. We believe the domain most closely associated with a persistent state <ref:page num="478" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> of peace is one's home or residence, followed by other places in which a person has a possessory interest. A person is less likely to rely on public law enforcement for protection in these premises and is more likely to supply his own protection. In fact, a person who takes no initiative to provide security in these private places is essentially leaving security to chance. Firearms ownership has long been permitted in <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>. We infer that the inclusion in the amendment of the right to bear arms for security was intended "to include a personal right to bear arms to protect one's person, family, or property against unlawful injury and to secure from unlawful interruption the enjoyment of life, limb, family, and property," Dowlut & Knoop, <emph typestyle="un">supra</emph>, at 190, subject to reasonable regulation.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_83" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P67" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3650000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3650000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Based on the foregoing considerations, we conclude that <casesum:headnote headnotesource="lexis-caselaw-editorial" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">

			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:4E6F821962FC4804B4AD3B27A047CE68" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:C75CDBC599A749E28E5D4CFDE7FD5757" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

			    <metaitem name="InternalName" value="Police Powers"/>
			  </meta>
			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:5A506C7EE952463FADC713DBB3AC9B51" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			</classify:classitem>
		      </classify:classification>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_14" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>A citizen's desire to exercise the right to keep and bear arms for purposes of security is at its apex when undertaken to secure one's home or privately owned business. Conversely, the State's interest in prohibiting concealed weapons is least compelling in these circumstances because application of the carrying a concealed weapon statute, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HS0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:stat>
				<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
				</lnci:statref>
			      </lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360800000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> (1999-2000), has but a tenuous relation to alleviation of the State's acknowledged interests. If the restriction of a private right is oppressive, while the public welfare is enhanced only to a slight degree, the offending statute is void as an invalid exercise of the police power.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </casesum:headnote>a citizen's desire to exercise the right to keep and bear arms for purposes of security is at its apex when undertaken<ref:page num="56" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> to secure one's home or privately owned business. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3670000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3670000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><footnote>
			<ref:anchor id="fn_fnote31" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<label alt-content="n31">31</label>
			<bodytext>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_51" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>Our decision today recognizes that the reasonableness of enforcing general gun regulations becomes uniquely suspect in certain settings, but <lnci:cite ID="I494C5K40K1MND0DF0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:constitution>
				  <lnci:constinfo>
				    <lnci:hier>
				      <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
					<lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
				      </lnci:hierlev>
				    </lnci:hier>
				  </lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
				    <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
				  </lnci:constref>
				</lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360N50000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite> does not transform the right to bear arms in these locations into an absolute right.</text>
			  </p>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_52" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>
			      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND36G0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND36G0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The State retains the ability regulate gun ownership, use, possession, and transportation of firearms even with respect to matters occurring in one's home or place of business. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph>, <emph typestyle="un">e.g.</emph>, <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RX3-WBS0-003C-G1SJ-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND36G0000400" status="valid">
				  <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND36F0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				  <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0D60000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6452161" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				    <lnci:case>
				      <lnci:caseinfo>
					<lnci:casename>
					  <lnci:party1 name="Gibson"/>
					  <lnci:text txt="v."/>
					  <lnci:party2 name="State"/>
					</lnci:casename>
					<lnci:jurisinfo txt="Alaska Ct. App."/>
					<lnci:decisiondate txt="1997"/>
				      </lnci:caseinfo>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0D70000400">
					<lnci:reporter normpubcode="499" value="P.2d"/>
					<lnci:ldi jumppage="1302" kw="1706_930_1300*.1302" page="1300" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="930"/>
					<lnci:volume num="930"/>
					<lnci:page num="1300"/>
					<lnci:pinpoint num="1302"/>
				      </lnci:caseref>
				      <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND22P0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
					<lnci:reporter normpubcode="3848" value="Alas. App. LEXIS"/>
					<lnci:volume num="1997"/>
					<lnci:page num="3"/>
				      </lnci:caseref>
				    </lnci:case>
				    <lnci:content>
				      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RX3-WBS0-003C-G1SJ-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
					<request xmlns="">
					  <parameters>
					    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000930#001300#"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_1302_4932"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000930#"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="930 P.2d 1300"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="1302"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360N70000400"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="3823"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					  </parameters>
					  <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Gibson v. State</emph>, 930 P.2d 1300, 1302 (Alaska Ct. App. 1997)</linktext>
					</request>
				      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				    </lnci:content>
				  </lnci:cite>
				  <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21B0000400" seqnum="1"/>
				</rfc:anchorcite> (rejecting defendants' as-applied challenge to the constitutionality of their convictions for possessing a firearm while impaired by intoxicating liquor, stating that "people who handle firearms while intoxicated, even in their own homes, pose a significant threat to the health and safety of their family members, their neighbors and themselves."). </rfc:reasonforciting>
			    </text>
			  </p>
			</bodytext>
		      </footnote> Conversely, the State's interest <ref:page num="479" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> in prohibiting concealed weapons is least compelling in these circumstances, because application of the CCW statute "has but a tenuous relation to alleviation" of the State's acknowledged interests. <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S4X-9G70-003B-S24T-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3650000400" status="valid">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3640000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0CM0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="3159543" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			  <lnci:case>
			    <lnci:caseinfo>
			      <lnci:casename>
				<lnci:party1 name="Moore"/>
				<lnci:text txt="v."/>
				<lnci:party2 name="East Cleveland"/>
			      </lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:decisiondate txt="1977"/>
			    </lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0CN0000400">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="52" value="U.S."/>
			      <lnci:ldi jumppage="500" kw="1917_431_494*.500" page="494" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1917" volume="431"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="431"/>
			      <lnci:page num="494"/>
			      <lnci:pinpoint num="500"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0CT0000400">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="285" value="L. Ed. 2d"/>
			      <lnci:ldi jumppage="531" kw="628_52_531*.531" page="531" pagesuffix="*" reporter="628" volume="52"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="52"/>
			      <lnci:page num="531"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0CW0000400">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="656" value="S. Ct."/>
			      <lnci:ldi jumppage="1932" kw="1805_97_1932*.1932" page="1932" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1805" volume="97"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="97"/>
			      <lnci:page num="1932"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND22M0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4112" value="U.S. LEXIS"/>
			      <lnci:volume num="1977"/>
			      <lnci:page num="17"/>
			    </lnci:caseref>
			  </lnci:case>
			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S4X-9G70-003B-S24T-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			      <request xmlns="">
				<parameters>
				  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#52#3#000431#000494#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_500_1100"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#52#3#000431#"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="431 U.S. 494"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="500"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360820000400"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="6443"/>
				  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				</parameters>
				<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Moore v. East Cleveland</emph>, 431 U.S. 494, 500, 52 L. Ed. 2d 531, 97 S. Ct. 1932 (1977)</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>
			<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2180000400" seqnum="3"/>
		      </rfc:anchorcite> (Powell, J., plurality opinion). </rfc:reasonforciting></rfc:reasonforciting><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3670000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3670000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>As stated recently by the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>New Hampshire Supreme Court</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" guid:guid="urn:entity:jb-100000218" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity>, "If the restriction of a private right is oppressive, while the public welfare is enhanced only [to a] slight degree, the offending statute is void <ref:page num="808" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> as an invalid exercise of the police power." <rfc:anchorcite lni="445J-PMS0-0039-44CV-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3670000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3660000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0D00000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="27593293" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="Kennedy"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Town of Sunapee"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="N.H."/>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="2001"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0D10000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="540" value="N.H."/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="79" kw="1539_147_79*.79" page="79" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1539" volume="147"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="147"/>
			    <lnci:page num="79"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0D30000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="434" value="A.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="688" kw="180_784_685*.688" page="685" pagesuffix="*" reporter="180" volume="784"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="784"/>
			    <lnci:page num="685"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="688"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND22N0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4017" value="N.H. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="2001"/>
			    <lnci:page num="175"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:445J-PMS0-0039-44CV-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#434#3#000784#000685#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_688_4902"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#434#3#000784#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="784 A.2d 685"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="688"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360870000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="373135"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Kennedy v. Town of Sunapee</emph>, 147 N.H. 79, 784 A.2d 685, 688 (N.H. 2001)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2190000400" seqnum="6"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite> (internal quotations omitted). </rfc:reasonforciting>We believe that the CCW statute, by virtue of its application under the facts of this case, suffers from this infirmity.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_84" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="57" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P68" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> If the constitutional right to keep and bear arms for security is to mean anything, it must, as a general matter, permit a person to possess, carry, and sometimes conceal arms to maintain the security of his private residence or privately operated business, and to safely move and store weapons within these premises.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_85" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P69" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In addition to weighing the public interest in enforcing the CCW statute against an individual's interest in exercising the right to keep and bear arms by carrying a concealed weapon, a court must assess whether an individual could have exercised the right in a reasonable, alternative manner that did not violate the statute.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_86" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>

		    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND36J0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

			      <lnci:volume num="199"/>

			    </lnci:caseref>
			    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0DF0000400">

			  <lnci:content>
			    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VJB0-003G-304C-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

				<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Brandmiller v. Arreola</emph>, 199 Wis. 2d 528, 544 N.W.2d 894 (1996)</linktext>
			      </request>

			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>
			<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21C0000400" seqnum="8"/>
		      </rfc:anchorcite>. <casesum:headnote headnotesource="lexis-caselaw-editorial" xmlns:casesum="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/case-summary/1/">

			  <classify:classitem>
			    <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:77F9EF34EE6D41B09E7BD7B4FFF1650A" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

			    <metaitem name="ProcessDate" value="09-24-2012 15:10:18"/>
			  </meta>
			  <classify:classitem>
			    <meta>
			      <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			      <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			      <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00000585"/>
			      <metaitem name="InternalName" value="General Overview"/>
			    </meta>
			    <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:77F9EF34EE6D41B09E7BD7B4FFF1650A" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </classify:classitem>
			  <classify:classitem>

			      <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>

			      <metaitem name="InternalName" value="Right to Bear Arms"/>
			    </meta>
			    <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:4E6F821962FC4804B4AD3B27A047CE68" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

			    </meta>
			    <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:5A506C7EE952463FADC713DBB3AC9B51" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </classify:classitem>

			<bodytext>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="hnpara_15" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>Applying intermediate scrutiny to an "as applied" constitutional challenge, the test for whether statutes or ordinances that restrict a fundamental right are constitutional is whether they leave open ample alternative channels by which the citizen may exercise the affected right. In circumstances where the State's interest in restricting the right to keep and bear arms is minimal and the private interest in exercising the right is substantial, an individual needs a way to exercise the right without violating the law. In these circumstances, regulations limiting a constitutional right to keep and bear arms must leave some realistic alternative means to exercise the right.</text>
			  </p>
			</bodytext>
		      </casesum:headnote>Applying intermediate scrutiny to an "as applied" constitutional challenge, we stated that, under this level of scrutiny, the test for whether statutes or ordinances that restrict a fundamental right are constitutional is <ref:page num="480" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> whether they leave "open ample alternative channels by which the citizen may exercise" the affected right. </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND36M0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND36M0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-VJB0-003G-304C-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND36M0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND36K0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0DJ0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0DB0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0DH0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0DC0000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="541" kw="2005_199_528*.541" page="528" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="199"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="541"/>
			    <lnci:syllabusnum ID="I4JVTG4Y0K1MNJ4XW0000400" num="4"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26V0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0DF0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="894" kw="1572_544_894*.894" page="894" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="544"/>
			    <lnci:syllabusnum ID="I4JVTG4Y0K1MNJ4XX0000400" num="4"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND26W0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND22R0000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VJB0-003G-304C-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000199#000528#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_541_3491"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000199#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="199 Wis. 2d 528"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="541"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608B0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Id.</emph> at 541</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21D0000400" seqnum="8"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_87" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P71" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In circumstances where the State's<ref:page num="58" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> interest in restricting the right to keep and bear arms is minimal and the private interest in exercising the right is substantial, an individual needs a way to exercise the right without violating the law. We hold, in these circumstances, that regulations limiting a constitutional right to keep and bear arms must leave <emph typestyle="un">some</emph> realistic alternative means to exercise the right.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_88" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P72" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> For instance, in order to keep and bear arms for the purpose of securing one's own property, a weapon must be kept somewhere and may need to be handled or moved, all within the weapon owner's property. During these times, the firearm will be either visible or concealed. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND36P0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND36P0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The State argues that even under the strictest enforcement of the CCW statute, a person lawfully in possession of a firearm will always retain the ability to keep the firearm in the open--holding the weapon in the open, keeping the weapon in a visible holster, displaying the weapon on the wall, <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote32" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n32">32</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_53" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>
			    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND36S0000400">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND36S0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3710000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3710000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The State points to <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-X7K0-003G-30MM-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND36S0000400" status="valid">
				  <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND36R0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
