				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360NK0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite>, this analysis in <emph typestyle="un">Mata</emph> is suspect. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND37V0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND37V0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>It is incomplete because it predates the adoption of <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
				<globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
				<globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			      </globalentity:entity>'s constitutional right to bear arms amendment and, therefore, did not attempt to reconcile the CCW statute with the tavern owner's constitutional right to bear arms for security. The countervailing policy arguments relied on in <emph typestyle="un">Mata</emph> take on a different gloss in the shadow of this provision. We believe, for the reasons expressed in the body of this opinion, that the <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-X7K0-003G-30MM-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND37V0000400" status="valid">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND37T0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<lnci:cite ID="I494KC4W0K1MND1KH0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0DV0000400" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				  <lnci:case>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I494KJKJ0K1MND3TY0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0DW0000400">
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="315" kw="2005_199_315*.315" page="315" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="199"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I494KJKJ0K1MND3TX0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0DY0000400">
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="578" kw="1572_544_578*.578" page="578" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="544"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I494KC4W0K1MND1KJ0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND22Y0000400"/>
				  </lnci:case>
				  <lnci:metadata>
				    <lnci:precedent>
				      <lnci:editletter ID="I494K3WC0K1MND1VF0000400" appliedby="human" comment="Overruled in part by" letter="op"/>
				    </lnci:precedent>
				  </lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:content>
				    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-X7K0-003G-30MM-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				      <request xmlns="">
					<parameters>
					  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000199#000315#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000199#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="199 Wis. 2d 315"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360NM0000400"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10984"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					</parameters>
					<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Mata</emph>
					</linktext>
				      </request>
				    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				  </lnci:content>
				</lnci:cite>
			      </rfc:anchorcite> opinion is now incorrect in its assessment of the reasonableness of requiring the open display of guns. </rfc:reasonforciting></text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> or otherwise <ref:page num="481" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> placing the weapon in <ref:page num="809" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> plain view. Relying on this reasoning, the State quarrels with any legal conclusion that application of the CCW statute to Hamdan in his circumstance rendered his rights illusory. <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote33" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n33">33</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_55" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>The State selectively recounts the circumstances surrounding Hamdan's CCW conviction to minimize his interests in providing security to his store. According to the State, "Hamdan carried a pistol in his pocket in a retail establishment accessible to the public and continued to do so while he spoke with the police officers who were inspecting his store. The State's interest in enforcing the CCW law is sufficiently great under these circumstances that the requirement that Hamdan carry his gun openly is a modest and reasonable limitation on his right to bear arms, one that survives [] the reasonableness standard . . . ."</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> <emph typestyle="un">See</emph>, <emph typestyle="un">e.g.</emph> <ref:page num="59" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> , <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RRM-TC70-003C-74M0-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND36P0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND36N0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0DM0000400" historycite="0" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="2102069" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt=" v. "/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Nieto"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0DN0000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="642" value="Ohio St."/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="409" kw="1632_101_409*.409" page="409" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1632" volume="101"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="101"/>
			    <lnci:page num="409"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0DR0000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="627" value="N.E."/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="664" kw="1524_130_663*.664" page="663" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1524" volume="130"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="130"/>
			    <lnci:page num="663"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="664"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND22S0000400" exclude="1" generated="0">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="531" value="Ohio LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1920"/>
			    <lnci:page num="112"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RRM-TC70-003C-74M0-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#627#3#000130#000663#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_664_4911"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#627#3#000130#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="130 N.E. 663"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="664"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608F0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9249"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Nieto</emph>, 101 Ohio St. 409, 130 N.E. 663, 664, 18 Ohio L. Rep. 287, 18 Ohio L. Rep. 513 (Ohio 1920)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21F0000400" seqnum="7"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite> ("[CCW] statute does not operate as a prohibition against carrying weapons, but as a regulation of the manner of carrying them. The gist of the offense is the concealment").</rfc:reasonforciting></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_89" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P73" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> We cannot agree. Requiring a storeowner who desires security <emph typestyle="un">on his own business property</emph> to <ref:page num="482" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> carry a gun openly or in a holster is simply not reasonable. Such practices would alert criminals to the presence of the weapon and frighten friends and customers. Likewise, requiring the gun owner to leave a handgun in plain view in his or her store so that he or she avoids a CCW charge fails the litmus test of common sense. We do not think it is necessary to spell<ref:page num="61" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> out the dangers created by making firearms <emph typestyle="un">more</emph> accessible to children, to assailants, to strangers, and to guests. In fact, leaving a firearm in the open could expose a gun owner to other liability, both criminal and civil. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0F80000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 948.55" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="41332870035" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="948.55"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_948.55()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G4N0-004G-W4NC-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000948#    55#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 948.55"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608J0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. �� 948.55</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> (prohibiting the leaving of a loaded firearm within the reach or easy access of a child) and <lnci:cite ID="I494C5K40K1MND47J0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. STAT. 947.01" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44191870023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="947.01"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="947.01">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G4N0-004G-W4KT-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000947#    01#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 947.01"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608K0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>947.01</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> (prohibiting disorderly conduct).</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_90" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P74" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> There is no dispute that most storeowners have the right to possess a firearm. As a practical matter, the storeowner who keeps a firearm for security must have the gun within easy reach. Requiring a storeowner to openly display weapons as the only available means of exercising the right to keep and bear arms for security is impractical, unsettling, and possibly dangerous. If the State prosecutes a storeowner for having a concealed weapon within easy reach, it is strongly discouraging the use of firearms for security and is practically nullifying the right to do so. Such a prosecution is very likely to impair the constitutional right to bear arms for security. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote34" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n34">34</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_56" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND38F0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND38F0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>In her dissent, the Chief Justice concludes that, in <emph typestyle="un">all</emph> instances, the "right to bear arms 'is not impaired by requiring individuals to carry weapons openly.'" Dissent, P124 (quoting <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RX3-XP10-003F-T13C-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND38F0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND38D0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FB0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="4681543" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="Dano"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="Collins"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Ariz. Ct. App."/>
				    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1990"/>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FC0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="529" value="Ariz."/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="322" kw="211_166_322*.322" page="322" pagesuffix="*" reporter="211" volume="166"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="166"/>
				    <lnci:page num="322"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FF0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="499" value="P.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="1022" kw="1706_802_1021*.1022" page="1021" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="802"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="802"/>
				    <lnci:page num="1021"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint lastnum="23" num="1022"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2300000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="3839" value="Ariz. App. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="1990"/>
				    <lnci:page num="102"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2310000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="436" value="Ariz. Adv. Rep."/>
				    <lnci:volume num="57"/>
				    <lnci:page num="35"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RX3-XP10-003F-T13C-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000802#001021#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_1022_4932"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000802#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="802 P.2d 1021"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="1022"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360NR0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="4306"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Dano v. Collins</emph>, 166 Ariz. 322, 802 P.2d 1021, 1022-23 (Ariz. Ct. App. 1990))</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21N0000400" seqnum="5"/>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>. In reaching this conclusion, she questions this opinion's "views about human psychology." Dissent, P127-129. The dissent also concludes implicitly, if not explicitly, that no enforcement of the CCW statute, as presently written, will unreasonably infringe upon a broadly worded constitutional right to keep and bear arms.</rfc:reasonforciting>
			</text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_57" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Under the CCW statute, it is technically unlawful for a homeowner to conceal a weapon in a nightstand within reach of the homeowner's bed. The law is simply not enforced in this situation, just as it is not enforced in many places when a storekeeper conceals a weapon near a cash register. </text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_91" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="62" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="483" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P75" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Overall, we believe that requiring the continuous, open carrying of a firearm in one's business would effectively eviscerate <lnci:cite ID="I494C5K40K1MND4CP0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608M0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> and lead to undesirable consequences. Under the view of the State and the Chief Justice, a storeowner either must sacrifice the exercise of his right to use arms for security or must <ref:page num="810" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> put himself and others at risk by openly displaying the weapon.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_92" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>

			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:4E6F821962FC4804B4AD3B27A047CE68" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:39B976ACAE4C4839990528F14E59A34D" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

			    <metaitem name="InternalName" value="General Overview"/>
			  </meta>
			  <topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:C75CDBC599A749E28E5D4CFDE7FD5757" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			</classify:classitem>
		      </classify:classification>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="hnpara_16" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text><lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HT0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608P0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> expressly limits the right to keep and bear arms to "lawful purposes." Therefore, a defendant is not entitled to assert a constitutional defense to a carrying a concealed weapon charge, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HV0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:stat>
				<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
				</lnci:statref>
			      </lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608R0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> (1999-2000), if he or she carried a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose. Carrying a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose, even if a defendant were able to satisfy the two other tests for an unreasonable restriction, is not protected by <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HW0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608S0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite>.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </casesum:headnote>expressly limits the right to keep and bear arms to "lawful purposes." Therefore, a defendant is not entitled to assert a constitutional defense to a CCW charge if he or she carried a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose. <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote35" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n35">35</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_58" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text><emph typestyle="un">Cf. </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="471B-24B0-0039-43M1-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND38H0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND38G0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FJ0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="30244546" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="Schelin"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Wash."/>
				    <lnci:decisiondate txt="2002"/>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FK0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="114" value="Wn.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="562" kw="1990_147_562*.562" page="562" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1990" volume="147"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="147"/>
				    <lnci:page num="562"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FN0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="24366" value="P.3d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="639" kw="1742_55_632*.639" page="632" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1742" volume="55"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="55"/>
				    <lnci:page num="632"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint num="639"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2320000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4126" value="Wash. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="2002"/>
				    <lnci:page num="660"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:471B-24B0-0039-43M1-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#24366#3#000055#000632#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_639_4933"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#24366#3#000055#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="55 P.3d 632"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="639"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360NV0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10840"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Schelin</emph>, 147 Wn.2d 562, 55 P.3d 632, 639 (Wash. 2002)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21P0000400" seqnum="12"/>
			    </rfc:anchorcite> (holding that constitutionally protected right to bear firearms in his home ceases when the purpose of bearing firearms is to further the commission of a crime).</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> Carrying a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose, even if a defendant were able to satisfy the two other tests for an unreasonable restriction, is not protected by the amendment.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">

			<classify:classitem-identifier>
			  <classify:classcode normval="00004921"/>
			</classify:classitem-identifier>
		      </classify:classitem>
		    </classify:classification>
		    <classify:classification classscheme="ln.legal" xmlns:classify="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/classification/1/">
		      <meta>
			<metaitem name="ProcessDate" value="09-24-2012 15:10:18"/>
		      </meta>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>

			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:4E6F821962FC4804B4AD3B27A047CE68" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="false"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00000879"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="General Overview"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:0E5390F82F7D4C2DBD06E44166387A29" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00000880"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="General Overview"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:39B976ACAE4C4839990528F14E59A34D" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00004975"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="General Overview"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:C75CDBC599A749E28E5D4CFDE7FD5757" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="false"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00004921"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="Purpose"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:FF06ADED1BFA413994980F3253E045B6" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		    </classify:classification>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="hnpara_17" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Whether a defendant carried a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose is a question of fact, as it may involve a state of mind for which competing evidence is necessary. This inquiry requires a determination of the individual's purpose for carrying the concealed weapon. Carrying a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose means carrying a concealed weapon in furtherance of the commission of a crime. To overcome a constitutional defense, the State has the burden of alleging that a defendant had a specific criminal purpose and of presenting evidence that the defendant carried the concealed weapon for that unlawful purpose. If the court determines that the alleged intent is criminal in nature and if the State meets its burden of producing evidence sufficient to raise the issue of that intent, then the court will instruct the trier of fact to determine if the unlawful purpose was held by the defendant while he carried the concealed weapon. If the trier of fact determines the allegation is true, a defendant will be precluded from successfully availing himself of any constitutional challenge to a carrying a concealed weapon (CCW) conviction. If it determines otherwise, then the unconstitutionality of enforcing the CCW statute, <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HX0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684"/>
			      </lnci:statref>
			    </lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608T0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> (1999-2000), against the defendant remains, and no further verdict regarding the elements of the CCW offense need be answered.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </casesum:headnote>Whether a defendant carried a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose is a question of fact, as it may involve a state of mind for which competing evidence is necessary. This inquiry requires a determination <ref:page num="484" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> of the individual's purpose for carrying the concealed weapon. In this inquiry, carrying a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose means carrying a concealed weapon in furtherance of the commission of a crime.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_94" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P78" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> To overcome a constitutional defense that has been approved by the court, the State has the burden of alleging that a defendant had a specific criminal purpose and of presenting evidence that the defendant carried the concealed weapon for that unlawful purpose. If the court determines that the alleged intent is criminal in nature and if the State meets its burden of producing evidence sufficient to raise the issue of that intent, then the court will instruct the trier of fact to determine if the particular unlawful purpose was actually held by the defendant while he or she carried the concealed weapon. If the trier of fact determines such an allegation to be true, a defendant will be precluded from successfully availing himself or herself of any<ref:page num="64" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> constitutional challenge to a CCW conviction. If it determines otherwise, then the unconstitutionality of enforcing the CCW statute against the defendant remains, and no further verdict regarding the elements of the CCW offense need be answered. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote36" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n36">36</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_59" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>If a court determines as a matter of law that an "as applied" challenge would fail (even assuming that a defendant did not carry a concealed weapon for an unlawful purpose), then there is no need to submit to the trier of fact a question on the defendant's unlawful purpose. While a lawful purpose is a necessary predicate for these challenges, it is not a sufficient condition.</text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_60" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Chief Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Abrahamson</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>'s dissent confuses the role of the inquiry into an unlawful purpose. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> dissent, P134-137 & accompanying footnotes. Of course, there will be instances when a defendant has multiple purposes for carrying a concealed weapon. The dispositive issue is whether the defendant had <emph typestyle="un">an</emph> unlawful purpose, irrespective of whether he or she had a concurrent lawful purpose. For example, a convicted felon who carries a weapon, concealed or not, for his security <emph typestyle="un">is</emph> acting in furtherance of a crime and may not avail himself of a constitutional defense. </text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_95" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="65" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="485" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> VII. APPLICATION OF PRINCIPLES</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_96" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P79" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Having examined the principles involved in an "as applied" challenge to the prosecution of a CCW violation, we now apply those principles to Hamdan's case. We acknowledge that the State proved all three elements of the CCW statute. Hamdan went armed with a dangerous weapon when he carried a gun in his trousers pocket. He was aware of the presence of the weapon. Because the <ref:page num="811" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> weapon was in his pocket and not visible, it was concealed.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_97" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P80" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In determining whether, under the circumstances of this case, it was unreasonable for the State to impair Hamdan's right to bear arms by punishing him for carrying a concealed weapon, we reach two legal conclusions. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote37" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n37">37</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_61" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND38Y0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND38Y0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Both the dissent and Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Crooks</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100057874" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity>' concurrence/dissent consider it odd that we assess the merits of a constitutional challenge as a legal question, versus one of fact. However, this court has previously developed tests for determining whether prosecution of a defendant under an otherwise-valid statute impermissibility infringes upon a constitutionally protected right. For example, in <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-VJ10-003G-302R-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND38Y0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND38J0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FS0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6257048" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="Miller"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1996"/>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FT0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="56" kw="2005_202_56*.56" page="56" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="202"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="202"/>
				    <lnci:page num="56"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FW0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="235" kw="1572_549_235*.235" page="235" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="549"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="549"/>
				    <lnci:page num="235"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2330000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="1996"/>
				    <lnci:page num="77"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VJ10-003G-302R-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000202#000056#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000202#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="202 Wis. 2d 56"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360NW0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Miller</emph>, 202 Wis. 2d 56, 549 N.W.2d 235 (1996)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>, we addressed an as applied challenge to a statutory requirement to display a red and orange triangular, slow-moving vehicle emblem on horse-drawn buggies used by members of the Old Order Amish. We stated: </rfc:reasonforciting>
			</text>
			<blockquote>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_62" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>
			      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND38Y0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND38Y0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<mock-para-break/>
			      </rfc:reasonforciting>
			    </text>
			  </p>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_63" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>We will apply the compelling state interest/least restrictive alternative test to our review of this claim that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0FY0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 347.245" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="45002810018" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:stat>
				  <lnci:statinfo>
				    <lnci:hier>
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="347.245">
					<lnci:hierlev label="subsection" num="1"/>
				      </lnci:hierlev>
				    </lnci:hier>
				  </lnci:statinfo>
				  <lnci:statref normcite="_347.245(1)()">
				    <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
				  </lnci:statref>
				</lnci:stat>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G490-004G-W3SN-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000347#   245#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 347.245"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360NY0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 347.245(1)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>, as applied to the eight Amish respondents, violates freedom of exercise and freedom of conscience under <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0G00000400" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 18" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44396850009" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:constitution>
				  <lnci:constinfo>
				    <lnci:hier>
				      <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
					<lnci:hierlev label="section" num="18"/>
				      </lnci:hierlev>
				    </lnci:hier>
				  </lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:constref normcite="I_18">
				    <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
				  </lnci:constref>
				</lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3W0-004G-W34N-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000018#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,18"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360P00000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext>Art. I, � 18 of the Wisconsin Constitution</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>. Succinctly stated, under this analysis, the challenger carries the burden to prove: (1) that he or she has a sincerely held religious belief, (2) that is burdened by application of the state law at issue. Upon such proof, the burden shifts to the State to prove: (3) that the law is based on a compelling state interest, (4) which cannot be served by a less restrictive alternative. </text>
			  </p>
			</blockquote>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_64" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3910000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3910000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3910000400" status="unresolved">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3900000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0G20000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0FS0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0G10000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0FT0000400">
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="66" kw="2005_202_56*.66" page="56" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="202"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint num="66"/>
				    <lnci:syllabusnum ID="I4JVTG4Y0K1MNJ4Y10000400" num="2"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2720000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0FW0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="235" kw="1572_549_235*.235" page="235" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="549"/>
				    <lnci:syllabusnum ID="I4JVTG4Y0K1MNJ4Y20000400" num="3"/>
				    <lnci:syllabusnum ID="I4JVTG4Y0K1MNJ4Y30000400" num="4"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2730000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND2330000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VJ10-003G-302R-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000202#000056#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_66_3491"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000202#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="202 Wis. 2d 56"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="66"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360P10000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Id.</emph> at 66</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>The court treated these as matters to be determined by the court. To be sure, challenges to the state constitutional right to keep and bear arms amendment involve a "reasonable restriction" test and not strict scrutiny, but they are still challenges based on a constitutional right.</text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_65" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3930000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3930000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Furthermore, as <emph typestyle="un">Miller</emph> itself indicated, the second legal element in the test that we adopt--the issue of whether some reasonable alternative means for exercising the right exists--is a legal question. In <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-VJB0-003G-304C-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3930000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3920000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0G40000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6187094" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="Brandmiller"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="Arreola"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1996"/>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0G50000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="528" kw="2005_199_528*.528" page="528" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="199"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="199"/>
				    <lnci:page num="528"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0G70000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="894" kw="1572_544_894*.894" page="894" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="544"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="544"/>
				    <lnci:page num="894"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2340000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="1996"/>
				    <lnci:page num="19"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VJB0-003G-304C-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000199#000528#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000199#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="199 Wis. 2d 528"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360P20000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Brandmiller v. Arreola</emph>, 199 Wis. 2d 528, 544 N.W.2d 894 (1996)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21R0000400" seqnum="8"/>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>, this court asked whether a cruising ordinance left open ample alternative channels for exercising the right at issue (right to travel) and framed this issue as a legal question that it (this court) resolved.</rfc:reasonforciting>
			</text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_66" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>The Chief Justice also opines that, by addressing Hamdan's constitutional challenge as primarily a legal question, we "turn our precedent on its head" by permitting "a court, not the jury, to reach substantive conclusions about the merits of a defendant's constitutional defense . . . ." Dissent, P135. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND39H0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39H0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The cases that the Chief Justice offers to support this position deal with <lnci:cite ID="I494C5K40K1MND4GF0000400" loadable="1" normcite="U.S. CONST. AMEND. 1" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="11984088" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="catchword" num="amend.">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="number" num="1"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="amend._1">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="7492" value="U.S. Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:content popname="1">
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/contentstore/statutes-legislation" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#7492#207#        1 #"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="38"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="U.S. Const. AMEND. 1"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360P40000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="filters" fixed=""/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>First Amendment</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> issues of obscenity and "true threats." Dissent, PP133-134. In the obscenity cases, courts define the legal parameters of "obscenity," and therefore the constitutional limits of the right to free speech. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND39K0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39K0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S4X-CSN0-003B-S25C-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND39H0000400" status="valid">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39G0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0GC0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="2821685" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				  <lnci:case>
				    <lnci:caseinfo>
				      <lnci:casename>
					<lnci:party1 name="Miller"/>
					<lnci:text txt="v."/>
					<lnci:party2 name="California"/>
				      </lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:decisiondate txt="1973"/>
				    </lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0GD0000400">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="52" value="U.S."/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="15" kw="1917_413_15*.15" page="15" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1917" volume="413"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="413"/>
				      <lnci:page num="15"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0GG0000400">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="285" value="L. Ed. 2d"/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="419" kw="628_37_419*.419" page="419" pagesuffix="*" reporter="628" volume="37"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="37"/>
				      <lnci:page num="419"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0GJ0000400">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="656" value="S. Ct."/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="2607" kw="1805_93_2607*.2607" page="2607" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1805" volume="93"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="93"/>
				      <lnci:page num="2607"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2350000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4112" value="U.S. LEXIS"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="1973"/>
				      <lnci:page num="149"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2360000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="1026" value="Media L. Rep. (BNA)"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="1"/>
				      <lnci:page num="1441"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				  </lnci:case>
				  <lnci:metadata>
				    <lnci:precedent>
				      <lnci:editletter ID="I494K3WC0K1MND1X70000400" appliedby="human" comment="Distinguished by" letter="d"/>
				    </lnci:precedent>
				  </lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:content>
				    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S4X-CSN0-003B-S25C-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				      <request xmlns="">
					<parameters>
					  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#52#3#000413#000015#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#52#3#000413#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="413 U.S. 15"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360P50000400"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="6443"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					</parameters>
					<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Miller v. California</emph>, 413 U.S. 15, 37 L. Ed. 2d 419, 93 S. Ct. 2607 (1973)</linktext>
				      </request>
				    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				  </lnci:content>
				</lnci:cite>
				<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21S0000400" seqnum="10"/>
			      </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting></rfc:reasonforciting><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND39K0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39K0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>In the context of <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity>'s constitutional right to bear arms, the issue is not whether a community standard, such as the "prurient interest," is met as a prerequisite to finding "obscenity." Rather, the only issue is the reasonableness of a restriction on the right. Furthermore, with regards to our "true threat" cases, this court has concluded, without submitting the determination to a jury, that a defendant's statement constituted a "true threat" as a matter of law. <rfc:anchorcite lni="434B-YPR0-0039-43S2-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND39K0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39J0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0GN0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="26536939" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>

				      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="A.S."/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0GP0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="23642" value="WI"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="48" kw="1327_2001_48*.48" page="48" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2001"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="2001"/>
				    <lnci:page num="48"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint lastnum="25" num="P23"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0GV0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="173" kw="2005_243_173*.173" page="173" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="243"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="243"/>
				    <lnci:page num="173"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0GX0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="712" kw="1572_626_712*.712" page="712" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="626"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="626"/>

				    <lnci:volume num="2001"/>
				    <lnci:page num="382"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:434B-YPR0-0039-43S2-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2001#000048#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PNUM_23_3481"/>

				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. A.S.</emph>, 2001 WI 48, PP23-25, 243 Wis. 2d 173, 626 N.W.2d 712</linktext>
				    </request>

				</lnci:content>

			      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21T0000400" seqnum="13"/>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>.</rfc:reasonforciting></text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_67" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND39V0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39V0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>As Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Bablitch</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100041936" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity> correctly notes in his concurrence, "constitutional facts are determined by the court." Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Bablitch</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100041936" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity>'s concurrence, P96; <emph typestyle="un">see also </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-VMY0-003G-30RW-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND39V0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39M0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0H10000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="5529524" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>

				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VMY0-003G-30RW-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

			    </rfc:anchorcite> (stating in the <lnci:cite ID="I494C5K40K1MND4GG0000400" loadable="1" normcite="U.S. CONST. AMEND. 4" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44041460001" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
