	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_98" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="66" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P81" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> First, under the circumstances, Hamdan's interests in maintaining a concealed weapon in his <ref:page num="486" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> store and carrying it personally during an unexpected encounter with visitors substantially outweighed the State's interest in enforcing the concealed weapons statute.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_99" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="487" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P82" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Hamdan exercised the right to keep and bear arms under circumstances in which the need to exercise this right was substantial. He owned a grocery store in a high crime neighborhood and his store <ref:page num="812" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> had been the site of past robberies and homicides. Hamdan himself had been a crime victim at the store. Hamdan had concerns not only for himself but also for his family and customers. He had good reason to anticipate future crime problems at the store and a need to provide his own security to deal with the problems. Acting on this need, Hamdan kept a handgun under the counter near the cash register but safely stored the weapon when the business was closed. Hamdan's transport of the weapon in his pocket on the night in question was incidental to his normal safe handling and storage of the firearm in his store. Meanwhile, the State's interests in prohibiting Hamdan from carrying a concealed weapon in his small<ref:page num="67" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> store, under the circumstances on the night the <ref:page num="488" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> police officers visited his store, were negligible. The police knew that Hamdan's store was a crime target and that Hamdan kept a weapon for protection. There is no evidence that Hamdan was prone to act irresponsibly or impulsively, and he was unlikely to do so in his own store. Therefore, enforcement of the CCW statute on these facts would seriously frustrate the constitutional right to keep and bear arms for security but advance no discernible public interest.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_100" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P83" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Second, Hamdan had no reasonable means of keeping and handling the weapon in his store except to conceal it. In the normal course of business, Hamdan concealed the weapon in an area that was accessible to him but inaccessible to the public. It would have been dangerous and counterproductive to openly display the weapon during business hours, and requiring him to do so would have seriously impaired his right to bear arms for security. When Hamdan was unexpectedly summoned to come to the front of the store at a time when he was closing up for the night, he had the option of putting the handgun in his pocket or leaving the handgun in the back room without knowing who<ref:page num="68" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> had come into the store and whether his security was threatened. Carrying the handgun openly when he went back into the store would have shocked his visitors, seriously threatened his safety, and was not a reasonable option.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_101" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P84" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Because we determine that Hamdan prevails on both of these issues, we conclude that he had a constitutional right to keep and bear arms for the lawful purpose of security at the time he carried his concealed weapon, that his conviction for carrying a concealed weapon was unconstitutional, and his conviction must be reversed. He was never allowed to present this defense. We remand the case to the circuit court for <ref:page num="489" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> further proceedings consistent with this opinion. The case should be dismissed unless the State can show probable cause that Hamdan had an unlawful purpose when he was carrying the concealed weapon. Hamdan asserted that he was exercising his constitutional right to bear arms for only lawful purposes and, at this time, there is no evidence that Hamdan had any unlawful purpose nor has the State asserted such an intent.</text>
	      </p>
	      <h xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">VIII. COMMENTARY</h>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_102" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P85" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The approval of a state constitutional right to keep and bear arms for security, defense, hunting, <ref:page num="69" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> recreation, and any other lawful purpose will present a continuing dilemma for law enforcement until the legislature acts to clarify the law. We urge the legislature to thoughtfully examine <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0H90000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608V0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> in the wake of the amendment and to consider the possibility of a licensing or permit system for persons who have a good reason to carry a concealed weapon. We happily concede that the legislature is better able than this court to determine public policy on fire<ref:page num="813" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> arms and other weapons. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote38" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n38">38</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_68" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Crooks</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100057874" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity> would declare <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0HB0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:stat>
			      <lnci:statinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:statinfo>
			      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
			      </lnci:statref>
			    </lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360PJ0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> unconstitutional but delay the effective date of the ruling to permit the legislature to make alterations in the CCW statute. Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Crooks</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100057874" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>' concurrence/dissent, P110. This suggestion is not tenable.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_103" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P86" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In the meantime, we must give effect to the constitutional right embodied in <lnci:cite ID="I494C5K40K1MND4GH0000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608W0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote39" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n39">39</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_69" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Contrary to assertions in the dissent and Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Crooks</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100057874" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>' concurrence/dissent, we have not read exceptions into the CCW statute. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> dissent, P115; Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			    <globalentity:content>Crooks</globalentity:content>
			    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100057874" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			  </globalentity:entity>' concurrence/dissent, PP100, 101, 107, 113. As explained in Parts IV and V of this opinion, the interpretation of the CCW statute and the statute's relation to statutory privilege defenses remain unchanged by the adoption of <lnci:cite ID="I494C5K40K1MND4P70000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
				  </lnci:hierlev>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:constinfo>
			      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
			      </lnci:constref>
			    </lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360PK0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite>. Our analysis has merely fleshed out the parameters of the constitutional rights in <lnci:cite ID="I494C5K40K1MND4P80000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
				  </lnci:hierlev>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:constinfo>
			      <lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
			      </lnci:constref>
			    </lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360PM0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> and has articulated the constitutional defense that protects those rights.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>

			<metaitem name="ProcessDate" value="09-24-2012 15:10:18"/>

		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>

			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="Right to Bear Arms"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:4E6F821962FC4804B4AD3B27A047CE68" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>

			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="General Overview"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:0E5390F82F7D4C2DBD06E44166387A29" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00000880"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="General Overview"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:39B976ACAE4C4839990528F14E59A34D" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		      <classify:classitem>
			<meta>
			  <metaitem name="appliedby" value="machine"/>
			  <metaitem name="intitle" value="true"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalID" value="00004975"/>
			  <metaitem name="InternalName" value="General Overview"/>
			</meta>
			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:C75CDBC599A749E28E5D4CFDE7FD5757" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		      </classify:classitem>
		    </classify:classification>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="hnpara_18" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>A defendant who challenges on constitutional grounds a prosecution for carrying a concealed weapon has to secure affirmative answers to the following legal questions before he can raise a constitutional defense. First, did the defendant's interest in concealing the weapon to facilitate exercise of his right to keep and bear arms substantially outweigh the State's interest in enforcing the concealed weapons statute? The State has a significant interest in prohibiting the carrying of concealed weapons. Thus, to satisfy this element, the defendant must have been exercising the right to keep and bear arms under circumstances in which the need to do so was substantial. Second, did the defendant conceal his weapon because concealment was the only reasonable means under the circumstances to exercise his or her right to bear arms? Put differently, did the defendant lack a reasonable alternative to concealment to exercise his constitutional right to bear arms? The invocation of this possible defense must be raised by motion of the defendant before trial, and resolution of these legal questions must be made by the court prior to trial. Affirmative answers to these questions will require a court to conclude that the State's enforcement of the CCW statute constituted an unreasonable and unconstitutional impairment of the right to keep and bear arms as granted in <lnci:cite ID="I4NVTVB90K1MNJ4HY0000400" loadable="0" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" status="valid" validate="0" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748"/>
			      </lnci:constref>
			    </lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3608X0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I. � 25</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite>.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </casesum:headnote>A defendant who challenges on constitutional grounds <ref:page num="490" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> a prosecution for carrying a concealed weapon will<ref:page num="70" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> be required to secure <emph typestyle="un">affirmative</emph> answers to the following legal questions before he or she is entitled to raise a constitutional defense. First, under the circumstances, did the defendant's interest in concealing the weapon to facilitate exercise of his or her right to keep and bear arms substantially outweigh the State's interest in enforcing the concealed weapons statute? The State generally has a significant interest in prohibiting the carrying of concealed weapons. Thus, to satisfy this element, the defendant must have been exercising the right to keep and bear arms under circumstances in which the need to do so was substantial. Second, did the defendant conceal his or her weapon because concealment was the only reasonable means under the circumstances to exercise his or her right to bear arms? Put differently, did the defendant lack a reasonable alternative to concealment, under the circumstances, to exercise his or her constitutional right to bear arms? The invocation of this possible defense must be raised by motion of the defendant before trial, and resolution of these legal questions must be made by the court prior to trial. Affirmative answers to these questions will<ref:page num="71" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> require a court to conclude that the State's enforcement of the CCW statute constituted an unreasonable and unconstitutional impairment of the right to keep and bear arms as granted in <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0HC0000400" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

			<topic:topicReference guid:guid="urn:topic:F21C5F3250264B5BBAB7C1B7FF01983F" xmlns:topic="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:topic:global:1" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>

		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="hnpara_19" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>The issue of defendant's unlawful purpose in carrying a concealed weapon is relevant only when the court approves a constitutional defense. The State can overcome a court-approved constitutional defense only if it asserts, and then proves at trial, that the defendant had an unlawful purpose at the time he or she carried the concealed weapon. Whether the defendant had an unlawful purpose, defined as an intent to use the weapon in furtherance of the commission of a crime, is a question of fact. The question should be submitted to the trier of fact along with separate, traditional instructions on the crime of carrying a concealed weapon. If a jury answers that the defendant did not intend the unlawful purpose specifically alleged by the State, then it will not need to reach the questions posed in the jury instructions for a carrying a concealed weapon offense, as the defendant's conduct remains constitutionally protected. If any unlawful purpose is proven, then the defendant can be found guilty of carrying a concealed weapon upon proof beyond a reasonable doubt of the elements of the crime of carrying a concealed weapon.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </casesum:headnote>The issue of unlawful purpose is relevant only when the court approves a constitutional defense. The State can overcome a court-approved constitutional defense only if it asserts, <ref:page num="72" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> and then proves at trial, that the defendant had an unlawful purpose at the time he or she carried the concealed weapon. Whether the defendant had an unlawful purpose, defined as an intent to use the weapon in furtherance of the commission of a crime, is a question of fact. The question should be submitted to the trier of fact along with separate, traditional instructions on the crime of carrying a concealed weapon.</text>
	      </p>

		<text><ref:page num="P88" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> If a jury answers that the defendant did not intend the unlawful purpose specifically alleged by the State, then it will not need to reach the questions posed in the jury instructions for a CCW offense as the defendant's conduct remains constitutionally protected. If any unlawful purpose is proven, then the defendant can be found guilty of carrying a concealed weapon upon proof beyond a reasonable doubt of the elements of the crime of carrying a concealed weapon. <emph typestyle="un">See</emph> <lnci:cite ID="I494C5K40K1MND4P90000400" loadable="1" ri.key="45122560011" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

		  </lnci:cite>.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_106" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P89" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> These principles should provide some guidance to counsel and the courts until the legislature takes further action.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_107" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><emph typestyle="it">By the Court.</emph>- <ref:page num="814" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The judgment of the circuit court is reversed and the <ref:page num="73" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> cause is remanded.  </text>
	      </p>
	    </majorityopinion>
	    <courtcase:opinionby VSalign="L" VSseparation="2NL"><hdr inline="Y" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y">Concur by:</hdr>WILLIAM A. <person:judge status="valid" xmlns:person="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/person/1/">BABLITCH</person:judge>; ANN WALSH <person:judge status="valid" xmlns:person="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/person/1/">BRADLEY</person:judge>; N.  PATRICK <person:judge status="valid" xmlns:person="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/person/1/">CROOKS</person:judge> (In Part) </courtcase:opinionby>
	    <concurs VSalign="L" VSseparation="2NL">
	      <hdr inline="N" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y" format="BANNER">Concur</hdr>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_108" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P90" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>WILLIAM A. BABLITCH</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100041936" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, J. <emph typestyle="it">(concurring).</emph> I join the majority opinion and write only to answer Chief Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Abrahamson</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s dissent.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_109" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P91" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Chief Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Abrahamson</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s dissent would find Mr. Hamdan guilty, notwithstanding that Mr. Hamdan <ref:page num="492" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> carried the gun in his pocket at night, in his own store, located in a high crime neighborhood, which had been the subject of past robberies and homicides, and had himself been the subject of an attempted murder in the store. I could not disagree more.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_110" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P92" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The Chief Justice's dissent, in its attempt to save the Carrying a Concealed Weapon statute, eviscerates the constitutional amendment. It renders the constitutional amendment a sham by reading into it the words "unless concealed." The inevitable and logical result of that interpretation is to create absurdities neither the legislature nor the voters could have intended.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_111" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P93" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Based on the Chief Justice's interpretation, it is lawful to have a gun on top of your night table or bureau, but not in a drawer; it is lawful to have a gun case in the home if the guns inside can be seen, but unlawful if the guns are behind a solid door and cannot<ref:page num="74" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> be seen. With all due respect, that just doesn't make sense.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_112" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P94" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The majority is absolutely correct in concluding that this could not have been the result intended by the legislators who wrote the constitutional amendment nor the voters who ratified it. The dissent by Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Crooks</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100057874" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, who would find the statute unconstitutional, by implication quite obviously agrees that this could not have been the intent behind the constitutional amendment.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_113" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P95" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND39X0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39X0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The very difficult task confronted by the majority was to conform the statute to the newly enacted constitutional amendment, if possible. It is well-established that statutes are presumed constitutional; thus, our first responsibility is to preserve the statute if possible. <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-VTR0-003G-340H-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND39X0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39W0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0HF0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="4609714" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="McManus"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1989"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0HG0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="129" kw="2005_152_113*.129" page="113" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="152"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="152"/>
			    <lnci:page num="113"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="129"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0HM0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="654" kw="1572_447_654*.654" page="654" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="447"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="447"/>
			    <lnci:page num="654"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2390000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1989"/>
			    <lnci:page num="102"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27D0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in Concurring Opinion at" letter="&"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VTR0-003G-340H-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000152#000113#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_129_3491"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000152#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="152 Wis. 2d 113"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="129"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360910000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. McManus</emph>, 152 Wis. 2d 113, 129, 447 N.W.2d 654 (1989)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>I conclude that the majority <ref:page num="493" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> did exceedingly well in accomplishing that task, and that is why I join the majority.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_114" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P96" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The framework set out by the majority for the circuit courts to follow in deciding these very fact-specific cases is not at all unlike the framework these courts have used for decades in deciding <lnci:cite ID="I4JVT4B30K1MNJ1VR0000400" loadable="1" normcite="U.S. CONST. AMEND. 4" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44041460001" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="catchword" num="amend.">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="number" num="4"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="amend._4">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="7492" value="U.S. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/contentstore/statutes-legislation" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#7492#207#        4 #"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="38"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="U.S. Const. AMEND. 4"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360930000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="filters" fixed=""/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>4th Amendment</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> cases, which are themselves very fact-specific. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3B00000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3B00000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="75" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In <lnci:cite ID="I4JVT4B30K1MNJ1VS0000400" loadable="1" normcite="U.S. CONST. AMEND. 4" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44041460001" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:constitution>
			<lnci:constinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="catchword" num="amend.">
			      <lnci:hierlev label="number" num="4"/>
			    </lnci:hierlev>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:constref normcite="amend._4">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="7492" value="U.S. Const."/>
			</lnci:constref>
		      </lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/contentstore/statutes-legislation" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#7492#207#        4 #"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="38"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="U.S. Const. AMEND. 4"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360940000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="filters" fixed=""/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>4th Amendment</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> cases, the court is confronted with historical facts and constitutional facts. Constitutional facts, i.e., whether the facts are in conformity with the constitutional demands, are determined by applying the historical facts to the constitution, which is a question of law determined by the court. <rfc:anchorcite lni="45R2-3FS0-0039-454J-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3B00000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND39Y0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0HR0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="29023702" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Jennings"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0HS0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="23642" value="WI"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="44" kw="1327_2002_44*.44" page="44" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2002"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="2002"/>
			    <lnci:page num="44"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="P20"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0HX0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="228" kw="2005_252_228*.228" page="228" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="252"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="252"/>
			    <lnci:page num="228"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0J00000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="142" kw="1572_647_142*.142" page="142" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="647"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="647"/>
			    <lnci:page num="142"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND23B0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="2002"/>
			    <lnci:page num="239"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27F0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in Concurring Opinion at" letter="&"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:45R2-3FS0-0039-454J-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2002#000044#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PNUM_20_3481"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2002#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2002 WI 44"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="20"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360960000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Jennings</emph>, 2002 WI 44, P20, 252 Wis. 2d 228, 647 N.W.2d 142</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>The touchstone is "reasonableness." So too here. The constitutional facts are determined by the court, applying the historical facts to the constitutional amendment, and "reasonableness" is the touchstone. Accordingly, I respectfully disagree with the Chief Justice's dissent and join the majority.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_115" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P97" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>ANN WALSH BRADLEY</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100064504" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, J. <emph typestyle="it">(concurring).</emph> I agree with the majority that Hamdan's conviction for carrying a concealed weapon was unconstitutional and his conviction must be reversed. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3H70000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3H70000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Majority op., P84. However, I do not join the majority's discussion in Part VIII regarding the procedural aspects of future constitutional <ref:page num="815" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> challenges to prosecutions for carrying a concealed weapon. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="45R2-3FS0-0039-454J-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3H70000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3H60000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0J30000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0HR0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0J20000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0HS0000400">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="44" kw="1327_2002_44*.44" page="44" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2002"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint lastnum="88" num="P85"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2740000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0HX0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="228" kw="2005_252_228*.228" page="228" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="252"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2750000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0J00000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="142" kw="1572_647_142*.142" page="142" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="647"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2760000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND23B0000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27G0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in Concurring Opinion at" letter="&"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:45R2-3FS0-0039-454J-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2002#000044#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PNUM_85_3481"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2002#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2002 WI 44"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="85"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360990000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">id.</emph>, PP85-88</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21W0000400" seqnum="9"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>.</rfc:reasonforciting></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_116" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P98" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> I am not convinced that the procedural mechanism created by<ref:page num="76" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Part VIII is consistent with established methods of raising constitutional defenses. I am also concerned that some unique aspects of these procedures may prove to be unworkable and create confusion. Accordingly, I respectfully concur.  </text>
	      </p>
	    </concurs>
	    <courtcase:opinionby VSalign="L" VSseparation="2NL"><hdr inline="Y" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y">Dissent by:</hdr>N. PATRICK <person:judge status="valid" xmlns:person="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/person/1/">CROOKS</person:judge> (In Part); SHIRLEY S. <person:judge status="valid" xmlns:person="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/person/1/">ABRAHAMSON</person:judge></courtcase:opinionby>
	    <dissents VSalign="L" VSseparation="2NL">
	      <hdr inline="N" typestyle="BF" intradoc-nav-point="Y" format="BANNER">Dissent</hdr>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_117" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="494" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P99" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>N. PATRICK CROOKS</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100057874" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, J. (<emph typestyle="it">concurring/dissenting).</emph> For the reasons set forth below, I respectfully concur/dissent, since I agree with the majority's result that Hamdan's conviction should be reversed, but I dissent on the majority's action in remanding this matter.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_118" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P100" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The majority in this case improperly reads exceptions into <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0J40000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27H0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3609B0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> in order to hold that it is constitutional. Such exceptions to the statute should not be made by this court, but by the legislature. Looking at the statute itself, I conclude that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0J50000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27J0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3609C0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> has become unconstitutional with the passage of <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0J60000400" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27K0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3609D0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25 of the Wisconsin Constitution</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite><lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0J70000400" ri.key="40894700012" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="1"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="I_I">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27M0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>. I</lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> agree with Chief Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Abrahamson</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s dissent that the majority erroneously assigns to a court, rather than a jury, the task of determining factual issues involving whether a defense<ref:page num="77" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> to a charge of carrying a concealed weapon is available to a defendant.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_119" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P101" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> I agree with her dissent that this court should not attempt to engraft exceptions onto <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0J80000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27N0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3609F0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>, in order to try to make it conform to constitutional strictures. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3H90000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3H90000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>Chief Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Abrahamson</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity>'s dissent, P115. If the statute does not conform to the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> Constitution, as amended, then the statute is unconstitutional. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3VY0-MVH0-0039-446R-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3H90000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3H80000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0JB0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="18978934" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Zarnke"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1999"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0JC0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="139" kw="2005_224_116*.139" page="116" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="224"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="224"/>
			    <lnci:page num="116"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint lastnum="140" num="139"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0JH0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="370" kw="1572_589_370*.370" page="370" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="589"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="589"/>
			    <lnci:page num="370"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND23C0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1999"/>
			    <lnci:page num="21"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27P0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3VY0-MVH0-0039-446R-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000224#000116#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_139_3491"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000224#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="224 Wis. 2d 116"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="139"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3609H0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Zarnke</emph>, 224 Wis. 2d 116, 139-140, 589 N.W.2d 370 (1999)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21X0000400" seqnum="5"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>; <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3D-BHG0-003G-30K7-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3H90000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3HB0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0JM0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6454673" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>

			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>

			    <lnci:volume num="557"/>

			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND23D0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>

			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27R0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3D-BHG0-003G-30K7-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000207#000054#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_82_3491"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000207#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="207 Wis. 2d 54"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="82"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3609M0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Hall</emph>, 207 Wis. 2d 54, 82, 557 N.W.2d 778 (1997)</linktext>
			    </request>
