			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND21Y0000400" seqnum="1"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>.</rfc:reasonforciting></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_120" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P102" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> I strongly disagree, however, with Chief Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Abrahamson</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s conclusion that the statute survives the constitutional amendment and remains constitutional. In light of <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0JW0000400" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:constinfo>
		      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
		      </lnci:constref>
		    </lnci:constitution>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27S0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3609P0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Article I, Section 25 of the Wisconsin Constitution</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>, I conclude that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0JY0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27T0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R3609R0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> is unconstitutional because it is unnecessarily broad and rigid now and provides no exceptions as it is written. The statute is not a reasonable exercise of the <ref:page num="495" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> state's police power. If the majority were to refrain from attempting to find exceptions in the statute where none exist, it too would presumably<ref:page num="78" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> find it unconstitutional.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_121" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3K70000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
		    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3K70000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3K90000400">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3K90000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3KX0000400">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3KX0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3M00000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3M00000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P103" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The breadth of the statute is incompatible with the broad constitutional right to bear arms. Its prohibition extends to anyone at any time and, therefore, improperly and unnecessarily impinges on a person's right to bear arms "for security, defense, hunting, recreation or any other lawful purpose." <footnote>
			    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote40" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <label alt-content="n40">40</label>
			    <bodytext>
			      <p>
				<ref:anchor id="fnpara_70" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<text><lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0K00000400" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				    <lnci:constitution>
				      <lnci:constinfo>
					<lnci:hier>
					  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
					    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
					  </lnci:hierlev>
					</lnci:hier>
				      </lnci:constinfo>
				      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
					<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
				      </lnci:constref>
				    </lnci:constitution>
				    <lnci:metadata>
				      <lnci:precedent>
					<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27V0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				      </lnci:precedent>
				    </lnci:metadata>
				    <lnci:content>
				      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
					<request xmlns="">
					  <parameters>
					    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360PN0000400"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
					    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					  </parameters>
					  <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
					</request>
				      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				    </lnci:content>
				  </lnci:cite>.</text>
			      </p>
			    </bodytext>
			  </footnote> The statute has been held to prohibit a gun placed on the front seat of a car, <footnote>

			    <label alt-content="n41">41</label>

					</lnci:precedent>

				      <lnci:content>

					  <request xmlns="">

					      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10984"/>

					    <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Walls</emph>, 190 Wis. 2d 65, 73, 526 N.W.2d 765 (Ct. App. 1994)</linktext>

				    <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2200000400" seqnum="2"/>
				  </rfc:anchorcite>. </text>
			      </p>
			    </bodytext>
			  </footnote> in a glove compartment, <footnote>

			  </footnote> or on a shelf behind the driver's seat. <footnote>

			      </p>
			    </bodytext>
			  </footnote> One "goes armed" even when going nowhere with the concealed weapon. <footnote>
			    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote44" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <label alt-content="n44">44</label>
			    <bodytext>
			      <p>
				<ref:anchor id="fnpara_74" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<text><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-XTG0-003G-3182-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3M00000400" status="valid">
				    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3KY0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

					  <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
					  <lnci:ldi jumppage="79" kw="2005_175_75*.79" page="75" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="175"/>
					  <lnci:volume num="175"/>
					  <lnci:page num="75"/>
					  <lnci:pinpoint num="79"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0M30000400">
					  <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
					  <lnci:ldi jumppage="865" kw="1572_498_865*.865" page="865" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="498"/>
					  <lnci:volume num="498"/>
					  <lnci:page num="865"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND23J0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">

					</lnci:caseref>
				      </lnci:case>
				      <lnci:metadata>
					<lnci:precedent>
					  <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2800000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
					</lnci:precedent>
				      </lnci:metadata>
				      <lnci:content>

		<text><ref:page num="79" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="816" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3MK0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3MK0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P104" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> It may be argued that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0M50000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

		      </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting></rfc:reasonforciting><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3MN0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3MN0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>However, the state's police power is subject to limitations, and is not to be used in an unreasonable or excessive fashion, and, as such, is limited by the state and federal constitutions. <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-WGN0-003G-34H5-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3MN0000400" status="valid">

				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>948.605</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> (possession in a school zone). </text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> The state's police power cannot save a prohibition that sweeps as broadly as <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0MS0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>

			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2840000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">

	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_123" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <ref:page num="80" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3MR0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3MR0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P105" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Notwithstanding the majority's exceptions engrafted onto the statute, it logically extends to such a wide variety of scenarios that it leaves no "'open ample alternative channels by which the citizen may exercise the right at issue.'" <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-VJB0-003G-304C-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3MR0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3MP0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0MW0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6187094" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="Brandmiller"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Arreola"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1996"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0MX0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="541" kw="2005_199_528*.541" page="528" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="199"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="199"/>
			    <lnci:page num="528"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="541"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0N20000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="894" kw="1572_544_894*.894" page="894" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="544"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="544"/>
			    <lnci:page num="894"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND23N0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1996"/>
			    <lnci:page num="19"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2860000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VJB0-003G-304C-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000199#000528#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_541_3491"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000199#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="199 Wis. 2d 528"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="541"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360B30000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Brandmiller v. Arreola</emph>, 199 Wis. 2d 528, 541, 544 N.W.2d 894 (1996)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2260000400" seqnum="8"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite> (quoting <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S4X-6670-003B-53PT-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3MR0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3N90000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0N50000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="4679968" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="Lutz"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="City of York, Pennsylvania"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="3d Cir."/>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1990"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0N60000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="350" value="F.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="255" kw="440_899_255*.255" page="255" pagesuffix="*" reporter="440" volume="899"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="899"/>
			    <lnci:page num="255"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND23P0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4107" value="U.S. App. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1990"/>
			    <lnci:page num="4395"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND23R0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="562" value="A.L.R.4th"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="87"/>
			    <lnci:page num="1081"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2870000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S4X-6670-003B-53PT-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#350#3#000899#000255#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#350#3#000899#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="899 F.2d 255"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360B50000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="6387"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Lutz v. City of York, Pennsylvania</emph>, 899 F.2d 255 (3d Cir. 1990))</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. Logically extended, as the State conceded at oral argument, it prohibits a gun owner from storing his weapons out of plain sight, such as in a gun cabinet, closet, or drawer in his home. If such reasonable actions are foreclosed by the statute, owners of firearms and other dangerous weapons have been effectively, and significantly, deprived of the means by which they may exercise the constitutional right to bear arms for any lawful purpose.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_124" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P106" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Since, in my opinion, the statute is unconstitutional in light of the constitutional amendment, then making changes to it, so that the statute will be constitutional in the future, is the province of the legislature. Policy decisions affecting the statute's constitutionality should be made in typical legislative<ref:page num="81" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> fashion. Public hearings and vigorous debate by members of the legislature are appropriate methods to employ when developing a law that is appropriate for the citizens of <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> and within constitutional mandates. By its <ref:page num="497" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> approach of attempting to engraft its exceptions onto the statute, the majority squelches this process.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_125" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P107" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The majority is correct in pointing out that among the six states that have a constitutional provision guaranteeing the right to bear arms, but do not allow any class of citizens to carry concealed weapons legally, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> is unique in the strictness of its prohibition. Majority op., P50. <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s carrying concealed weapons (CCW) law contains no exceptions. The other five states mentioned above have CCW laws that contain significant exceptions, the most common exception being for one's home or place of business. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote46" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n46">46</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>

			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56R2-03V0-004F-6200-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

			      <lnci:statref normcite="_2923.12(C)">

			      </lnci:statref>
			    </lnci:stat>
			    <lnci:metadata>
			      <lnci:precedent>
				<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND28C0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			      </lnci:precedent>
			    </lnci:metadata>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:56WH-NXD0-009V-8554-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#9461#117#000029#000023#    12#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_c"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Ohio Rev. Code Ann. � 2923.12"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360RF0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9258"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Ohio Rev. Code Ann. � 2923.12(C)</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite> (1997) (providing exception for "going to or from the actors lawful business or occupation" and "while in the actor's own home."). </text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> The constitutional approach in <ref:page num="817" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> that is proposed by the majority, rewriting the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> CCW law by this court, is not the way to adopt exceptions that allow <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> citizens to exercise their rights reasonably.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_126" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <ref:page num="82" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3ND0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
		    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3ND0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3NV0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3NV0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P108" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Other state courts have recognized the state's police power to regulate the constitutional right to bear arms, but have also held that "the legitimate <ref:page num="498" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> governmental purpose in regulating the right to bear arms cannot be pursued by means that broadly stifle the exercise of this right where the governmental purpose can be more narrowly tailored." <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RXR-1PY0-003G-H356-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3ND0000400" status="valid">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3NC0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

		      </rfc:anchorcite> (holding possession of a billy club in defendant's home protected by state constitution); <ref:page num="83" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:anchorcite lni="3X7S-RMK0-00KR-D2Y0-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3NV0000400" status="valid">
			<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3PF0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0PG0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="1446971" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_127" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P109" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> As an examination of other jurisdictions facing the same question shows, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> must modify its statutes in order that it does not, in effect, bar its citizens from legally exercising their right to bear arms, as described in Article I, Section 25 of our state constitution. This might be done by either: (1) Creating a licensing system by which certain qualified individuals are certified to carry concealed weapons; or (2) creating exceptions to <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0PN0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND28K0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360BP0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> that narrow the scope of the law to cover only certain reasonable time, manner and place restrictions on the carrying of concealed weapons. Only then will <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s CCW statute be insulated from the legitimate constitutional attack that it is too broad.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_128" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3R30000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3R30000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="499" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P110" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> If this court were to strike down the current <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> CCW statute, there would be legitimate concerns about the state of the law in this state during the interim, until the legislature could amend the statute to conform with the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> Constitution, as<ref:page num="84" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> amended. However, the effective date of such a decision could be delayed, in order to provide the legislature sufficient time to enact the necessary amendments to the present law. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-VH30-003G-3007-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3R30000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3PH0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0PR0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6565264" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>

			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="Dep't of Corr."/>

			    </lnci:casename>

			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0PS0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="267" kw="2005_211_254*.267" page="254" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="211"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="211"/>
			    <lnci:page num="254"/>

			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0PX0000400">

			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="742" kw="1572_564_742*.742" page="742" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="564"/>

			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND28M0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VH30-003G-3007-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Dep't of Corr. v. Kliesmet</emph>, 211 Wis. 2d 254, 267, 564 N.W.2d 742 (1997)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND22G0000400" seqnum="1"/>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND22H0000400" seqnum="10"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite> (delaying, for one year, the effective date of this court's decision limiting the authority of the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">

			    </request>

		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3SC0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3SC0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P111" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The decision in the companion to this case, <emph typestyle="un">State v. Cole</emph>, <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote47" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

		      <bodytext>

				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0SW0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="234" kw="2005_127_234*.234" page="234" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="127"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="127"/>

			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="283" kw="1572_378_283*.283" page="283" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="378"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="378"/>
			    <lnci:page num="283"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2460000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>

			    <lnci:page num="2751"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND28W0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VXX0-003G-30S6-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">

				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000127#000234#"/>

			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Minniecheske</emph>, 127 Wis. 2d 234, 378 N.W.2d 283 (1985)</linktext>

		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_130" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3SF0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3SF0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P112" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Lastly, I agree, also, with Chief Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Abrahamson</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity>'s determination that the majority improperly gives factual determinations to the judge to decide, as a matter of law, and not to the jury, concerning whether a defense is available to a defendant in a concealed weapon case. Majority op., P85, and Chief Justice <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Abrahamson</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity>'s dissent, P132. It is for a jury to determine whether to believe defendant's version of events. <ref:page num="86" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RSV-Y7F0-003G-30B5-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3SF0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3SD0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TB0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6427727" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Coleman"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1996"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TC0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="214" kw="2005_206_199*.214" page="199" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="206"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="206"/>
			    <lnci:page num="199"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="214"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TH0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="701" kw="1572_556_701*.701" page="701" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="556"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="556"/>
			    <lnci:page num="701"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2470000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1996"/>
			    <lnci:page num="114"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND28X0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RSV-Y7F0-003G-30B5-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000206#000199#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_214_3491"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000206#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="206 Wis. 2d 199"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="214"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360CM0000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Coleman</emph>, 206 Wis. 2d 199, 214, 556 N.W.2d 701 (1996)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>The majority here requires the court, inappropriately, to weigh the evidence and make factual decisions relating to a constitutional defense against a CCW charge.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_131" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P113" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The majority in this case erroneously reads exceptions into <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TK0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND28Y0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360CP0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> rather than allowing the legislature to determine how to make the statute conform to the requirements of the constitution, as amended. I conclude that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TM0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2900000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360CR0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> is unconstitutional now, because of the constitutional amendment adopted by <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>'s citizens. I would, in a delayed holding allowing time for the legislature to act, find the present statute unconstitutional, and, therefore, I respectfully concur since I agree with the majority's result that Hamdan's conviction should be reversed. However, I dissent on the majority's action in remanding this matter.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_132" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P114" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>SHIRLEY S. ABRAHAMSON</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>, CHIEF JUSTICE <emph typestyle="it">(dissenting).</emph> I conclude that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TN0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2910000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360CS0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite>, prohibiting people from going armed with a concealed weapon, is constitutional as written and as applied. <ref:page num="87" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> constitution provides that "the <ref:page num="501" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> people have the right to keep and bear arms for security, defense, hunting, recreation or any other lawful purpose." <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote48" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n48">48</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_78" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TP0000400" normcite="WIS. CONST. I 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			    <lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:hier>
				  <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
				  </lnci:hierlev>
				</lnci:hier>
			      </lnci:constinfo>
			      <lnci:constref normcite="I_25">
				<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
			      </lnci:constref>
			    </lnci:constitution>
			    <lnci:metadata>
			      <lnci:precedent>
				<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2920000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			      </lnci:precedent>
			    </lnci:metadata>
			    <lnci:content>
			      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				<request xmlns="">
				  <parameters>
				    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360RK0000400"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				  </parameters>
				  <linktext>Wis. Const. art. I, � 25</linktext>
				</request>
			      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			    </lnci:content>
			  </lnci:cite>.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> I therefore dissent.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_133" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3SV0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3SV0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P115" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The court should not rewrite <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TR0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:precedent>
			  <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2930000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			</lnci:precedent>
		      </lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360CT0000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> to include exceptions for owners of "privately operated businesses" and persons in their "private residences." <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote49" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n49">49</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_79" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>Majority op., P68.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> If <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TS0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:precedent>
			  <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2940000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			</lnci:precedent>
		      </lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360CV0000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> is unconstitutional because it is too broad, needing exceptions to render it constitutional, the court should strike the statute down and allow the legislature to enact a more narrow prohibition. We have often said that "courts cannot go beyond the province of legitimate construction to save [a statute], and where the meaning is plain, words cannot be read into it or out of it for the purpose of saving one or other possible alternative." <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote50" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n50">50</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_80" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>
			    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3SP0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3SP0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3D-BHG0-003G-30K7-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3SP0000400" status="valid">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3SG0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TV0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6454673" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				  <lnci:case>
				    <lnci:caseinfo>
				      <lnci:casename>

				    </lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0TW0000400">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="82" kw="2005_207_54*.82" page="54" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="207"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="207"/>
				      <lnci:page num="54"/>
				      <lnci:pinpoint num="82"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0V10000400">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="778" kw="1572_557_778*.778" page="778" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="557"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="557"/>
				      <lnci:page num="778"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2480000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="1997"/>
				      <lnci:page num="4"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				  </lnci:case>
				  <lnci:metadata>
				    <lnci:precedent>
				      <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2950000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				    </lnci:precedent>
				  </lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:content>
				    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3D-BHG0-003G-30K7-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				      <request xmlns="">
					<parameters>
					  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000207#000054#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_82_3491"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000207#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="207 Wis. 2d 54"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="82"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360RN0000400"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					</parameters>
					<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Hall</emph>, 207 Wis. 2d 54, 82, 557 N.W.2d 778 (1997)</linktext>
				      </request>
				    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				  </lnci:content>
				</lnci:cite>
			      </rfc:anchorcite>.</rfc:reasonforciting>
			  </text>
			</p>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_81" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>As this court has explained: </text>
			  <blockquote>
			    <p>
			      <ref:anchor id="fnpara_82" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <text>Were we to rewrite a statute whenever it failed constitutional muster in order to save it, using any means possible, the legislature would soon realize that it need not be concerned with constitutional limitations: the judiciary could always be relied upon to mend and mold its language to fit within constitutional constraints.</text>
			    </p>
			    <p>
			      <ref:anchor id="fnpara_83" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <text>"While a statute should be held valid whenever by any fair interpretation it may be construed to serve a constitutional purpose, courts cannot go beyond the province of legitimate construction to save it, and where the meaning is plain, words cannot be read into it or out of it for the purpose of saving one or other possible alternative." It is well-established that "where the language used in a statute is plain, the court cannot read words into it that are not found . . . even to save its constitutionality, because this would be legislation and not construction."</text>
			    </p>
			    <p>
			      <ref:anchor id="fnpara_84" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <text>Finally, "'although this Court will often strain to construe legislation so as to save it against constitutional attack, it must not and will not carry this to the point of . . .' judicially rewriting it". "Otherwise, there would be no such thing as an unconstitutional statute." </text>
			    </p>
			  </blockquote>
			</p>

			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> Moreover, <ref:page num="819" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="502" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> "defining the contours of laws subjecting a violator to criminal penalty is a legislative, not<ref:page num="88" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> a judicial, function." <footnote>

	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_134" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P116" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The first part of this dissent explains that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0VN0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2980000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360CW0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> is constitutional as applied to the defendant here because it is a reasonable exercise of the State's police power, and it does not eviscerate the defendant's right to keep and bear arms for security. The second part of this dissent explains why the majority opinion errs when it gives courts the authority to determine, as a matter of law, that a given defendant may have a valid constitutional defense to a charge of carrying a concealed weapon, subject to a determination of lawful purpose by the finder of fact. Finally, I comment on the majority opinion's failure to appreciate the extent to which it has frustrated the ability of the legislature to set public policy on concealed weapons in <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity>.</text>
	      </p>
