				<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Cole</emph>, 2003 WI 112, 264 Wis. 2d 520, 665 N.W.2d 328</linktext>
			      </request>
			    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			  </lnci:content>
			</lnci:cite>
			<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND22N0000400" seqnum="6"/>
		      </rfc:anchorcite>, we are to presume that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0W00000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:stat>
			  <lnci:statinfo>
			    <lnci:hier>
			      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			    </lnci:hier>
			  </lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			    <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
			  </lnci:statref>
			</lnci:stat>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2990000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360D10000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite> is constitutional, and we impose the heavy<ref:page num="90" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> burden of proving that it is unconstitutional on <ref:page num="503" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> the challenger, the defendant in this case. <footnote>
			<ref:anchor id="fn_fnote52" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<label alt-content="n52">52</label>
			<bodytext>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_87" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3T50000400">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3T50000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3T70000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3T70000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3T50000400" status="valid">
				    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3T40000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				    <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0W20000400" historycite="0" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="31842786" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				      <lnci:case>
					<lnci:caseinfo>
					  <lnci:casename>
					    <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
					    <lnci:text txt="v."/>
					    <lnci:party2 name="Cole"/>
					  </lnci:casename>
					</lnci:caseinfo>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0W30000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
					  <lnci:reporter normpubcode="23642" value="WI"/>
					  <lnci:ldi jumppage="112" kw="1327_2003_112*.112" page="112" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2003"/>
					  <lnci:volume num="2003"/>
					  <lnci:page num="112"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0W50000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
					  <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
					  <lnci:ldi jumppage="520" kw="2005_264_520*.520" page="520" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="264"/>
					  <lnci:volume num="264"/>
					  <lnci:page num="520"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0W70000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
					  <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
					  <lnci:ldi jumppage="328" kw="1572_665_328*.328" page="328" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="665"/>
					  <lnci:volume num="665"/>
					  <lnci:page num="328"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I494C77C0K1MND01C0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
					  <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
					  <lnci:volume num="2003"/>
					  <lnci:page num="613"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
				      </lnci:case>
				      <lnci:metadata>
					<lnci:precedent>
					  <lnci:editletter ID="I494C77C0K1MND1SB0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
					</lnci:precedent>
				      </lnci:metadata>
				      <lnci:content>
					<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
					  <request xmlns="">
					    <parameters>
					      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2003#000112#"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2003#"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2003 WI 112"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360RY0000400"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					    </parameters>
					    <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Cole</emph>, 2003 WI 112, 264 Wis. 2d 520, 665 N.W.2d 328</linktext>
					  </request>
					</linktemplate:linktemplate>
				      </lnci:content>
				    </lnci:cite>
				    <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND22P0000400" seqnum="7"/>
				  </rfc:anchorcite>. I disagree with this court's conclusion in <emph typestyle="un">Cole</emph> that a statute enjoys a presumption of constitutionality when it is enacted before adoption of the constitutional amendment in issue. <rfc:anchorcite lni="4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3T70000400" status="valid">
				    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3T60000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				    <lnci:cite ID="I494C77C0K1MND01H0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0W20000400" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				      <lnci:case>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I494C77C0K1MND0N20000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0W30000400">
					  <lnci:ldi jumppage="112" kw="1327_2003_112*.112" page="112" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2003"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I494C77C0K1MND0N10000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0W50000400">
					  <lnci:ldi jumppage="520" kw="2005_264_520*.520" page="520" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="264"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I494C77C0K1MND03Y0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0W70000400">
					  <lnci:ldi jumppage="328" kw="1572_665_328*.328" page="328" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="665"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
					<lnci:caseref ID="I494C77C0K1MND0240000400" anaphref="I494C77C0K1MND01C0000400"/>
				      </lnci:case>
				      <lnci:metadata>
					<lnci:precedent>
					  <lnci:editletter ID="I494C77C0K1MND1SC0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
					</lnci:precedent>
				      </lnci:metadata>
				      <lnci:content>
					<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
					  <request xmlns="">
					    <parameters>
					      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2003#000112#"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2003#"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2003 WI 112"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360S20000400"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					    </parameters>
					    <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Cole</emph>, 2003 wi 112, ___ Wis. 2d ___, P52</linktext>
					  </request>
					</linktemplate:linktemplate>
				      </lnci:content>
				    </lnci:cite>
				    <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND22R0000400" seqnum="7"/>
				  </rfc:anchorcite> (<globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judge" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
				    <globalentity:content>Abrahamson</globalentity:content>
				    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judge" guid:guid="urn:entity:jud-100053235" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
				  </globalentity:entity>, C.J., concurring). </rfc:reasonforciting>
			      </rfc:reasonforciting>I would say instead that no presumption of constitutionality applies and the defendant in this case carries the burden of showing that the statute is inconsistent with the constitutional amendment.</text>
			  </p>
			</bodytext>
		      </footnote> Any reasonable doubts about the statute must be resolved in favor of constitutionality. <footnote>

	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_137" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3TF0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
		    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TF0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3TH0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TH0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P118" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Furthermore, because the statute is an exercise of the State's police power,<ref:page num="91" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> judicial review is limited to whether the exercise of that power is reasonable. <footnote>
			<ref:anchor id="fn_fnote54" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<label alt-content="n54">54</label>
			<bodytext>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_89" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-WJB0-003G-352F-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3TF0000400" status="valid">

				    </lnci:precedent>

					<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Jackman</emph>, 60 Wis. 2d 700, 705, 211 N.W.2d 480 (1973)</linktext>
				      </request>

				</lnci:cite>
				<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND22S0000400" seqnum="5"/>
			      </rfc:anchorcite>.</text>
			  </p>
			</bodytext>
		      </footnote> In reviewing the reasonableness of the statute, it is not for this court to pass judgment on the wisdom of the legislation. "Where legislative action is within the scope of the police power, fairly debatable questions as to reasonableness, wisdom, and propriety of action, are not for the determination of the court but for the legislative body." <footnote>
			<ref:anchor id="fn_fnote55" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>

	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_138" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <ref:page num="P119" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3TK0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TK0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>To determine whether <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0XT0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:precedent>
			  <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND29G0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			</lnci:precedent>
		      </lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360D20000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> is constitutional on the facts of this case we must ask two questions. The first question is whether the regulation on concealed weapons is a reasonable exercise of the police power, namely, does the statute promote public safety, health, or welfare and bear a reasonable <ref:page num="504" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> relation to accomplishing those purposes. <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote56" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n56">56</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_91" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text><emph typestyle="un">In </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-VJW0-003G-3073-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3TK0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TJ0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0XW0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6048780" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="Interest of Reginald D."/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1995"/>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0XX0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="308" kw="2005_193_299*.308" page="299" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="193"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="193"/>
				    <lnci:page num="299"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint num="308"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0Y20000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="181" kw="1572_533_181*.181" page="181" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="533"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="533"/>
				    <lnci:page num="181"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND24H0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="1995"/>
				    <lnci:page num="66"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:precedent>
				    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND29H0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				  </lnci:precedent>
				</lnci:metadata>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-VJW0-003G-3073-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000193#000299#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_308_3491"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000193#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="193 Wis. 2d 299"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="308"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360SM0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Interest of Reginald D.</emph>, 193 Wis. 2d 299, 308, 533 N.W.2d 181 (1995)</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND22V0000400" seqnum="4"/>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> The<ref:page num="92" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> second <ref:page num="820" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> question is whether the reasonable exercise of the state's police power eviscerates the constitutional right to bear arms.</rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_139" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P120" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> No one disputes that the prohibition on carrying a concealed weapon is a reasonable exercise of the State's police power. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3TR0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TR0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote57" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n57">57</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_92" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>As the majority opinion explains, <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			      <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
			      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			    </globalentity:entity>'s prohibition of the carrying of concealed weapons is not only a reasonable exercise of police power but also serves many valuable purposes in promoting public safety. Majority op., P53.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0Y40000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:stat>
			<lnci:statinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
			</lnci:statref>
		      </lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:precedent>
			  <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND29J0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			</lnci:precedent>
		      </lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360D30000400"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>Wisconsin Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> promotes public safety. </rfc:reasonforciting><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3TN0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TN0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3TR0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TR0000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The primary justification for the prohibition on carrying concealed weapons is that it protects the public by preventing an individual from having a deadly weapon on hand of which the public (including a law enforcement officer) is unaware, which may be used in the sudden heat of passion. <footnote>
			<ref:anchor id="fn_fnote58" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<label alt-content="n58">58</label>
			<bodytext>
			  <p>
			    <ref:anchor id="fnpara_93" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <text>Majority op. PP54-56; <emph typestyle="un">see also </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="3RVJ-C470-003G-J2SY-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3TR0000400" status="valid">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TP0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0YG0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="4042558" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				  <lnci:case>
				    <lnci:caseinfo>
				      <lnci:casename>
					<lnci:party1 name="State"/>
					<lnci:text txt="v."/>
					<lnci:party2 name="McAdams"/>
				      </lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Wyo."/>
				      <lnci:decisiondate txt="1986"/>
				    </lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0YH0000400">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="499" value="P.2d"/>
				      <lnci:ldi jumppage="1238" kw="1706_714_1236*.1238" page="1236" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="714"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="714"/>
				      <lnci:page num="1236"/>
				      <lnci:pinpoint num="1238"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				    <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND24K0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				      <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4141" value="Wyo. LEXIS"/>
				      <lnci:volume num="1986"/>
				      <lnci:page num="658"/>
				    </lnci:caseref>
				  </lnci:case>
				  <lnci:metadata>
				    <lnci:precedent>
				      <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND29M0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				    </lnci:precedent>
				  </lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:content>
				    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RVJ-C470-003G-J2SY-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				      <request xmlns="">
					<parameters>
					  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000714#001236#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_1238_4932"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000714#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="714 P.2d 1236"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="1238"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360SR0000400"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="11009"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					</parameters>
					<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. McAdams</emph>, 714 P.2d 1236, 1238 (Wyo. 1986)</linktext>
				      </request>
				    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				  </lnci:content>
				</lnci:cite>
				<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND22X0000400" seqnum="1"/>
			      </rfc:anchorcite>.</text>
			  </p>
			</bodytext>
		      </footnote> The public is safer, the argument goes, if it is able to take notice of those people who are carrying weapons and proceed accordingly. </rfc:reasonforciting>Indeed, in a case similar to the present case, <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-X7K0-003G-30MM-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3TN0000400" status="valid">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TM0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0Y60000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="6142637" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			<lnci:case>
			  <lnci:caseinfo>
			    <lnci:casename>
			      <lnci:party1 name="State"/>
			      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
			      <lnci:party2 name="Mata"/>
			    </lnci:casename>
			    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Ct. App."/>
			    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1996"/>
			  </lnci:caseinfo>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0Y70000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="321" kw="2005_199_315*.321" page="315" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="199"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="199"/>
			    <lnci:page num="315"/>
			    <lnci:pinpoint num="321"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0YC0000400">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="630" value="N.W.2d"/>
			    <lnci:ldi jumppage="578" kw="1572_544_578*.578" page="578" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1572" volume="544"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="544"/>
			    <lnci:page num="578"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND24J0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
			    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4136" value="Wisc. App. LEXIS"/>
			    <lnci:volume num="1996"/>
			    <lnci:page num="14"/>
			  </lnci:caseref>
			</lnci:case>
			<lnci:metadata>
			  <lnci:precedent>
			    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND29K0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			  </lnci:precedent>
			</lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:content>
			  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3J-X7K0-003G-30MM-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			    <request xmlns="">
			      <parameters>
				<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#111#3#000199#000315#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_321_3491"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#111#3#000199#"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="199 Wis. 2d 315"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="321"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360D50000400"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10984"/>
				<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			      </parameters>
			      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">State v. Mata</emph>, 199 Wis. 2d 315, 321, 544 N.W.2d 578 (Ct. App. 1996)</linktext>
			    </request>
			  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
			</lnci:content>
		      </lnci:cite>
		      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND22W0000400" seqnum="2"/>
		    </rfc:anchorcite>, the court of appeals concluded<ref:page num="93" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> that a persuasive argument can be made that "a tavern owner's display of a handgun may deter crime while concealment of the gun probably would not." <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote59" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n59">59</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_94" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text>The majority opinion dismisses this analysis as suspect in light of <lnci:cite ID="I494C77C0K1MND0N30000400" loadable="1" normcite="WIS. CONST. 1 25" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="42762490028" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="article" num="1">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="25"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="1_25">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="6748" value="Wis. Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:metadata>
				<lnci:precedent>
				  <lnci:editletter ID="I494C77C0K1MND1SD0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				</lnci:precedent>
			      </lnci:metadata>
			      <lnci:content>
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G3X0-004G-W34X-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6748#128#000001#000025#"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="39"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="WI Const 1,25"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360SS0000400"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="139255"/>
				      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>Article I, Section 25</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite>, <emph typestyle="un">see</emph> majority op., P72 n.32, yet nothing about the constitutional amendment changes the reasonableness or persuasiveness of the bald argument that openly displaying a handgun may deter crime while concealment probably would not.</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote></rfc:reasonforciting></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_140" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="505" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P121" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Moreover, by making it a misdemeanor to carry a concealed weapon, <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND0YK0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND29N0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360D70000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> bears a reasonable and substantial relationship to the end of promoting<ref:page num="94" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> public safety. Criminalizing conduct stigmatizes conduct and deters people from doing it, a conclusion the majority opinion agrees with as well. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote60" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n60">60</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_95" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Majority op., P56.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_141" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P122" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The second question in the present case is whether the reasonable exercise of the State's police power eviscerates the constitutional right to bear arms. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote61" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n61">61</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_96" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Majority op., P39.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> As the majority opinion explains, an otherwise reasonable exercise of police power cannot be invoked in a way that "eviscerates," "destroys," "frustrates," or "nullifies" the constitutional right to bear arms. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote62" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n62">62</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_97" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Majority op., PP40-41.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> Short of that, however, as the majority opinion further explains, the right to bear arms is not absolute and is subject to reasonable regulation. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote63" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n63">63</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_98" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Majority op., P45.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_142" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>
		  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3TT0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
		    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TT0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3TW0000400">
		      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3TW0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3VH0000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3VH0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><ref:page num="P123" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In order to determine whether a statute eviscerates<ref:page num="95" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> a constitutional right or merely reasonably regulates a constitutional right we must examine the "degree" to which the regulation frustrates the purpose of the constitutional right. <footnote>
			  <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote64" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <label alt-content="n64">64</label>

				</rfc:anchorcite> (regulation requiring people on a public street or in a public place to remove ammunition from their firearms is constitutional because it only regulates manner and does not unreasonably hinder right to bear arms); <rfc:anchorcite lni="3S3J-X7P0-003F-Y1RG-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3TW0000400" status="valid">

			</footnote> For example, in <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RWN-D590-003F-W0G4-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3TT0000400" status="valid">

			  <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND2310000400" seqnum="10"/>
			</rfc:anchorcite>, the <ref:page num="506" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
			  <globalentity:content>Washington Supreme Court</globalentity:content>
			  <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" guid:guid="urn:entity:jb-100000677" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
			</globalentity:entity> upheld a city ordinance regulating the carrying and possession <ref:page num="821" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> of "dangerous knives" in the face of a constitutional amendment granting the right to bear arms. The court reasoned that the police power was reasonably exercised to "promote public safety and good order," and that the city did not enact a "complete prohibition on possession and carrying knives" but merely "regulated the carrying, transport, and use of knives." <footnote>
			  <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote65" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <label alt-content="n65">65</label>
			  <bodytext>
			    <p>

			    </p>
			  </bodytext>
			</footnote> Therefore, the statute was constitutional. <footnote>

			  <label alt-content="n66">66</label>

					    </request>

					</lnci:content>
				      </lnci:cite>
				      <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND23C0000400" seqnum="18"/>
				    </rfc:anchorcite>, the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
				      <globalentity:content>Colorado Supreme Court</globalentity:content>
				      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" guid:guid="urn:entity:jb-100000519" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
				    </globalentity:entity> concluded that a statute making it a felony for ex-offenders to possess, use, or carry a weapon was a reasonable exercise of the State's police power despite a state constitutional right to bear arms. The Court explained: (1) the statute is a legitimate exercise of the police power; (2) the legislature cannot enact laws in the name of police powers that "render nugatory [the] Bill of Rights and other constitutional protections"; but (3) a statute that "simply limits the possession of guns and other weapons by persons who are likely to abuse such possession" does not eviscerate a constitutional protection. <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RX4-1KV0-003D-93GD-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3VV0000400" status="valid">

					  </lnci:caseref>

					</lnci:case>

					  <lnci:page num="1608"/>
					</lnci:caseref>
				      </lnci:case>
				      <lnci:metadata>
					<lnci:precedent>
					  <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2B00000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
					</lnci:precedent>
				      </lnci:metadata>
				      <lnci:content>
					<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3S3M-0100-003C-805T-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
					  <request xmlns="">
					    <parameters>
					      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#246#3#000616#000163#"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_173_4912"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#246#3#000616#"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="616 N.E.2d 163"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="173"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360TD0000400"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="9249"/>
					      <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					    </parameters>
					    <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Arnold v. Cleveland</emph>, 67 Ohio St. 3d 35, 616 N.E.2d 163, 173 (Ohio 1993)</linktext>
					  </request>
					</linktemplate:linktemplate>
				      </lnci:content>
				    </lnci:cite>
				    <rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND23F0000400" seqnum="13"/>
				  </rfc:anchorcite> (legislation survived constitutional scrutiny because the regulation achieved its goal of protecting the public by "limiting the accessibility of certain generally recognized dangerous firearms"). </rfc:reasonforciting>

			</footnote></rfc:reasonforciting>
		    </rfc:reasonforciting>
		  </rfc:reasonforciting>
		</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_143" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P124" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="97" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND1180000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2B10000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DB0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wisconsin Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> is similarly constitutional when applied to the defendant because it does not eliminate the right of an owner of a privately operated business to bear arms for security or defense but simply limits the manner in which he or she may exercise the right to bear arms. That is, <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND1190000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2B20000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DC0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>� 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> does not prevent anyone from carrying a firearm for security, defense, hunting, recreation, or other lawful purposes. <ref:page num="507" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Rather, it limits the manner of carrying weapons, by requiring that a weapon that is on a person or within a person's reach not be concealed. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote67" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n67">67</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_103" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><emph typestyle="un">See</emph> majority op., P46.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> The gist of the offense is the concealment. Thus, nothing about <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND11B0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2B30000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DD0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> comes close to eviscerating, destroying, frustrating, or nullifying the right to bear arms in <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> for the defendant here or any other person. The right to bear arms "is not impaired by requiring individuals to carry weapons openly." <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote68" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n68">68</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_104" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3W00000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3W00000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><rfc:anchorcite lni="3RX3-XP10-003F-T13C-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3W00000400" status="valid">

				  </lnci:caseref>

				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="436" value="Ariz. Adv. Rep."/>

				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:precedent>

				  </lnci:precedent>
				</lnci:metadata>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RX3-XP10-003F-T13C-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">

		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_105" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3W70000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/">
			    <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3W70000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			    <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3W90000400"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3W90000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><emph typestyle="un">See also </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3W70000400" status="valid">
				<ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3W60000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
				<lnci:cite ID="I494C77C0K1MND0N40000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND0W20000400" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">

				      <lnci:editletter ID="I494C77C0K1MND1SF0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				    </lnci:precedent>
				  </lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:content>
				    <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:4939-4WB0-0039-402S-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				      <request xmlns="">
					<parameters>
					  <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2003#000112#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2003#"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2003 WI 112"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360TJ0000400"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					  <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
					</parameters>
					<linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Cole</emph>, ___ Wis. 2d ___, P49</linktext>
				      </request>
				    </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				  </lnci:content>
				</lnci:cite>
				<rfc:anchorheadnote anchorheadnotetoken="I4F247V40K1MND23G0000400" seqnum="23"/>
			      </rfc:anchorcite> ("The right to bear arms is clearly not rendered illusory by prohibiting an individual from keeping a loaded weapon hidden either in the glove compartment or under the front seat in a vehicle."). </rfc:reasonforciting>
			  </rfc:reasonforciting>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3W90000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3W90000400_2" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The distinction between as applied and facial challenges is a difficult one to make. The distinction apparently arose in <lnci:cite ID="I494C77C0K1MND11Y0000400" loadable="1" normcite="U.S. CONST. AMEND. 1" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="11984088" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
			      <lnci:constitution>
				<lnci:constinfo>
				  <lnci:hier>
				    <lnci:hierlev label="catchword" num="amend.">
				      <lnci:hierlev label="number" num="1"/>
				    </lnci:hierlev>
				  </lnci:hier>
				</lnci:constinfo>
				<lnci:constref normcite="amend._1">
				  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="7492" value="U.S. Const."/>
				</lnci:constref>
			      </lnci:constitution>
			      <lnci:metadata>
				<lnci:precedent>
				  <lnci:editletter ID="I494C77C0K1MND1SG0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				</lnci:precedent>
			      </lnci:metadata>
			      <lnci:content popname="1">
				<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/contentstore/statutes-legislation" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				  <request xmlns="">
				    <parameters>
				      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#7492#207#        1 #"/>

				    </parameters>
				    <linktext>First Amendment</linktext>
				  </request>
				</linktemplate:linktemplate>
			      </lnci:content>
			    </lnci:cite> cases, and its usefulness in other cases has troubled courts and scholars. <emph typestyle="un">See </emph><rfc:anchorcite lni="4784-6990-0039-41XS-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3W90000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3W80000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND11W0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="30386159" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>

				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="Natwick"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND11X0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="23642" value="WI"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="125" kw="1327_2002_125*.125" page="125" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1327" volume="2002"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="2002"/>
				    <lnci:page num="125"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint num="P20"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND1220000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="111" value="Wis. 2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="19" kw="2005_257_19*.19" page="19" pagesuffix="*" reporter="2005" volume="257"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="257"/>
				    <lnci:page num="19"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND1240000400">
