				    <lnci:volume num="653"/>
				    <lnci:page num="266"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND24Y0000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4135" value="Wisc. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="2002"/>
				    <lnci:page num="1063"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:precedent>
				    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2B50000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				  </lnci:precedent>
				</lnci:metadata>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:4784-6990-0039-41XS-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#23642#2#2002#000125#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PNUM_20_3481"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="21"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#23642#2#2002#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="2002 WI 125"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="20"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360TN0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10983"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Schultz v. Natwick</emph>, 2002 WI 125, P20 n.19, 257 Wis. 2d 19, 653 N.W.2d 266</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>. </rfc:reasonforciting>
			</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_144" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="98" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P125" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The majority opinion reaches a different answer to this second question. The majority opinion concludes that prohibiting an owner of a privately operated business from carrying concealed weapons for purposes of security renders meaningless the right to bear arms. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote69" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n69">69</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_106" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Majority op., P68.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_145" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P126" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The majority opinion's contrary conclusion results from the fact that it goes beyond an examination of the degree to which the right is restricted and instead weighs the merits of the policy supporting <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND1260000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2B60000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DF0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> as a reasonable exercise of the State's police power when applied to the owner of a privately operated business. The majority opinion concludes, for <ref:page num="508" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> example, that a person is less likely to "act on impulse" or in the heat of passion "in a familiar setting in which the safety and satisfaction of customers is paramount <ref:page num="822" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> and the liability for mistake is nearly certain." <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote70" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n70">70</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_107" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Majority op., P57.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> The majority also concludes that "[a] shopkeeper is not likely to use a concealed<ref:page num="99" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> weapon to facilitate his own crime of violence in his own store." <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote71" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n71">71</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_108" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <emph typestyle="un">Id.</emph>
			</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> Finally, the majority opinion asserts that there is less need in these circumstances for innocent customers to be notified that the owner of a business possesses a weapon--anyone who enters a business premises "should presume that the owner possesses a weapon, even if the weapon is not visible." <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote72" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n72">72</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_109" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <emph typestyle="un">Id.</emph>
			</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_146" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P127" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> In short, the majority opinion engages in its own consideration of public policy and promulgates its own views of human psychology to reach its conclusion that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND1270000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2B70000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DG0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> is unconstitutional as applied to an owner of a privately operated business without the benefit of any facts or reasoned debate on the matter or giving credence to the legislature's determination of public policy or views about human psychology. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote73" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n73">73</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_110" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><emph typestyle="un">See</emph> majority op., P74 ("Requiring a storeowner to openly display weapons as the only available means of exercising the right to keep and bear arms for security is impractical, unsettling, and possibly dangerous.").</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_147" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="100" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> <ref:page num="P128" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The majority opinion's consideration of policy and psychology is in error. First, the majority's conclusions are unpersuasive. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3WJ0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3WJ0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>It seems equally plausible to argue that a person will act less rationally and more impulsively in defending his or her own privately <ref:page num="509" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> owned business (a familiar place) because the person's interest in security is so strong and the feeling of violation from any breach in that security is so great. Likewise, there is no evidence that a crime of violence is less likely for a shop owner in his own store. A shop owner who has a gun and is frightened, intimidated, or threatened is more likely to use it, and as the <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		      <globalentity:content>Wyoming Supreme Court</globalentity:content>
		      <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:judicialBranch" guid:guid="urn:entity:jb-100000029" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		    </globalentity:entity> concluded in upholding its own concealed weapon law, "it is not always necessary, <emph typestyle="un">nor is it always lawful</emph>, to use deadly force in one's own defense." <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote74" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n74">74</label>
		      <bodytext>
			<p>
			  <ref:anchor id="fnpara_111" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			  <text><rfc:anchorcite lni="3RVJ-C470-003G-J2SY-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3WJ0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3WB0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND1290000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND5400000400" normprotocol="lexsee" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="McAdams"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND1280000400" anaphref="I493DC010K1MND5410000400">
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="1238" kw="1706_714_1236*.1238" page="1236" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="714"/>
				    <lnci:pinpoint num="1238"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND27C0000400" anaphref="I493DDGK0K1MND20R0000400" exclude="1" generated="1"/>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:precedent>
				    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2B80000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				  </lnci:precedent>
				</lnci:metadata>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RVJ-C470-003G-J2SY-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000714#001236#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="PAGE_1238_4932"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000714#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="714 P.2d 1236"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:pinpoint" fixed="1238"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360TS0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="11009"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">McAdams</emph>, 714 P.2d at 1238</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			    </rfc:anchorcite> (quoting <rfc:anchorcite lni="3RVJ-C9C0-003G-J3BJ-00000-00" rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3WJ0000400" status="valid">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3WK0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND12C0000400" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="3763123" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="Garcia"/>
				      <lnci:text txt="v."/>
				      <lnci:party2 name="State"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				    <lnci:jurisinfo txt="Wyo."/>
				    <lnci:decisiondate txt="1983"/>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND12D0000400">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="499" value="P.2d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="1148" kw="1706_667_1148*.1148" page="1148" pagesuffix="*" reporter="1706" volume="667"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="667"/>
				    <lnci:page num="1148"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2500000400" exclude="1" generated="1">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="4141" value="Wyo. LEXIS"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="1983"/>
				    <lnci:page num="347"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:precedent>
				    <lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2B90000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				  </lnci:precedent>
				</lnci:metadata>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/cases/urn:contentItem:3RVJ-C9C0-003G-J3BJ-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#499#3#000667#001148#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="1"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#499#3#000667#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="667 P.2d 1148"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360TT0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="11009"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">Garcia v. State</emph>, 667 P.2d 1148 (Wyo. 1983))</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			    </rfc:anchorcite> (emphasis added).</text>
			</p>
		      </bodytext>
		    </footnote> Finally, it is equally plausible to conclude that the privately operated business is a "public place," that customers will be exposed to the danger of a concealed weapon in public places, and a business owner's right to carry a concealed weapon for security is outweighed by the needs of public safety. </rfc:reasonforciting><footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote75" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n75">75</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_112" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3WP0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3WP0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/><emph typestyle="un">See</emph> majority op., P63 (quoting Ruby B. Weeks, Annotation, <emph typestyle="un">Scope and Effect of Exception, in Statute Forbidding Carrying of Weapons, as to Person on </emph><rfc:anchorcite rfctokenref="I4F246TY0K1MND3WP0000400" status="unresolved">
			      <ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3WN0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			      <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND12H0000400" historycite="0" loadable="1" normprotocol="lexsee" ri.key="7019865" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
				<lnci:case>
				  <lnci:caseinfo>
				    <lnci:casename>
				      <lnci:party1 name="His Own Premises or at His Place of Business"/>
				    </lnci:casename>
				  </lnci:caseinfo>
				  <lnci:caseref ID="I493DDGK0K1MND12J0000400" exclude="0" generated="0">
				    <lnci:reporter normpubcode="831" value="A.L.R.3d"/>
				    <lnci:ldi jumppage="938" kw="169_57_938*.938" page="938" pagesuffix="*" reporter="169" volume="57"/>
				    <lnci:volume num="57"/>
				    <lnci:page num="938"/>
				  </lnci:caseref>
				</lnci:case>
				<lnci:metadata>
				  <lnci:precedent>
				    <lnci:editletter ID="I494C77C0K1MND1SH0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
				  </lnci:precedent>
				</lnci:metadata>
				<lnci:content>
				  <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/analytical-materials/urn:contentItem:4TST-NV50-02C9-72NN-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
				    <request xmlns="">
				      <parameters>
					<parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#831#3#000057#000938#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="11"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:kw-fallback-substring" fixed="#831#3#000057#"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="57 A.L.R.3d 938"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360TV0000400"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="338920"/>
					<parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
				      </parameters>
				      <linktext> <emph typestyle="un" xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">His Own Premises or at His Place of Business</emph>, 57 A.L.R.3d 938</linktext>
				    </request>
				  </linktemplate:linktemplate>
				</lnci:content>
			      </lnci:cite>
			    </rfc:anchorcite>, � 2(a) (1974) (recognizing the danger of a concealed weapon in place where there is contact with the public)).</rfc:reasonforciting>
			</text>
		      </p>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_113" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>The majority opinion's conclusion that everyone should presume an owner of a privately operated business is carrying a concealed weapon is also dubious in the face of the majority opinion's contrary conclusion that carrying a gun openly is unreasonable since it "would alert criminals to the presence of the weapon and frighten friends and customers." Majority op., P73. Why is it reasonable and not frightening for customers to presume that all owners of a privately operated business are carrying a concealed weapon but frightening and unreasonable to permit the owner to carry that weapon openly? </text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_148" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P129" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Second, and more importantly, the majority's dubious conclusions are irrelevant. The statute <ref:page num="510" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> is presumed constitutional and the burden on the challenger<ref:page num="102" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> is heavy. By enacting the statute the legislature has determined that public safety is advanced when owners of privately operated businesses, like all other individuals, are required to carry their guns openly. <ref:page num="823" page-scheme="4922" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Although the majority opinion has set forth counter-arguments to the legislature's determination that concealed weapons are hazardous to public safety, neither the majority opinion nor the challenger has carried the heavy burden of demonstrating that the legislative determination is unconstitutional because the degree to which it restricts the right to bear arms for owners of privately operated businesses eviscerates the constitutional right.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_149" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text>II</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_150" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P130" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> While I conclude that <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND12M0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 941.23" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="44793220023" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="941.23"/>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_941.23()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2BB0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G480-004G-W32K-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000941#    23#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 941.23"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DH0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 941.23</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> is constitutional as applied, I write further because I believe that the majority also errs when it parcels out between judge and jury the questions necessary for determining whether its newly created constitutional defense to a charge of carrying a concealed weapon is available to a defendant.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_151" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P131" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> The majority opinion concludes that a defendant who challenges a prosecution for carrying a concealed weapon on constitutional grounds will be required<ref:page num="103" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> to secure affirmative answers to two "legal questions" for the circuit court before he is entitled to raise a constitutional defense and one question of fact for the fact finder at trial before he may prevail. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote76" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n76">76</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_114" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>Majority op., P86.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> The two legal questions for the circuit court are: (1) did the defendant's interest in concealing the weapon substantially outweigh the State's interest in enforcing the <ref:page num="511" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> concealed weapons statute; and (2) was concealment the only reasonable means under the circumstances to carry the gun. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote77" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n77">77</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_115" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text>
			  <emph typestyle="un">Id.</emph>
			</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote> Then, according to the majority opinion, if the defendant receives affirmative answers to these two questions the trier of fact must determine by means of a separate verdict question whether the defendant had a lawful purpose for carrying the weapon. <footnote>
		    <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote78" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		    <label alt-content="n78">78</label>
		    <bodytext>
		      <p>
			<ref:anchor id="fnpara_116" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
			<text><emph typestyle="un">Id.</emph>, PP78, 86-87.</text>
		      </p>
		    </bodytext>
		  </footnote></text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_152" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P132" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> It is unclear to me why the questions are so divided. First, it is well established in <globalentity:entity role="urn:contentType:geography" xmlns:globalentity="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:identified-entities:global:1">
		    <globalentity:content>Wisconsin</globalentity:content>
		    <globalentity:entityReference role="urn:contentType:geography" guid:guid="urn:entity:geob-102970657" xmlns:guid="urn:x-lexisnexis:content:guid:global:1"/>
		  </globalentity:entity> law that a court commits error by refusing to give a theory of defense instruction<ref:page num="104" page-scheme="7490" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> to the jury when a defendant presents sufficient evidence in support of the defense. When deciding whether a defendant is entitled to assert a defense, a court does not weigh the evidence. It asks only whether a reasonable construction of the evidence, viewed most favorably to the defendant supports the alleged defense. A court may refuse the defendant's request for an instruction only when there is no evidence to support it.</text>
	      </p>
	      <p xmlns="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/base/1/">
		<ref:anchor id="para_153" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		<text><ref:page num="P133" page-scheme="3481" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> Moreover, in cases involving claims that a criminal prosecution impermissibly infringes upon a constitutionally protected right, it is typically the jury that determines whether the constitutional defense is available to the defendant. For example, a person is prosecuted under <lnci:cite ID="I493DDGK0K1MND12T0000400" normcite="WIS. STAT. 944.21" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="6369279" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		    <lnci:stat>
		      <lnci:statinfo>
			<lnci:hier>
			  <lnci:hierlev label="section" num="944.21">
			    <lnci:hierlev label="subsection" num="4"/>
			  </lnci:hierlev>
			</lnci:hier>
		      </lnci:statinfo>
		      <lnci:statref normcite="_944.21(4)()">
			<lnci:standardname normpubcode="6684" value="Wis. Stat."/>
		      </lnci:statref>
		    </lnci:stat>
		    <lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:precedent>
			<lnci:editletter ID="I493DDGK0K1MND2BC0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
		      </lnci:precedent>
		    </lnci:metadata>
		    <lnci:content>
		      <linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/document/statutes-legislation/urn:contentItem:55B2-G4B0-004G-W4Y9-00000-00" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			<request xmlns="">
			  <parameters>
			    <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#6684#116#000944#    21#"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:anchoridref" fixed="_4"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="5"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="Wis. Stat. � 944.21"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DJ0000400"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="contentcomponentid" fixed="10989"/>
			    <parameter style="query" name="priceplan" fixed="subscriptions"/>
			  </parameters>
			  <linktext>Wis. Stat. � 944.21(4)</linktext>
			</request>
		      </linktemplate:linktemplate>
		    </lnci:content>
		  </lnci:cite> (1995-96) for distributing obscene materials. <rfc:reasonforciting rfctoken="I4F246TY0K1MND3WS0000400" xmlns:rfc="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/legal/reason-for-citing/1/"><ref:anchor id="I4F246TY0K1MND3WS0000400" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>The statute defines obscene material to exclude materials protected by the <lnci:cite ID="I494C77C0K1MND1210000400" loadable="1" normcite="U.S. CONST. AMEND. 1" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="11984088" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:constitution>
			<lnci:constinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="catchword" num="amend.">
			      <lnci:hierlev label="number" num="1"/>
			    </lnci:hierlev>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:constref normcite="amend._1">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="7492" value="U.S. Const."/>
			</lnci:constref>
		      </lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:precedent>
			  <lnci:editletter ID="I494C77C0K1MND1SJ0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			</lnci:precedent>
		      </lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:content>
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/contentstore/statutes-legislation" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#7492#207#        1 #"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:contentclasscode" fixed="38"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="cfi:normcite" fixed="U.S. Const. AMEND. 1"/>
			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DK0000400"/>

			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>First Amendment</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite>. The court instructs the jury, defining <ref:page num="512" page-scheme="3491" page-scheme-type="reporter-series-code" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/> what is protected <lnci:cite ID="I494C77C0K1MND1200000400" loadable="1" normcite="U.S. CONST. AMEND. 1" normprotocol="lexstat" ri.key="11984088" status="valid" xmlns:lnci="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/citations/1/">
		      <lnci:constitution>
			<lnci:constinfo>
			  <lnci:hier>
			    <lnci:hierlev label="catchword" num="amend.">
			      <lnci:hierlev label="number" num="1"/>
			    </lnci:hierlev>
			  </lnci:hier>
			</lnci:constinfo>
			<lnci:constref normcite="amend._1">
			  <lnci:standardname normpubcode="7492" value="U.S. Const."/>
			</lnci:constref>
		      </lnci:constitution>
		      <lnci:metadata>
			<lnci:precedent>
			  <lnci:editletter ID="I494C77C0K1MND1SK0000400" appliedby="machine" comment="Cited in dissenting opinion at" letter="j"/>
			</lnci:precedent>
		      </lnci:metadata>
		      <lnci:content popname="1">
			<linktemplate:linktemplate rel="http://services.lexisnexis.com/shared/linkrelations/CITE-REF" href="/shared/contentstore/statutes-legislation" type="application/xhtml+xml" domain="services" xmlns:linktemplate="services.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/linktemplate/1/">
			  <request xmlns="">
			    <parameters>
			      <parameter style="query" name="CITE-REF" fixed="#7492#207#        1 #"/>

			      <parameter style="query" name="spanid" fixed="I56N5HD52N1R360DM0000400"/>

			    </parameters>
			    <linktext>First Amendment</linktext>
			  </request>
			</linktemplate:linktemplate>
		      </lnci:content>
		    </lnci:cite> free speech, and the jury decides whether the constitutional defense is available. <footnote>
		      <ref:anchor id="fn_fnote79" xmlns:ref="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/reference/1/"/>
		      <label alt-content="n79">79</label>
		      <bodytext>

Tropic of Cancer</emph>, <lnci:span CITE-REF="#111#3#000020#000134#" cfi:contentclasscode="1" cfi:kw-fallback-substring="#111#3#000020#" cfi:normcite="20 Wis. 2d 134" spanid="I56N5HD52N1R360TY0000400" xmlns:cfi="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/cite-finding-information/1/">20 Wis. 2d 134</lnci:span>, <lnci:span CITE-REF="#111#3#000020#000134#" cfi:anchoridref="PAGE_137_3491" cfi:contentclasscode="1" cfi:kw-fallback-substring="#111#3#000020#" cfi:normcite="20 Wis. 2d 134" cfi:pinpoint="137" spanid="I56N5HD52N1R360V00000400" xmlns:cfi="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/cite-finding-information/1/">137</lnci:span>, <lnci:span CITE-REF="#630#3#000121#000545#" cfi:contentclasscode="1" cfi:kw-fallback-substring="#630#3#000121#" cfi:normcite="121 N.W.2d 545" spanid="I56N5HD52N1R360V10000400" xmlns:cfi="http://www.lexisnexis.com/xmlschemas/content/shared/cite-finding-information/1/">121 N.W.2d 545</lnci:span> (1963)</lnci:content>
